The sunfilled hotel suite is homey with clutter: books, bent toys, squashed cookies, open jam jars on unmade rollaway beds. She is further attended by a babysitter, by a fawning chambermaid and by a visitor, both straining hard to hear. Across the room sits Anthony Perkins, her grinning costar, who observes the hubbub with fine detachment.

title: Tenants Shorted On Rent Deposits
description: Some landlords are still not handling tenants rent security deposits legally, the State Attorney General's office reports. A 1970 Rent Law requires landlords to set up escrow accounts for each tenant, pay the tenant the interest provided at the prevailing rate in New York State and keep 1 percent as carrying charges.

title: Thai Airline Will Buy Nine 747's And Establish a Base in Seattle
description: SEATTLE, Nov. 3 (AP)  Thai Airways International announced plans yesterday to buy nine Boeing 747's for $600 million and establish the company's United States headquarters in Seattle.

title: Minor Party Tries to Prove Itself
description: WHITE PLAINS IN its first year as an official political party, the Right to Life Party has about 90 candidates on Tuesday's ballot in Westchestermore than in any other county in the state. It just worked out that way, said Mary Jane Tobin, the party's state chairman. They worked very hard to fill the line.

title: THE AIR: UNSAFE AT ANY SITE
description: Clarence Webster gets on the train for Pelham and by chance finds himself on the smoker. He doesn't smoke, and the initial shock of the air is staggering; he rushes to the next car. The air there is better, and he's O.K. After he getshome, he jogs through his neighborhood  far from the auto congestion of Manhattan, far from heavy industry or large power plants  and the air seems fine. The breeze blowing in the window at night is refreshing, too, and at some point it occurs to him that the times when he must inhale really toxic matterare, after all, relatively few. Yet the disturbing fact is that he may be wrong. There is growing, if controversial, evidence to suggest that, not only is the air he breathes contaminated by cigarette smoke and auto fumes, not only is it hazardous at or near some industrial sites, but large portions of the entire atmosphere oversizable areas of the United States may be dangerous to human health.

title: 5 Lions and 2 Tigers Recaptured
description: GULFPORT, Miss., Nov. 3 (AP) Five lions and two tigers that escaped when their cages were splintered in a truck accident were captured by the authorities today. No injuries to humans were reported. The animals, part of theCarson and Barnes Circus from Hugo, Okla., were being taken to an afternoon show when the trailer separated from the cab on the circus truck early today.

title: Court Upholds Ban on Marijuana In Church of a Sect in Florida
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Nov. 3 (UPI)A lower court ruling banning the smoking of marijuana in the church of a Miami Beach religious sect has been upheld by the Florida Supreme Court.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: mains all but unknown in America. They are not comfortable about being compared to the better known Simon Wiesenthal. They point out that they not only document war crimes but, unlike Wiesenthal, also confront the criminals as well, often at great risk to themselves. In any case, they are certainly his successors as chief Nazihunters of the world. And since what Wiesenthal has called the biological solution to the Nazi problem inexorably takes its toll of aging criminals, Serge and Beate will also be the last of the hunters.

title: Karen Broderick Engaged to Marry Lieut. James Frye
description: Mr. and Mrs. Edward F. Broderick Jr. of Convent Station, N.J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Karen Elizabeth Broderick, to Second Lieut. James Anthony Frye, U.S.M.C., son of Mr. and Mrs. Carl W. Frye of New Vernon, N.J. An April wedding is planned.

title: Long Island/This Week
description: EAST HAMPTON  Landmarks of the East End, regional artists; 11 A.M. to 5 P.M. Fridays, Saturdays, Mondays; 11 A.M. to P.M. Sundays; through Dec. 8; Gallery East, 257 Pantigo Lane. Reception 2 to 5 P.M. today.

title: Marriage Announcement 1 -- No Title
description: Engagements

title: John Bevan, Karen Nielsen Set Wedding
description: Mr. and Mrs. Louis B. Nielsen of Honesdale and Wangaum Falls, Pa., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Karen Melanie Nielsen, to John Stuart Bevan, son of Mr. and Mrs. John A. Bevan of West Hartford, Conn

title: A Draw Is a Win
description: ALMOST from the moment the first atomic bomb was dropped in anger on Hiroshima, people have dreamed of chaining Prometheus once again, of teaching him to put aside the bomb. But gradually Prometheus was transformed into Dr.

title: Trapped In a World Full of Cars
description: IF there's anything more shocking than facing your own mortality, it's realizing your car's mortality. If you go, that's itbut if the car dies, you've still got to get around.

title: SPORTS TODAY
description: BASKETBALL

title: Pipe Bomb Is Detonated At East Side Apartment
description: A small pipe bomb was set off in a luxury apartment building on the Upper East Side of Manhattan early yesterday, damaging light fixtures and carpeting in a secondfloor hallway, according to the police.

title: Questions/Answers
description: Each year we have a problem with chrysanthemums. Our winters are cold

title: The Coming Battle Is Political For S. Korea's Anxious Army
description: SEOUL, Korea  The assassination of President Park Chung Hee just over a week ago thrusts into the limelight Korea's most important political institution  the 500,000man army.

title: Too Tall Gains Split Decision
description: LAS CRUCES, N.M., Nov. 3  Ed (Too Tall) Jones had hoped for a different sort of fight in his boxing debut. He had hoped for a fight where his opponent came to him, a brawl in which a 6foot9inch former football player with an 88inch reach could dominate a more experienced adversary in a 16foot ring.

title: VOTEBUYING TRIAL ENDS IN ACQUITTALS
description: LAKE CHARLES, La., Nov. 3 (AP) Representative Claude Leach and his law partner, Edwin Cabra, were acquitted by a Federal jury today of buying votes in the Louisiana Democrat's 1978 election, which he won narrowly.

title: Shooting Erupts in Bolivian Capital As Army Support for Coup Falters
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Sunday, Nov. 4 Heavy shooting erupted throughout the capital last night amid growing signs that military support for Col. Alberto Natusch Busch, leader of Thursday's coup, was breaking down.

title: Inquiry Finds Tangled Plot to Free Planes for Libya
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 31  Eight giant Lockheed C130 Hercules airplanes with longrange fuel tanks, desert camouflage and Libyan Air Force markings have been sitting on the tarmac in Marietta, Ga., since the Libyan Government paid $60 million for them in 1973.

title: Future Events
description: Nov. 7 Forget about running all over New York in search of the ultimate gift. Go instead to the American Cancer Society's Holiday Shopping Spree, in which 30 of the city's chicest merchants are participating. Some, like T. Anthony, Porthault, Gucci and Alexander Shields will set up booths at city division headquarters, 19 West 56th Street. Others, among them, Kron Chocolatier, Ben Kahn Furs, F.A.O. Schwarz and Miss Grimble, have arranged to donate a certain percentage of your purchases to the cause. Contact the society for particulars of this plan. Admission of $10 to opening from 6:30 P.M. to 8:30 P.M. entitles you to cocktails, a fashion show with the likes of Cristina Ferrare DeLorean, Georgiana Bronfman and Barbara de Portago as models and, of course, to spend as much as you like. Two hours not enough? Return Nov. 8 any time between 10 A.M. and 6 P.M. free of charge. The spree benefits the society's research, educational and patientcare program.

title: DINING OUT An Authentic Gran Ristorante
description: HERACLITUS should have been taken to dinner at Mona Tratoria. No doubt the Greek philosopher was right that all things change, and in some way or other Mona's must be changing too, but he could not fail to be impressed by the persistence of Mona's excellence, asthough the law of ruin in the world had been suspended for a few years in Croton Falls. Recognized from the moment of its opening for the purity and beauty of its Bolognese dishes, it remains at ease among the summits of Westchester's restaurants.

title: Westchester/This Week
description: BALDWIN PLACE  Side by Side, musical by Stephen Sondheim, starring Patric lozzo and Dennis Angulo. Today 2 P.M. $5.50, discount available for students, the elderly and groups. Reservations. Mahopac Farm Playhouse, junction of Rtes. 6 and 118. 6281169. ELMSFORD  Same Time, Next Year, starring Betsy Palmer. Daily, except Mondays. Through Nov. 25. Ricchiardi's Chamber of Horrors and Illusions, magic show. Tomorrow. Opens 6:15 P.M., buffet at 7, show at 8:30 . Sundays one hour earlier. $18.15 to $20.35. Reservations. An Evening Dinner Theater, 11 Clearbrook Rd. 5922222. NEW ROCHELLE  Good News, musical comedy performed by Props n Paint. Thursday to Saturday 8 P.M., next Sunday 2 P.M. Through Nov. 17. $3, students and the elderly $2. Little Theater in Xavier Hall, College of New Rochelle, Castle PI, and Elm St. 6325300.

title: Religion
description: California; St. Cuthbert's portion was returned last week.) And scientists studying the Shroud of Turin, the linen cloth that many people believe to be the 2,000yearold burial cloth of Jesus Christ, recently reported that their tests neither verified nor dismissed its authenticity. Empirically speaking, the status of the potentially most valuable Christian relic thus remained ambiguous, but the inconclusiveness of the scientists report was expected to intensify interest in the shroud.

title: Healy Sparks Farrell Victory
description: Ed Healy ran his string of victories to six and led Monsignor Farrell the team title yesterday in the Catholic High Schools Athletic Association New York sectional crosscountry championships at Van Cortlandt Park.

title: School Teaches Use Of Guide Dogs
description: FOR the last 25 years, Guiding Eyes for the Blind and its dogs have helped the sightless from around the country to see through its training program in Westchester County.

title: Youth Found Hanged In Empty Nyack House
description: The badly decomposed body of a 15yearold Rockland County youth was found hanging from a rafter in a vacant house on Route 9W in Nyack on Friday by police officers responding to an anonymous telephone call.

title: Westchester Votes on Public Energy
description: With the election two days away, neither supporters nor opponents of Westchester County's Proposition 1, the referendum that would lay the groundwork for the county to get into the electrical power business, are ready to claim victory in advance. But neither side has conceded defeat either.

title: Race Issue Minimized in Boston Mayoral Campaign
description: BOSTON, Nov. 2  The racial tensions that have repeatedly boiled over into violence and turmoil here this fall and throughout the 1970's will provide the backdrop for Tuesday's nonpartisan mayoral elections in Boston, but center stage will once again be occupied by the personality contest between Mayor Kevin H. White and his perennial opponent, State Senator Joseph F. Timilty.

title: THE LIVELY ARTS These Thespians Travel
description: HICKSVILLE  Atroupe of strolling players are we. The lyric is from Cole Porter's Kiss Me, Kate, and it could well have been written with the new band of enterprising actors collectively called Theater East in mind. The traveling thespiansare available to schools, libraries, centers for the elderly and community groups in Nassau County  they seem to make everything but house callsand they do it all for free. The Cultural and Performing Arts Division and the Town of Oyster Bay CETA Program are sustaining them, at least through March.

title: NATO Forces: Criticism Gains New Urgency
description: In NATO's 31st year, criticisms of its military inadequacies, the present strategy or lack of it for defending Europe and the imbalance between the overall United States contribution and that of the European partners are growing in volume and severity.

title: Election Law Now a Factor To Scotto and Many Others
description: On the first page of the New York State election law appears the following paragraph: Definitions. The terms used in this chapter shall have the signification herein defined unless other meaning is clearly apparent in language or context....

title: Like a Korda Film
description: WHEN the British Lion film company collapsed in the early 1950's and Sir Alexander Korda  the man most responsible for the creation of the British film industry itself  resigned as chief of production, he was asked who might replace him. IL isn't easy, he said. You see, I don't grow on trees. In a profession that flourished on individuality, Alexander Korda was unique, a characteror sucn charismatic presence, wit and opulence that he awed famous friends as well as his favorite nephew, Michael Korda. Early in his immensely readable chronicle of his family, Michael Korda confesses, I longed to be like him in every respect.

title: U.S. TIE WITH SEOUL STRESSED BY VANCE
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 3  Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance met here today with the men governing South Korea in the wake of the assassination of President Park Chung Hee, reaffirmed American commitments to the peace and security of the republic and cautiously discussed the direction the country will take politically.

title: New Jersey/ This Week
description: The Diary of Lou Jacobi, a oneman show starring the actor. Saturday, 8:30 P.M. $8.50; students, $6.75. (201) 7363200.

title: New EnergySaving Rules Are Generating Plenty of Heat
description: Construction of some commercial buildings has slowed down in Connecticut because many building inspectors won't grant permits for electrical installations. They won't grant the permits because they themselves don't understand the state's new Model Code for Energy Conservationin New Building Construction. State officials hope that after all 350 inspectors complete a 13week cram course this fall the difficulty will diminish. But if the confusion clears it may not be for long: The Federal Government is expected to announce this month a mandatory energy construction code that is many times more complicated than the code now in force.

title: A DREAM IN NIGERIA: PAVED LAGOS STREET; Citizens of Richest Black Country in Africa Protest the Lack of Services and Opportunity; How Soon the Future?; New Lease on Life; Potholes and Puddles
description: LAGOS, Nigeria  Kugbuyi Street, with its formidable canyons masquerading as potholes, is the sort of street to be found in every neighborhood of this city, and building No. 4, a decaying threestory brick structure, is the sort found on almost every street in Lagos. Fourteen families live in this building, and one of the households belongs to 26yearold Tokunboh D. Oladeinde.

title: Strontium 90 Found in 4 Wells
description: MANORVILLE BROOKHAVEN National Laboratory, in tests performed in conjunction with the Suffolk County Department of Public Health, has found low levels of the radioactive substance strontium 90 in four privately owned wells here, near the laboratory's foundry. The level ofstrontium 90 was within the United States Environmental Protection Agency's standard for drinking water.

title: Kent Tripped on Path to Title
description: A funny thing happened to Kent yesterday on its way to a title in the Erickson League. It was upset and shut out by Hotchkiss, a traditional rival. 130.

title: Realty News
description: National Economic Research Associates and the John Hancock Mutual Life Insurance Company have leased space in the World Trade Center.

title: Sam Spade As Candide
description: PITY the poor reporter who tries, as Michael Wolff has in his first book, to get a grip on our day and age. The 1970's have very nearly escaped the epitomizing tag that Americans ritually attach to spans of 10 years. Only one  Tom Wolfe's The Me Decade  has gained much currency. Yetone suspects that this label has been widely accepted Dot so much because it fits as out of desperation: any bill of goods is better than none. After all, the buttoneddown 50's ware followed by the tumultuous 60's, and how can you have a decade without an adjective?

title: Free Calendar Given By House to Continue
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 (AP)  Despite a vote restricting the practice, each House member will be able to distribute 2,500 free wall calendars to friends and favored constituents this December as usual, at a cost to the taxpayers of $1 million.

title: Mr. Weidenbaum Answers His Critics
description: I plead guilty. Yes, I have tried to put a price tag on the large array of requirements that Government regulators impose on the American economy, costs that ultimately are borne by consumers. Citizens are concerned about the full range of costs imposed by Government just as they want to know thesize of their direct tax burden. I also have urged Government agencies to make sure, before promulgating new regulations, that the benefits to the nation from those actions exceed the costs. But that hardly explains why my research has unleased such excesses of vituperation on the part of Nader's Raiders.

title: Regions Don't Grow Old
description: There is a great deal of concern these days over the perceived decline of manufacturing in the Northeast. The analysis of this trend is often phrased in terms of older regions versus newer regions, or Frost Belt versus Sun Belt. Older regions have outdatedequipment, it is said, or the workers in older regions are too highly paid and too unionized. These traditional explanations do not really tell us much about the decline of the Northeast.

title: New Band Sound Mixes Jazz and Funk Rhythms
description: FREEPORT AFTER playing guitar for seven years with three of the most popular local rock bands, Mike Nugent has formed his own group to showcase the style of music in which he is most comfortable  a largely instrumental mix of jazz and funk that he calls sophisticated rhythm and blues.

title: CONNECTICUT HOUSING Houses for $1 in New Haven
description: NEW HAVEN FOR as long as she can remember, Gail Lee said, she has lived with three things against her when it came to finding a decent place to live. She was black, she was a woman on her own, and she had children. Thus the pattern of her days became that of an itinerant tenant grabbing whatever she could.

title: Symphony: National's Mahler 7th
description: The National Symphony's first Carnegie Hall concert this season was cancelled four weeks ago after rains prevented the arrival at New York airports of half the orchestra. The second  i.e., the first  Friday night was, in a curious way, equally unlucky, even the audience responded with cheers.

title: Wood, Field and Stream Bluefish Replace Striped Bass
description: MARTHA'S VINEYARD, Mass. One of the happiest hunting and fishing rituals is responding in kind to someone who has introduced you to the pleasures of field and stream in his region.

title: New Zealand Mother Wins Marathon at Los Angeles
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 3 (AP) Beverly Shingles, a 39yearold mother of two from New Zealand, won the first Los Angeles women's marathon today. She completed the 26mile385yard course in 2 hours 45 minutes 46 seconds.

title: Columbia Set Back By Dartmouth, 170
description: Dave Shula and Jeff Kemp, whose last names are familiar in football, led Dartmouth to a 170 Ivy League victory over Columbia at Baker Field yesterday.HONOLULU, Nov. 3 (UPI)  Ron Fariovanti of Temple kicked a 32yard field goal with 23 seconds remaining, and Mark Bright rushed for three touchdowns as the Owls defeated the University of Hawaii, 3431, today.

title: LETTER TO THE WESTCHESTER EDITOR
description: I read with mounting dismay the story County Study Shows Housing Lack in 80's (Oct. 14) and the subliminal conclusions contained the Westchester County Department of Planning's population projection for the year 2000.

title: ABOUT LONG ISLAND
description: NORTHPORT LOU and Evelyn Amster have seen the farms in western Suffolk County disappear in the 33 years that they have been married, and they count their blessings that they have been able to resist taking that course themselves.

title: HOME CLINIC Saving WaterHeating Energy
description: SINCE water heaters are second only to home heating systems as the largest user of energy in most homes in this area, anything that can be done to cut down on the energy a water heater consumes is usually worth looking into. There areactually three steps that can be taken to lower the cost of providing hot water:

title: Try Scotch Captures $200,000 Levy Pace
description: WESTBURY, L.I. Nov. 3  Except for one brief moment near the quartermile pole, Try Scotch, a 5year old gelding driven by Shelly Goudreau, was the leader all the way in the $200,000 George Morton Levy Pace at Roosevelt Raceway tonight, finishing in the track recordtying time of 1 minute 56 3/5 seconds.

title: Down by the Old Mill Stream, a New Day
description: GURLEYVILLE  FARMERS from all the neighboring communities would bring their corn and buckwheat to be ground, said Adolph Douda, standing next to the now silent machinery of the GurleyvilleGrist Mill. My brother and I ran these machines every day after school. And how we hated it! In winter our friends would skate on the mill pond, and the girls would call Come on out, boys! and we had to stay in and grind corn. It really spoiled our day.

title: Patricia Burns Affianced To William S. Molloy Jr.
description: Mr. and Mrs. William G. Burns of Ridgewood, N.J., have made known the engagment of their daughter, Patricia Marie Burns, to William S. Molloy Jr., son of Mrs. Molloy, also of Ridgewood, and the late Mr. Molloy. A wedding is planned for May.

title: Meeting the People: A Visit by Mrs. Carter
description: NEWPORT, N.H. (UPI)  Ida Dutilley looked through the front window of the antique store and frowned. It was 11 A.M., and it was still raining.

title: My Retarded Sister Is a Teacher
description: MY earliest memory of my sister is of a very young child, sitting in a stroller, reaching out her arms to hug me. She wasn't able to talk yet, but I was two years older and interpretedher coos and cries for the rest of the world. Most often what she wanted was to be loved, and I would run over and wrap my arms around her.

title: Violin: Albert Markov at Carnegie Hall
description: Albert Markov, who gave a violin recital last Sunday night at Carnegie Hall, is among the more prominent of the Russian musicians who have recently flocked to the West. He won a gold medal at the Oueen Elisabeth ofthe Belgians Competition in 1959, and said to have appeared widely in the Soviet Union. Since arriving in the United States in 1975, he has played with the Baltimore, Houston, and Pittsburgh Symphonies, among others.

title: Late Toss Tops Cornell, 2320
description: ITHACA, N.Y., Nov. 3  Yale became today the first college football team to win 700 games, but it took tipped pass and a rally in the closing minutes to do it. John Rogan's 12yard touchdown pass capped the winning drive in a 2320 victory over Cornell.

title: STAGE VIEW
description: What a nutty form musical comedy is! It can be nutty in two ways (to say the least). It can, for instance, pretend to be telling a perfectly straightforward, lifelike story, even though characters who aren't supposed to be singers and dancers are reaching for high notes and high kicks practically all of the time. And it can reverse years, wink at the audience, and openly confess that the whole thing's ajolly fraud, sheer artifice from overture to exitmarch. Annie, let's say, wants you to believe  temporarily and insanely  in its Depressionbred moppet who makes it to a mansion by Christmastime. Even though it includes among its personnel a jauntily mythic figure with a clarion voice called F.D.R., it stays resolutely within its own frame. I Love My Wife, however, broke the frame for openers. The musicians got out of the pit and onto the stage, where they split up into twos and threes and tootled advice to the actors as needed. Arbitrary, and just as much fun. A writer, then, can play it anyway he chooses.

title: World News Briefs
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Nov. 3 (Reuters) Kurdish rebel leaders have ordered their forces to stop fighting while peace negotiations with the Government are under way, Kurdish sources said today.

title: CRIME
description: For some years now Joseph Hansen has been fleshing out the West Coast privateeye style with his Dave Brandstetter series, beginning with Fadeout in 1970. Brandstetter is an investigator for an insurance company, but he operates as any private eye does. In addition, Brandstetter is a homosexual with a rich, eccentric and domineering father. The author does not make a big thing out of Brandstetter's sexual habits. His affairs are treated as simply as the heterosexual affairs of other investigators. Though there is plenty of action in the four books up to now, the series is surprisingly lowkey. However, the plotting is very good, the dialogue is natural and the various characters ring true. Mr. Hansen is one of the best writers in his field.

title: To Hear Stateless Nations
description: DUMONT, N.J.  Andrew Young made many moot statements in his public career, but one point, to me, deserved special attention. He said that the Palestinians were a force in the world and that regardless of one's views, that force could not be ignored.

title: Trial to Resume Today For Nuclear Protester Arrested at Plant Site
description: The trial of a protester charged with trespassing at the construction site of a nuclear power plant at Shoreham, L.I., during a demonstration in June is to resume in Hauppauge today, with the defense planning to argue that the trespassing was legally justified and that the Long Island Lighting Company had participated in it through implied invitation and provocation.

title: Theater District to Get A Museum All Its Own
description: IF all goes according to plan, Broadway will be showing off something new next spring  a theater museum in the theater district. It will occupy space in the Minskoff Building, just opposite the Minskoff Theater box office, in the streetlevel arcade that runs from 44th Street to 45th Street.

title: Greek Ship Sinks Off England
description: SOUTHAMPTON, England, Nov. 4 (Reuters)  A Greek freighter carrying chemicals sank in the English Channel today 24 hours after colliding with a West German cargo ship, the Coast Guard said. The 6,540ton Aeolian Sky sank 10miles on tne Englisn coast wnile Unaer tow to the Isle of Wight. The crew had been taken off by helicopter yesterday.

title: U.N. Official Heads for Cambodia
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 4 (Reuters)  The director of the United Nations Children's Fund, Henry Labouisse, left here today for the Cambodian capital of Phnom Penh to inspect the distribution of aid donated by his organization.

title: TEHERAN STUDENTS SEIZE U.S. EMBASSY AND HOLD HOSTAGES
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Nov. 4  Moslem students stormed the United States Embassy in Teheran today, seized about 90 Americans and vowed to stay there until the deposed Shah was sent back from New York to face trial in Iran.

title: Reporter's Notebook: Empty Chair Stirs Curiosity at Park's Funeral Services in Seoul
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 4  It was 6:22 on Saturday morning, the day of the state funeral of President Park Chung Hee. The time showed on a large clock on the Seoul City Hall. And just below the luminous face of the clockwas a large portrait of the assassinated leader, dressed in a blue suit, staring into the middle distance, his face lined in a realistic manner.

title: Private U.S. Panel Recommends Informal Contacts With the P.L.O.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4  A panel of prominent Americans has recommended that the United States modify its policies and have informal contacts with the Palestine Liberation Organization as a way of influencing Palestinian views.

title: The Air Came Out of My Body
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J. MAYBE it's just as well. Maybe if the Giants had held on against the Dallas Cowboys yesterday, they would have been put on a pedestal that they don't deserve to be on. Not yet, anyway. Despite their recent fourgame winning streak, despite the emergence Phil Simms as a rookie quarterback with talent and poise, the Giants really are not as good as their loyalists, frustrated for so long, want them to be. If the Giants had won yesterday, they would have created a level of accomplishment that they were not prepared to maintain this season. But when they lost, 1614, on a 22yard field goal by Rafael Septien with three seconds remaining, their loyalists accepted reality. So did the players, reluctantly.

title: Transit Bond Key Issue in New York  Jersey to Pick New Assembly
description: New York State's political, business and labor organizations planned to make a last minute push today for passage of a $500 million transportation bond issue.

title: Islanders Are Held To 44 Tie by Jets
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba, Nov. 4 (UPI)  Peter Sullivan scored on a breakaway with four minutes remaining to give Winnipeg a 44 tie with the New York Islanders tonight. The victory extended the Jets unbeaten streak to five games.

title: It's Rank vs. File in a Rift Dividing Stamford Police
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Nov. 2  The Chief who was brought in two years ago to reorganize the Stamford Police Department in the wake of allegations of extensive corruption is locked in a tense dispute with his 210member force.

title: Lebanese Clan Presses Fight With Other Christian Faction
description: ZGHARTA, Lebanon, Nov. 3  The family, Suleiman Franjieh was saying, will exact its retribution.

title: Advertising
description: THE word from nervous Detroit is that the five major advertising media expect to fare well enough. The City generates some $400 million in automotive advertising, according to Leading National Advertisers.

title: Sporting Gear
description: For cyclists who can't keep out of the rain, a new line of apparel called Thunderwear is useful. It consists of a twopiece outfit made of the breathable fabric, GoreTex, and includes a seamsealing kit. The top has a drawstring waist as well as an extralong tail to keep out spray. Wrist closures are made with Velcro fasteners and elastic closures are elastic. The drawstring hood affords good peripheral vision. The pants have an elastic waistband and passthrough pockets. The top costs $73.50 and the pants $50. The manufacturer, Sojourn Designs, 2300 Central Avenue, Boulder, Colo. 80301, (303) 4434690, has a list of the nearest outlets.

title: Chess:
description: It is easy to become disturbed by your opponent's time pressure and to relax your vigilance. There is a temptation to play any old move quickly to force a hurried replywith any luck, a blunder.

title: Ring Career of Too Tall Jones
description: JONES still doesn't know where he is, the voice television said as Too Tall Jones floundered about the ring on legs like licorice whips. The same could have been said of the referee.

title: Lucey Endorses Kennedy
description: MADISON, Wis., Nov. 4 (UPI)  Patrick J. Lucey, who resigned recently as Ambassador to Mexico, said today that he was endorsing Senator Edward M. Kennedy, Democrat of Massachusetts, for President in 1980. Mr. Lucey said in a statement that he would go to Washington to offer his services to Mr. Kennedy.

title: Market Place What Next for Bond Prices?
description: THE bond market has been a ruin ever since the Federal Reserve Board announced a threepart program to stem inflation on Oct. 6.

title: Slump Now Expected to Hit in 1980
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4  Most economic forecasters now expect a more substantial recession than had previously been predicted for next year, when President Carter will be struggling with reelection.

title: Milwaukee Road: Carter Signs Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (AP)  President Carter signed legislation today providing millions of dollars in emergency aid to the financially ailing Chicago, Milwaukee, St. Paul & Pacific Railroad.

title: Nobel Prize Economist Criticizes Government
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 4  Unimpressed by the attention he has been getting, Theodore W. Schultz, recent cowinner of the Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Science, was working as usual the other day, hunched over a desk littered with working papers and surrounded by stacks of the books and articles of his profession.

title: Notes on People
description: The same man whose silence set him apart from all of the other key figures in the Watergate scandal is now following the others lead by attempting to cash in on his notoriety. G. Gordon Liddy, who refused to pleabargain with prosecutors and served 52 months in prison, more time than anyone else convicted of crimes connected to Watergate, has written a first novel, and he has taken to the talkshow circuit to promote it.

title: Two Studies Indicate That Jailing Is Only Course for Some Youths
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (UPI)  Group h. omes for juvenile delinquents are on the increase, but locking up chronic offend ers in traditional reform schools still is the most effective deterrent in some cases, two studies indicate.

title: De Gustibus Turning the Tables On a Primitive Predator
description: I have often been asked whether or not shark is edible. The answer is quite definitely yes, and one of the best seafood dishes I've ever sampled was a platter of mako shark prepared teriyakistyle and cooked over a charcoal fire by my friend Shizuo Tsuji, the distinguished head of the Tsuji Hotel School in Osaka, Japan.

title: Senator Baker Draws Distinction Between Losing and Not Winning
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (AP)  Howard H. Baker Jr. said today that he did not lose Saturday's straw vote in Maine on the 1980 Republican Presidential nomination. He said he just didn't win.

title: Laura Goodman Bride of Elliot Richman, Science Writer
description: Laura Karen Goodman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Bernard J. Goodman of Merrick, L.I., was married yesterday to Elliot Richman, son of Dr. Michael J. Richman of Teaneck. N.J.. and thelate Harriet Gold Richman. Rabbi David M. Posner performed the ceremony in his study at Temple EmanuEl.

title: Washington Watch
description: WASHINGTON CONGRESS is now expected to authorize interestbearing checking accounts and at the same time to permit lending institutions to override state usury laws, a measure designed to continue the availability of mortgage money.

title: Two 6 Vehicle Crashes In Dust Storm Hurt 29
description: BAKERSFIELD, Calif., Nov. 4 (UPI)  Two sixvehicle accidents in a blinding dust storm injured 29 persons yesterday, the California Highway Patrol said. Two of the vehicles in the first accident were Greyhound buses.

title: Space Shuttle's Delays Facing Carter Review
description: The manned space shuttle is months behind schedule. Its costs are overrunning estimates. Its management has been juggled. A plague of technical problems has postponed its first orbital test flight until next summer, if not later.

title: Gambling as a Disorder
description: Maryland recently opened the first statesponsored center for the treatment of compulsive gamblers. And on Jan. 1, the diagnostic manual of the American Psychiatric Association will add pathological gambling to its list of mental disorders. There is,no doubt, good reason for both developments. Uncontrollable gambling can wreck lives and families, and perhaps professionals can help. But the new focus on problem gamblers is sad news as well: it suggests that the spread of gambling, presumably including legalized gambling, is taking a heavy toll.

title: Weekly Lotto Numbers Drawn
description: The numbers picked Saturday night in New York State's weekly Lotto drawing were 1, 4, 39, 33, 25 and 22. The supplementary number was 11.

title: PROPOSED CHARTER FOR F.B.I. CRITICIZED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (UPI)  The proposed charter for the Federal Bureau of Investigation fails to ban the bureau's criticized political surveillance and counterintelligence activities, despite recommendations for such prohibitions by every major study of the F.B.I., the Center for National Security Studies said today.

title: Obituary 2  No Title
description: Deaths

title: Dance: Echoes of Africa
description: SATURDAY night's dance attraction at the Theater of the Riverside Church was the JeanLon Destin AfroHaitian Dance Company, and Mr. Destine called his program Echoes of Africa. But took a choreographic look at more thanAfrica and Haiti. There were dances from the entire Caribbean region. Nevertheless, that title remained appropriate, for Mr. Destin attempted to show how cultural echoes of Africa can be found in the dances of blacks throughout the New World.

title: 7 Inmates Hurt in Melee At Green Haven Prison
description: STORMVILLE, N.Y., Nov. 4 (AP)  A disturbance involving more than 100 inmates in a recreational yard of the Green Haven State Correctional Facility this afternoon sent two inmates to a hospital with knife wounds and five others to the prison infirmary with less serious injuries.

title: Radio
description: 78 A.M., WNCN. Partita in F, finale, Albrechtsberger; Valse Oubliee No. 1, Liszt; Variations on a Theme of Paganini, Lutoslawksi ; Prince Igor, excerpt, Borodin; Adagio in G minor., Cramer.

title: Article 1  No Title
Israeli Assailed for Idea on P.L.O.
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 4  Israeli officials today repudiated a statement by the chief Israeli representative in the West Bank and Gaza autonomy negotiations, who said that the Palestine Liberation Organization under some circumstances could become a negotiating partner on issues affecting Palestinians.

title: Dr. Rutstein Weds Beverly Bennett
description: Beverly Bennett, director of development services at Harvard University, and Dr. David D. Rutstein, Ridley Watts Professor of Preventive Medicine Emeritus at the Harvard MedicalSchool, were married yesterday at the bridegroom's home in Cambridge, Mass. Justice of the Peace Robert Shell performed the ceremony.

title: German Budget Deficit
description: BONN, Nov. 4 (Reuters)  The West German Federal budget deficit for the first three quarters of this year was 813.2 billion, little changed. from the same 1978 period, the Finance Ministry said.

title: 8 Major Colleges Unbeaten, Untied
description: Eight major college teams remained undefeated and untied Saturday, an unusually high number of Division IA teams with perfect records this late in a season. The teams and their victories are: Ohio State and McNeese State. 9;Aianama, Brigham Young, Florida State, Houston and Nebraska, 8, and Yale, 7.

title: Dividend Meetings
description: Partial list of scheduled meetings for week follows:

title: Gen. Hugh Harris Dies
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (AP)  Gen. Hugh P. Harris, retired, a former commmanding general of the United States Continental Army, died yesterday at the Walter Reed Army Medical Center. He was 70 years old.

title: BRZEZINSKI SEEKING STRONGER INFLUENCE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4  Zbigniew Brzezinski, President Carter's national security adviser, is reshaping his staff in what White House aides describe as an effort to strengthen his authority over the State Department and the Pentagon.

title: Solomon Is Victor
description: PARIS, Nov. 4 (AP)  Harold Solomon won the $50,000 Paris open tennis tournament today by defeating Corrado Barazzutti, Italy's topranked Waver. 63. 26. 63. 64.

title: IRANIANS IN PROTEST AT LIBERTY STATUE
description: A small band of Iranian students chained themselves to railings inside the Statue of Liberty for three hours yesterday afternoon and unfurled a huge banner from the monument's crown demanding that the deposed Shah of Iran be returned to his homeland to be tried and punished.

title: Dollar Off in Tokyo
description: TOKYO, Monday. Nov. 5 (AP)  The dollar declined against the Japanese yen this morning, opening at 235.30 yen on the Tokyo foreignexchange market and holding in the 235.70to235.90 range. It closed Friday at 236.55 yen.

title: MEXICO'S BIRTH RATE SEEMS OFF SHARPLY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4  American census experts have detected what they believe is a dramatic drop in the birth rate in Mexico over the last four years.

title: The Editorial Notebook Frail Sociology
description: The Surgeon General should consider labeling all sociological studies: Keep out of reach of politicians and judges. Indiscriminate use of these suggestive works can be dangerous to the nation's health.

title: The U.N. Today
Obituary 3  No Title
description: Deaths

title: TV: Going Places Travels the U.S.
description: PRODUCED by CBS News, Going Places is obviously designed to be a kind of On the Road for young people. But the pilot, which can be seen tomorrow afternoon at 4, has to cope with several flat tires.

title: Satellite Photograph
Dr. Marie P. Warner, 84, Family Planning Leader
description: Dr. Marie Pichel Warner, a Manhattan specialist in family planning, died Saturday at Mt. Sinai Hospital. She was 84 years old.

title: Bolivia Ruler Decrees Martial Law, Sends Jets Against Demonstrators
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Nov.4  Bolivia's new military regime stepped up efforts today to impose its authority on the country, declaring martial law and censorship and using planes and tanks in an attempt to disperse opponents.

title: Article 2  No Title
Reactor Faces a Different Kind of Fight
description: SKAGIT, Wash., Nov. 1  Sophie Neble, an amiable 72yearold farm operator, gazed across at a miledistant hilltop, the site of a proposed nuclear power plant, and exclaimed in the accents of her native Pennsylvania Dutch country:

title: Nets Hold Off Kings, 10198
description: PISCATAWAY, N.J., Nov. 4  The New Jersey Nets finally won a tight game down the stretch tonight, defeating the Kansas City Kings, 10198. The final score, however, was not truly indicative of how precariously they had perched on the edge of another close loss.

title: Flyers 3, Sabres 1
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 4 (AP) Ken Linseman's secondperiod powerplay goal broke a 11 tie and the Philadelphia Flyers went on to a 31 National Hockey League victory over the Buffalo Sabres tonight.

title: Should the F.T.C. Be Reined?; ISSUE AND DEBATE The Background OPPOSITION SUPPORT Should the F.T.C. Be Reined? Against the Commission For the Commission The Outlook
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4  It seems always to be a step out of sync with the mood of the nation.

title: George Holton, 58, Dies On a Photo Job in China
description: George Holton, a freelance photographer, died Saturday morning while on assignment in China. He was 58 years old and lived in New York City.

title: Rangers Happy to Have Sir Bubba on Their Side
description: VANCOUVER, BRITISH COLUMBIA THERE was an introduction to be made. When the New York Rangers gathered around their assistant coach, Mike Nykoluk, at practice in Denver Saturday, Nykoluk looked at his newest player.

title: Bayside Advances In P.S.A.L. Playoff
description: Bayside emerged yesterday as the team to beat in Division I of the Public Schools Athletic League's city playoffs. Led by Jamie Covington, its allpurpose back, Bayside scored a 368 victory over Lafayette, and will meet Port Richmond in the semifinals.

title: Hopes Are Concentrated on 2 Governorships and Several Mayoral Races
description: Republicans will try to use scattered elections around the country tomorrow to gain political leverage for the Presidential race next year. Their hopes are concentrated on governorships in Mississippi and Kentucky, the Legislature in New Jersey and mayoralties in Cleveland, Philadelphia and several other major cities.

title: Rohatyn Urging State to Increase Tax on Gasoline
description: The chairman of the Municipal Assistance Corporation, Felix G. Rohatyn, called yesterday for an increase in the state tax on gasoline to pay for the Legislature's program to aid people with their heatina fuel bills this winter.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Vertebrae, Rocks and Some Dashed Hopes
description: Elizabeth Hurd and her 6yearold son, Brian, were filled with hope. They drove 50 miles from Warwick, N.Y., to New York City yesterday afternoon, waited in line for 15 minutes and now was their turn to have a curator at theAmerican Museum of Natural History tell them what animal had formed the fossil they found on a ranch in Utah.

title: Opera: Birgit Nilsson Returns to the Metropolitan
description: FOR people who save historic program books, this was a big one for the collection. Birgit Nilsson, this generation's premiere Wagnerian soprano, returned to the Metropolitan Opera House last night after an absence of nearly fiveyears and served notice that she was not ready to give up her title. There were queestions raised about that in advance, and not unnaturally, since the Swedish diva is now 61 years old. But when she was finished with Brnnhilde's Immolation Scene, the center piece of this Gala Benefit Concert, the audience let loose one of those roars of approval that only great performances elicit. It began as a kind of suppressed growl and broke out in waves of almost frightening intensity.

title: Guitarist: Derek Bailey
description: Derek Bailey isn't well known in this country, not even among devotees of the newer currents in improvised music. But Mr. Bailey, an Euglish guitarist who gave his first New York performances on Saturday at Soundscape,has been making his uncompromisingly original music for more than a decade now, and it has spawned an entire generation of guitarists who approached. the instrument without regard for its conventions.

title: Navy Still Searching for 2 Fliers Believed Killed in Crash Off Spain
description: ALMERIA, Spain, Nov. 4 (Reuters)  United States naval units today continued to search for two airmen presumed killed when their F14 fighter plunged into the sea near southeastern Spain during military exercises.

title: Buying Agents Report Softening
description: After an unexpectedly strong September, business softened in October as borrowing costs and prices of industrial raw materials soared, according to a nationwide survey of purchasing released yesterday.

title: A Good Time at the Ziegfeld Ball Extravaganza
description: No, you out there, they aren't all the same. There are the sophisticated benefit balls and there is the Ziegfeld Ball and vive la diffrence.

title: Books of The Times A Brace of Thrillers
description: Oliver Mcnab wastes no time getting the Moran family into the pickle that forms the plot of his first novel, Horror Story. By page four, Seth Moran has driven his gray Volkswagen beetle down the wrong road deer in a NewHampshire woods, and his 5yearold daughter has spotted a lady with a funny hat and glasses and a long dress with long sleeves. And you know what else? ... A gun, a real gun. One of those long big ones. And a walkietalkie radio.

title: Shows Register Strong Profits
description: Broadway production profits in the last theatrical season increased by $10 million over the preceding season and offBroadway productions reversed decade of decline, according to a report released yesterday.

title: Asarco Spending to. Rise
description: Asarco Inc., a major metals producer, said last week that it planned to spend in excess of $100 miliion on capital projects next year, up from $70 mil.lion this year and $79.4 million in 1978.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: OSAKA, Japan, Nov. 4 (UPI)  Shiro Mizunuma, a catcher, smashed a tworun homer in the sixth inning and powered the Hiroshima Toyo Carp to a 43 victory over the Kintetsu Buffaloes today for Hiroshima's first Japan professional baseball series championship.KUMAMOTO, Japan, Nov. 4 (UPI)  Darrel Pace of the United States and a countryman, Richard McKinney, broke two world records as they finished first and second, respectively, on the final day of the AllJapan archery championships today.

title: 4 Youths Injured in Disturbance In Washington State Reformatory
description: MONROE, Wash., Nov. 4 (UPI)  Inmates at the Washington State Reformatory rioted today and four youths were injured, officials reported.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: In 1941, when 18yearold Marc Stepp left his hometown of Versailles, Ky., and set out for Detroit in search of work, he was only one member of the vast Southern emigration bent on getting wellpaid jobs in automobile factories. The next year, the Chrysler Corporation hired him as a dock worker, one of the lowestpaying factory jobs.

title: Plugged Nickle in Tuneup
description: In a tuneup for next Sunday 's $100,000 added Remsen, John M. Schiff 's Plugged Nickle, a late bloomer this season, worked out here before the start of yesterday 's program. The 2yearold colt, who won the recent $188,550 Laurel Futurity, worked seven furlongs in 1:25 2/5.

title: CREDIT MARKETS No Letup Expected In Climbing Rates
description: A month has passed since the Federal Reserve announced its new inflationfighting strategy, and the consensus among credit  market analysts is that interest rates  already at historic highsare likely to climb still further.

title: Unionist Hails Chrysler Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (UPI)  The president of the United Auto Workers said in a television interview today that the Chrysler Corporation has a reasonably good chance for survival under the Carter Administration's $1.5 billion rescue package.

title: Cowboys Set Back Giants On Late Field Goal, 1644
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Nov.  Harry Carson, who all week long had said it would be Just Another Game, sat and cried on the Giant bench for five minutes after it ended in not Just Another Loss.

title: PROPOSITION AND AMENDMENTS PROPUESTA Y ENMIENDAS
description: PROPOSITION NUMBER ONEENERGY CONSERVATION THROUGH IMPROVED TRANSPORTATION BOND ISSUE

title: Carey and Fuel Aid Choices
description: Governor Carey has decided he must veto at least one of three bills headed for his desk that would have the state treasury help people with their bloated heating bills. But administration aides fear Mr. Carey will have to pay a high price, politically or financially, to gain enough good will to block an override of his action.

title: Around the Nation
description: HONOLULU, Nov. 4 (AP)  Striking public workers have made a new contract offer and have reported progress toward ending the twoweekold strike that has halted public education and turned parts of this tourist island into a garbage dump.

title: Candidates in New York City and Suburban Elections Tomorrow
description: Follmwing are the major contests in the election tomorrow in the New York metropolitan area. Asterisks denote incumbents.

title: Stavros Papadopoulos Weds Diana Tompkins
description: The Greek Orthodox Archdiocesan Cathedral of Holy Trinity in Manhattan was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Diana Tompkins, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Rexford E. Tompkins of Port Chester. N.Y., toStavros Papadopoulos, son of Mr. and Mrs. Theologis Papadopoulos of Thessaloniki, Greece. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Chrysanthos Zois.

title: Sports Today
description: Dolphins vs. Houston Oilers, at Miami. (Television Channel 7, 9 P.M. RadioWCBS, 9 P.M.)

title: Letters to Mrs. Carter Reflect Her Influence
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (AP)  A sampling of Rosalyn Carter's mail shows that her increasing repute as President Carter's full partner has not gone unnoticed.

title: Kings 5, Black Hawks 3
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 4 (AP)  Marcel Dionne collected three goals and two assists tonight and a linemate, Charlie Simmer, broke a 33 tie late in the final period, lifting the Los Angeles Kings to a 53 victory over the Chicago Black Hawks.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: HARK Greenwich Village, where rock, folk and show tunes abound after dark, will have a free, untouted musicale tonight echoing more sedate sounds of the past. The 7:15 concert near a bustling Village crossroads is titled The Wealth in a Small Clavichord ana features Andrew de Masi at the keys, accompanied by Collette Harris on the viola da gamba. They are playing works of Bach, Farnaby, Escarlati, Beethoven, Lachert and original music by the clavichordist.

title: Events Today
description: A KURT WEILL CABARET, starring Martha Schlamme and Alvin Epstein; pianist, Steven Blier, at the Bijou Theater, 209, West 45th Street, 7:30.

title: Don Quixote Is Charging Onto Spanish TV Scene
description: MADRID THE genial madman Don Quixote and his sly, paunchy companion, Sancho Panza, have reached Spanish television, in a serialized comic strip for children.

title: Foe of Park Calls for Revision of Seoul's Constitution
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 4  A leader of South Korea's political opposition called today for constitutional changes within three months allowing for the direct election of a new president and National Assembly by next April and predicted great political and social unrest the present governmental system was retained.

title: Correcting for Rikers Island
description: After long negotiations begun at the request of the city, New York State has made a firm offer to lease Rikers Island and the prisons on it for $200 million. The deal now depends on approval by members of the Board of Estimate and the City Council. We hope they are able to approve the proposal on fiscal grounds. It makes great sense as a vital improvement in handlingthe city's jail population of more than 4.000.

title: Man Upstate Accused Of Rape of His Spouse During Estrangement
description: ALBANY, Nov. 2  In the first application of a New York State law designed to protect estranged wives, a man from Rensselaer County has been indicted on a charge of felony rape.

title: 200 Feared Dead in Bangladesh
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, Nov. 4 (AP)  A cargo ship ran into a crowded river launch carrying Moslems to a celebration near Khulna, 80 miles southwest of Dacca, and at least 200 people were feared drowned, The Bangladesh Times reported today.

title: St. John's Posts A 5715 Victory
description: Joe Kaso threw two touchdown passes and ran for a score and Wally Casa Nova rushed for two touchdowns as St. John's routed St. Peter's, 5715, yesterday in Jamaica, Queens.

title: Steelers on the Money in 387 Rout
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 4  The Pittsburgh Steelers, an avaricious lot, describe the second half of the season as the money half, referring to the $32,000 in extra pay that goes to each player for being on the winner of threegames: the Super Bowl game and two playoff games leading to it. No Steeler today let anyone get in the way of a chance at another big payoff as Pittsburgh demolished the Washington Redskins, 387.

title: Composites of 4 Issued by Police  In Prison Break
description: The state police in New Jersey issued composite sketches yesterday of the four persons who took part in the escape from prison at gunpoint Friday by Joanne Chesimard, who was convicted of the 1973 killing of a state trooper.

title: CORRECTION
description: In an article on the play Devour the Snow in The Times on Oct. 31, the name of the producer of The Elephant Man was incorrect. Richmond Crinkley was the producer of The Elephant Man Off Broadway. On Broadway Mr. Crinkley, Elizabeth I. McCann and Nelle Nugent were the producers.

title: Mountbatten Murder Trial Opening
description: DUBLIN, Nov. 4 (Reuters)  The Irish Army is mounting a huge security operation for the opening of the trial tomorrow of two men accused of murdering Earl Mountbatten of Burma.

title: Bridge:
description: The percentage chance that the opponents cards will be divided in a particular way is given in many textbooks. Memorizing these percentages is of little practical value. For the average player. it is sufficient to remember thatan even number of cards tends to break unevenly and an odd number of cards tends to break as evenly as possible.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: AvantGarde: 2 NewMusic Concerts
description: THERE were two potpourri newmusic concerts Saturday in New York, and both provided a. look at their respective scenes. A collaboration between the New York University Contemporary Players and members of the University of Illinois Contemporary Chamber Players in the afternoon at Carnegie Recital Hall offered eight composers from the academic newmusic scene in the East and Middle West, and in the evening there was a selection of seven emerging composers on the SoHo scene at the Kitchen.

title: Belle 's . Gold Upsets Smarten
description: John R. Murrell's Belle's Gold, took the lead in the stretch, ran away from the favorite, Smarten, and captured the 35th running of the $55,450 Discovery Handicap by four lengths yesterday at Aqueduct.

title: ABROAD AT HOME Winds Of Change
description: JACKSON, Miss.  In the summer of 1964  Freedom Summer, they called it  the civil rights movement made its great effort to break the wall of segregation in Mississippi. It met savage resistance; three students were murdered. But the drama of that summer toucnea tne conscience of the country and helped to bring about profound change.

title: Carmichael Mark Is Only Eagle Joy
description: A sellout crowd of 69,019 at Veterans Stadium in Philadelphia gave Harold Carmichael of the Eagles a standing ovation when he caught a pass for 5yard gain early in the game against the Cleveland Browns yesterday. Thereception marked a recordbreaking 106th consecutive National Football League game in which the 6foot8inch receiver had caught a pass.

title: Cello: Ellen Zoe Hassman
description: AN amazing feature of the local recital scene is the alacrity with which otherwise sophisticated instrumentalists treat the violin and cello sonatas of Beethoven and Brahms as if they were solovehicles. the latest instance was a performance of Brahms's Eminor Cello Sonata yesterday afternoon at the 92d Street Y. The cellist was EllenZoe Hassman, and the pianist was Sandra Rivers.

title: IRELAND TO ASK U.S. FOR HELP ON ULSTER
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (Reuters)  Prime Minister John Lynch of Ireland says that in a meeting with President Carter this week he will urge the President to use his influence with Britain's leaders to bring foward a political initiative for Northern Ireland.

title: U.S. Equestrians Triumph
description: Every summer, Bert de Nemethy, the coach of the United States Equestrian Team, begins to worry about what is in store for his squad on the fall indoor circuit, especially about assorted disasters at the National Horse Show.

title: Sports World Specials
description: The television commercial opens with Joe Greene, the 260pound defensive tackle of the Pittsburgh Steelers, limping down a stadium runway, his uniform jersey slung over his right shoulder, presumably injured and out of the game. A young boy trails behind.

title: To the French, Robber on Run Becomes Hero
description: NICE, France, Nov. 2  To the French, who are short of heroes at the moment, Albert Spaggiari is the next best thing. He is the Lone Ranger, Robin Hood and Jerry Lewis all in one package. He is, in fact, France's favorite crook.

title: Pope and Cardinals Meeting Today On Pressing Problems for Vatican
description: ROME, Nov. 4  Roman Catholic cardinals from all over the world are gathering in Rome for an extraordinary assembly, beginning tomorrow, at which Pope John Paul II will give them a report on the state of the church at the end of his first year in office and will ask for their views on the most pressing problems facing the Vatican.

title: 7 Inmates Hurt in Melee At Green Haven Prison
description: STORMVILLE, N.Y., Nov. 4 (AP) A disturbance involving more than 100 inmates in a recreational yard of the Green Haven State Correctional Facility this afternoon sent two inmates to a hospital with knife wounds and five others to the prison infirmary with less serious injuries.

title: Stanley Gilkey, 79, Producer Of 3 Broadway Revues in 40's
description: Stanley Gilkey, a retired Broadway producer, died Saturday at the Pacifica Convalescent Home in Pacifica, Calif. He was 79 years old.

title: India Discovers Offshore Oil
description: MADRAS, India, Nov. 4 (Reuters)  Oil has been discovered in commercial quantities in the sea off western India, Petroleum Minister Bala Pajnor said today. He said that the field was about 50 miles southwest of Bombay.

title: Question Box
description: QUESTION: When were lefthanded polo players barred from competition, and why was this done?

title: New Factors in the PrimeTime Battle
description: IN the first seven weeks of the television season, leadership in the primetime audiencepopularity ratings has bounced from NBCTV to ABCTV to CBSTV, with no sign yet that a clear order of rank is forming. The weekly fluctuations have convinced most network officials that this will be the closest contest for audience that television has experienced in many years. The ratings summary for the first seven weeks puts ABC first with a 19.7 average, NBC next with 18.3 and CBS third with 17.6. But these figures reflect the extraordinary viewing ABC attracted with the World Series in prime time and that NBC received with the baseball playoff games. Moreover, as raw numbers, they belie the CBS resurgence during the last two weeks, which occurred after the network canceled several of its weaker new entries and began replacing them with a variety of special programs and madefortelevision features.

title: Tentative Pact Accord Reached In Strike at Delaware Auto Plant
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Nov. 9 (AP)  Negotiators for 9,000 striking production workers and the management of the General Motors Corporation's Chevette assembly plant here reached a tentative contract agreement today.

title: Incomes Rise Slower in Jersey
description: WASHINGTON  Personal incomes in New Jersey increased more slowly than the national average and did not keep pace with inflation during the second quarter of 1979, according to Department of Commerce figures. Personal incomesin New Jersey increased 2 percent from April to June, compared with the national increase of 2.2 percent and an equal rise in the Consumer Price Index.

title: Mayor Byrne Takes Charge
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 4  Somebody asked Mayor Jane M. Byrne at a news conference the other day if she really thought that her endorsement of Senator Edward M. Kennedy's Presidential aspirations would carry as much weight as the late

title: 10 Men Sought in Guard's Killing
description: The police are looking for 10 to 12 men suspected in the stabbing death of an offduty state correction officer in the Bronx Saturday night near his home. The victim, 26yearold Nelson Rodriguez, was stabbed to death about 8 P.M. Saturday night on Fordham Road near Grand Avenue during a dispute with a group of young men, the police said.

title: U.N. Cambodia Talks Open Today As 250,000 Refugees Seek Safety
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 4  About 250,000 Cambodians are camped along their country's border with Thailand, according to the most conservative estimates of Thai and foreign official sources, and depend almost entirely on food provided by international relief efforts based in this country.

title: The Region
description: TRENTON (UPI)  Legislators, Governor Byrne's office and the state Attorney General are expected to start separate inquiries this week into the deaths from food poisoning of four elderly patients at Marlboro Psychiatric Hospital, a staterun institution in Monmouth County.

title: 3 Late Scores Give Rangers 42 Victory
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, Nov. 4  In their last five games the New York Rangers could not manage more than two goals an outing. Tonight they scored twice within 1 minute 49 seconds of the third period to gain a 42 triumph over the Vancouver Canucks and end a fivegame victoryless streak.

title: Army Identifies 2 Killed in Crash
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 4 (AP)  United States Army officials yesterday released the names of two servicemen killed in a helicopter crash Thursday.

title: Vengeance for Raid Seen as Motive For 4 Killings at AntiKlan March
description: GREENSBORO, N.C., Nov. 4  All four persons shot to death yesterday at an antiKlan demonstration here were members of an organization that claimed responsibility for bursting into a Ku Klux Klan rally July 8, tearing down the Confederate flag and burning it.

title: Marist Eleven Tops Manhattan, 2722
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N.Y., Nov. 4  Jess Hackett ran for two touchdowns and threw for a third today as he led Marist to a 2722 football victory over Manhattan College.

title: Party Behind AntiKlan Protest  Sees Government Role in Deaths
description: They advocate the violent armed overthrow of the capitalist system and its replacement by a dictatorship of workers. And they believe that the United States Government is responsible for the deaths of four colleagues in Greensboro, N.C.. over the weekend.

title: Mrs. Lloyd Is Victor
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Nov. 4  Chris Evert Lloyd needed only an hour to rout Virginia Wade, 61, 61, before teaming with Rosie Casals to win the final match, over Miss Wade and Sue Barker, as the United States recorded a 70 victory over Britain in the 51st Wightman Cup. This was the eighth time an American team has swept the series. Barker, as the United States recorded a 70 victory over Britain in the 51st Wightman Cup. This was the eighth time an American team has swept the series.

title: Gene Mayer Wins
description: COLOGNE, West Germany, Nov. 4 (AP)  Topseeded Gene Mayer of the United States defeated Wojtek Fibak of Poland, 36, 63, 61, today and won the $75,000 Cologne Grand Prix tennis tournament.

title: Three Abstractions Form Puzzle on Park Avenue
description: About all that could be said incontrovertibly at first was that they had not been there the night before  the three big, abstract, angular, jetblack silhouettes that Park Avenue dwellers between 74th and 75th Streets woke up toyesterday morning. The figures stood in the median strip of the avenue, the tallest in midblock and the others near each end.

title: Profit Surge Led by Oil
description: Led by the major oil companies, several bellwether United States industries showed surprising profit strength in the third quarter. However, many analysts indicated that the big gains, helped by unexpected strength in theeconomy, were not likely to continue through the final three months of the year. Some industries, notably steel and automobile manufacturing, suffered major setbacks.

title: Outdoors: Hunters Should Aim at Safety First
description: I HAVE deerhunting friends who refuse to enter certain areas where the animals are plentiful because those spots also attract too many guns.

title: Struggle in Japanese Party Said to Imperil Its Unity
description: TOKYO, Monday, Nov. 5  Prime Minister Masayoshi Ohira, locked in a power syruggle with former Prime Minister Takeo Fukuda, said yesterday that the crisis might portend a breakup of the governing Liberal Democratic Party.The Japanese Parliament is scheduled to vote on a new Prime Minister later today, with Mr. Ohira and Mr. Fukuda, both members of the majority party, trying to control the office. Several other candidates to be nominated by the opposition parties are expected to be eliminated in the first ballot.

title: Panel Says Atomic Officials Played Down Reactor Peril
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4  Both the company that operated the reactor at Three Mile Island near Harrisburg, Pa., and the Federal agency that regulated the reactor decided in the first days of the nuclear accident there last spring that bad news was not something the public ought to hear, a Presidential study group's report asserts.

title: WILLIAM J. HANDLEY, FORMER ENVOY, DIES
description: William J. Handley, the former United States Ambassador to Turkey who organized the American effort to stop the Turkish connection narcotics trade, died yesterday in a Portland, Ore., hospital at age 60. His doctor said his death apparently resulted from the complications of a liver disease.

title: Piano: John J. Reynolds in Debut
description: JOHN J. REYNOLDS, a pianist from California, made his New York debut Saturday night at Carnegie Recital Hall. Mr. Reynolds's program was extremely brief, and was chosen with his modest technical resources in mind.

title: Bishop Frederick H. Belden Dies
description: DENVER, Nov. 4 (UPI)  Bishop Frederick H. Belden of the Episcopal Diocese of Rhode Island, died today at St. Joseph's Hospital. He was 70 years old.

title: Rates Squeeze Savings Banks
description: Savings banks, especially those in New York City, have been suffering because of sharply escalating interest rates, and some have been experiencing operating losses for the first time since they were formed more than a century ago.

title: Dark Day Wednesday
description: There will be racing at Aqueduct on Election Day tomorrow, ordinarily the dark day at the Big A. The feature will be the $50,000 Knickerbocker Handicap at a mile and threeeighths on the turf. There will be no racing Wednesday.

title: Heavy U.S. Offerings Set
description: With the credit markets beginning to show the first signs of stability since the Federal Reserve announced its tighter money strategy a month ago, this week the Treasury is scheduled to market a large volume of bills  shortterm securities that come due in a year or less.

title: The Day the Offense Stopped
description: The Seahawks set a record for offensive futility yesterday in suffering a 240 loss to the Los Angeles Rams at Seattle. With a crowd of 62,048 watching in stunned disbelief, the Seahawks were held to minus7 yards in total offense, a National Football League mark. In 1967 Denver had minus5 yards against Oakland.

title: Church Fortress Defying Brooklyn Decay
description: Where suspects used to be escorted to be booked, where victims used to describe their losses, the People's First Baptist Church in Brooklyn is trying to create a community of believers.

title: Brooklyn Area Counts on Lundy's Heirs
description: Compared with many other sections of flew York City that are plagued by flight and destruction, Sheepshead Bay  a twosquaremile community on the southern edge of Brooklyn with a population of 100,000 has maintained an unusual degree of stability.

title: Aaron Davis Hall: Architectural Paradox
description: AS a piece of architecture for the performing arts, Aaron Davis Hall at City College, which opened last month, puts Lincoln Center to shame. It is a structure with none of the travertine marble pomposity of the Metropolitan OperaHouse or the New York State Theater  instead, the college has erected building with some verve, a hall that brings as much of a sense of energy to the performingarts scene in New York as any new structure in years.

title: Commodities
description: WITH gold and silver prices hayloosened their hold on other commodity futures, at least for the time being, the professional traders once again concentrated on futures spreads last week.

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: MONDAY, NOVEMBER 5, 1979

title: Kemeny Sees Atom Power Dying If the Industry Does Not Change
description: BOSTON, Nov. 4 (AP)  John G. Kemeny, head of the Presidential commission that investigated the Three Mile Island nuclear accident, said in an interview published today nuclear power will be wiped out by public opinion if the industry does not change.

title: In the Emirate, Sand and Tears
description: The Bedu had been resettled. All over the emirate, the nomads who had been the companions of [Wilfred] Thesiger, [St. John] Philby and Bertram Thomas [all Arabists] now lived in new cinderblock developments in the desert. I had asked to meet a Bedu family, and it had been arranged for a ministry driver to take me out to Al Ain, an [Abu Dhabi] oasis town on the edge of the Empty Quarter. Sitting in the hotel lobby at eight in the morning, I was conscious of the intrinsic irony of excursion. Through the window, I could see the Baluchis planting grass and their torn tents straining at their guy ropes. If I wanted to meet nomads, they were a hundred yards away from where I was sitting. A Thesiger or a Lawrence, in search of people living lives of heroic privation, would, I was sure, have simply walked down the hotel drive and talked to the Baluchis.

title: Galway's Vivaldi
description: JAMES GALWAY, who filled Avery Fisher Hall yesterday afternoon for a flute program that he will repeat there tonight, is arguably the reigning superstar of the flute, along with JeanPierre Rampal. And to this taste, Mr. Galwaysurpasses Mr. Rampal on almost every count. At least it can be safely said that yesterday's concert was a jewel.

title: The City
description: In an analysis of New York City's Oct. 15 revision of its 198083 financial plan, the Citizens Budget Commission warned yesterday that at some point in time, a solution must be found to pending litigation charging inequality in real estate assessments. The watchdog group said the city's contingent liability might run up to $1.5 billion.

title: New Auto Industry Technology A Source of Wonder and Anxiety
description: WARREN, Mich.  At the General Motors Corporation technical center here, researchers have developed small, $2,800 instrument that is just one part of a technological revolution promising fundamental change in the automobile industry and in the way Americans will work and live in the future.

title: The Catch in a National Sales Tax
description: Chairman Al Ullman of the House Ways and Means Committee has proposed a 10 percent value added tax, in effect a national sales tax, to encourage savings by taxing consumption. Given the country's low savings rate, the proposal merits attention. But the idea raises three problems. One is solvable, another is irrelevant  but the third, unfortunately, may be insurmountable.

title: A Harvest Festival in an Urban Valley
EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Avon Products Inc. has appointed Robert E. Breen chairman and chief executive officer of its Great Oak Insurance Company subsidiary.

title: GOVERNMENT IN IRAN VOWS HELP IN SIEGE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4  The United States said today that it had been told by the Iranian Government that it would do its best to free the Americans being held hostage in Washington's embassy in Teheran. But officials here were uncertainhow quickly the Iranians could fulfill their pledge because the takeover apparently has the approval of Iran's powerful religious authorities.

title: The State Of Marriage: Is It Dying, Evolving or Just Fine?; The Selfish Marriage
description: Is marriage, like the dinosaur, doomed to extinction? Or is it, at the very least, a candidate for formal evolution?

title: Bomb Threat Forces Down Jet
description: LINTHICUM, Md., Nov. 4 (UPI)  A Delta Airlines jet flying from Atlanta to New York made an emergency landing at BaltimoreWashington International Airnnrt today because of threats that a bombwas on board, an official said. Bob Clark, an airport spokesman, said no bomb was found when the state police escorted the 88 passengers and seven crew members off an searched the plane shortly after midnight. He said the plane resumed its flight to New York at 1:30 A.M. Delta officials in Atlanta said the airlines reservation desk had received two threats from the same anonymous caller last night, spokesman for the Federal Bureau of Investigation said.

title: Smaller Retailers Luring BigCity Executives
description: Increasingly, retail managements in smaller cities and towns are reaching out to hire executives who have made a name at nationally known stores in bigger cities. And they are having surprisingly good luck in drawing able people from what might be considered the bigger leagues.

title: Campbell: Oilers Workhorse Runs Like
description: HOUSTON S S the film projector began to whir, the screen showed No. 34 looping casually to his right behind the quarterback. He took the handoff smoothly from Dan Pastorini, read the line of scrimmage and then, leaning forward like a charging rhino, suddenly veered wide to the left. It was an explosive thrust, a quick cut that only a desperate lunge by an outside defender kept from going for a big gain.

title: News Summary
description: MONDAY, NOVEMBER 5, 1979

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Deaths

title: Penny H. Zavos, a Banker, Is Married to James Spanos
description: In the Three Hierarchs Greek Orthodox Church in Brooklyn yesterday afternoon, Penny H. Zavos, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Harry Zavos of Brooklyn, became the bride of James K. Spanos, son of Mr. and Mrs. Kyriakos Spanos of Manchester, N.H. The Rev. Angelo Gavalas performed the ceremony.

title: Jets Victors at Green Bay, 2722
description: GREEN BAY, Wis., Nov. 4  On the road, where they had lost their other four games this season, the Jets staged another of those brinkofdisaster performances today. But this time they won, beating the Green Bay Packers by 2722.

title: Turkish Leader Says He Plans Crackdown Against Extremists
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Nov. 4 (Reuters)  Suleyman Demirel, Turkey's Prime Ministerdesignate, said today he would crack down harder on Kurdish separatists and political extremists.

title: Dance: Chen And Troupe Hail Nature
description: THE titles of four dances performed by Hsuehtung Chen and Dancers at Pace University's Schimmel Center on Saturday  Egrets at Dawn, Empty Mountain, Reflections on a Stream and Autumn Dance  suggest apreoccupation with nature. But, as Mr. Chen blends American moderndance technique with the more formal look of Chinese traditional dance, so he sometimes weaves a simple statement about the human condition into his dances. Shore of Hope, Mr. Chen's latest work, is a straightforward message of sympathy to the Vietnamese refugees who fled by boat and who inspired the dance.

title: World News Briefs
description: SALISBURY, Zimbabwe Rhodesia, Nov. 4 (Reuters)  Zimbabwe Rhodesia's guerrilla war was reported today to have claimed 22 more lives, raising the death toll to more than 1,000 since peace talks began in London eight weeks ago.

title: Mrs. King a Finalist
description: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 4 (AP)  Billie Jean King of the United States outlasted Virginia Ruzici of Rumania in a 2hour duel today and gained the singles final in the $210,000 Stockholm open tennis tournament.

title: ESSAY The Blame Passers
description: WASHINGTON  Dick Clark, the former Iowa Senator placed in charge of the American program to get help to starving refugees from Vietnam and Cambodia, last week deserted his post with no notice to take a job in the Kennedy campaign helping to round up Iowa delegates.

title: Borg Overpowers Connors, 62, 62
description: TOKYO, Nov. 4 (AP)  Bjorn Borg pinned Jimmy Connors to the baseline with heavy topspin drives and scored a 62, 62 victory today to win the $300,000 Tokyo World Super Tennis singles championship for the second consecutive year.

title: Dallas Suit on Job Bias Is Viewed as FarReaching
description: DALLAS, Nov. 3  For the last three weeks, a Federal district judge here has been hearing a classaction discrimination case covering about 15,000 women and blacks.
