description: TORONTO, Nov. 6 (AP)  The National Hockey League will take the first step next month to adding a 22d team for the 198182 season by studying the possibility of expanding to the Meadowlands sports facility in East Rutherford, N.J., John Zeigler, the N.H.L. president, said today.

title: MARIETTA BITTER
description: Marietta Bitter, a harpist and the wife of Walter Abel, the actor, died of cancer yesterday at her home, 167 East 71st Street. She was 75 years old.

title: Utah and Nevada Worry Over Missile Plan's Scale
description: SALTLAKE CITY, Nov. 6  The Governor of Utah was waving his arms in wider and wider circles today, saying, We didn't realize the scope of the thing was so big, so huge, so enormous.

title: Books of The Times
description: What a perfect title The Falcon and the Snowman seems to be for Robert Lindsey's A Story of Friendship and Espionage, as his subtitle describes his book. Sated as we are with the clichs of popular spy entertainment, THE FALCON AND THE SNOWMAN. A True Story of Friendship and Espio nage. By Robert Lindsey. 359 pages. Il lustrated. Simon &Schuster.$12.95. we take it for granted that the world of international espionage is filled with predatory beasts and icecold opera tives.

title: Arms Pact Survives an Amendment
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6  By the margin of a single vote the Senate Foreign Relations Committee today defeated another socalled killer amendment to the strategic arms limitation treaty with the Soviet Union today.

title: Treasury Set to Recover DoublePayment Checks
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (UPI)  The Treasury Department is committed to recovering by December 1980 $83.3 million worth of doublepayment checks issued over the last decade, according to Dario Pagliai, Commissioner of the Treasury's Bureau of Government Financial Operations.

title: Advertising
description: Agencies Cite Gains In Japan

title: Global Drop In Grain Seen
description: PARIS, Nov. 6 (Reuters)  Worldwide production of coarse grains will fall by about 9 percent, or about 20 million tons, from last season, with the Soviet Union's decline contributing to most of the drop, the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development said today.

title: ANDREY POTTER, 97; AN AIDE AT PURDUE
description: Prof. Andrey A. Potter, dean emeritus of engineering at Purdue University, who served two interim terms as Purdue's president in the 1920's and 1940's, died Monday at St. Elizabeth's Hospital in Lafayette, Ind. He was 97 years old and lived in West Lafayette.

title: The City
description: The bank fraud trial of Michele Sindona, the Italian financier, was postponed yesterday from Nov. 26 to Jan.7 by Judge Thomas P. Griesa of Federal District Court in Manhattan. There was no explanation for the postponement, but when the November date was set, the judge had said it was tentative.

title: Bridge:
description: Declarers who count their chickens before they are hatched often wind up with egg on their faces. The result of the diagramed deal seemed like a bad yolk to the British South. The story was described in Bridge magazine by P. F. Saunders, a writer whose style is always succinct and effective.

title: Principals Meet On I.B.M. Suit
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (AP)  Both sides in the Government's antitrust suit against the International Business Machines Corporation held preliminary talks today that could lead to a settlement of the 10yearold case, a Justice Department spokesman said.

title: Critics of Redgrave Casting as Jew Ask Equal Time
description: Though production is scheduled to begin soon on a made  for  television movie starring Vanessa Redgrave as a survivor of the Auschwitz concentration camp, the debate over that casting continues.

title: For the Elderly Who Dislike Eating Alone
description: For older persons who hate to eat alone or who are homebound, there are often community agencies that serve meals to the elderly on a communal basis, such as in a church hall or school cafeteria, or that brine Meals on Wheels to the home.

title: Main Iran Oil Port Reported Closed And Prices of Spot Petroleum Soar
description: Iran was reported yesterday to have stopped loading all oil tankers at the country's major port at Kharg Island in the Persian Gulf, and oil prices soared in the spot market as a result. The report, which stemmed from oil industry sources, was later circulated by the Central Intelligence Agency, the State Department and White House aides.

title: Shreve Approves Bid of Henry Birks
description: BOSTON, Nov. 6 (AP)  Stockholders of the Shreve, Crump and Low Company, a Boston retailing concern, gave final approval today for the company's acquisition by Henry Birks and Sons Ltd. of Montreal.

title: A Perfect Day For Ferry Ride
description: It was a day to bring out the drums: a perfect autumn day when the air was crisp and the skyline sparkled, the kind of day, some New Yorkers like to say, when the city is at its best.

title: America's Share of World Markets
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif.  While the United States is still No. 1 in innovative technology, its grip on world leadership in technology is weakening. This development, discernible in many domestic industries, is dramatically evident in the steel industry.

title: Spurs Overcome Nets, 10895
description: SAN ANTONIO, Nov. 6  The New Jersey Nets coach, Kevin Loughery, was standing in the locker room, calmeddown version of his courtside self. He was uttering the same words that he has spoken so often after the team's latest defeats, this time following the Nets 10895 loss tonight to the San Antonio Spurs.

title: Justice Brennan Holds Up the Sale Of Drilling Leases on Georges Bank
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6  A Supreme Court Justice today temporarily blocked the sale of leases for the exploration of oil and gas on the Georges Bank fishing grounds off Cape Cod.

title: Unionist Says Scotto Gave $25,000 in Cash for Carey
description: Joseph F. Colozza, a dock union official who worked in Governor Carey's reelection campaign last year, testified yesterday that Anthony M. Scotto had given him a $25,000 cash contribution for the Carey campaign in June 1978.

title: Democrats in Kentucky and Mississippi Victors in Races for Governor
description: Democrats overcame stiff Republican challenges and held onto the governorships in Kentucky and Mississippi yesterday. But a Republican ousted Cleveland's angry young Democratic Mayor, Dennis J. Kucinich.

title: Notes on People
description: A Chair for the Speaker

title: Closed End Bond Funds
description: Unaudited net asset values of closedend investment bond fund shares, recorded by the companies as of Friday. Also shown is the closing listed market price or dealertodealer asked price of each fund's shares, with the percentage of difference.

title: A Favorite TroubleShooter of Presidents
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6  Sol M. Linowitz, the second successive American Jew to become President Carter's Ambassador at Large for Middle East negotiations, is a striking contrast to his flamboyant predecessor and friend, Robert S. Strauss, in background, style and temperament.

title: Rockland Voters Lower Tax Cap
description: POMONA, N.Y, Nov. 6  Rockland County voters approved a lower ceiling on their county property taxes today.

title: Polish Team to Tackle Everest
description: WARSAW, Nov. 6 (Reuters)  Polish mountaineers plan to attempt the first winter conquest of Mount Everest, the Polish news agency P.A.P. reported today. Nepalese authorities are expected to approve the expedition in the next few days, and the 20man Polish team will set off for Nepal early next month, the agency said.

title: Market Place
description: THE money market funds, those investment vehicles offering a place to park money at high interest rates, have been so successful in these days of peak interest that at least one basic service appears to have suffered.

title: Carter Is Urged to Change Handling of Foreign Crises
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6  President Carter has approved a White House report calling for sweeping changes in the Administration's system for making important national security decisions and its anoroach to handling foreign crises.

title: U.S. Sells Out Mark Bonds
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (Reuters) The Treasury Department said today that its $1.12 billion issue of 2year and 3year notes denominated in West German marks had been oversubscribed.

title: Con Ed Takeover Action Fails in Westchester  Simon Wins in Bronx
description: Voters approved mass transportation bond issues yesterday in New York and New Jersey, while rejectingg a state college building bond issue in New Jersey and at least two constitutional amendments in New York.

title: Suffolk Politicians Called in Kickback Investigation
description: Some of Suffolk County's leading Republicans  possibly as many as 15have been ordered to appear this morning before a Federal grand jury in Brooklyn that is reportedly investigating the possible payment of kickbacks in connection with the county's insurance program.

title: Citicorp Note Rate Up
description: Citicorp reports that the average rate on 91day notes that it sold this week climbed to 15.087 percent, the highest level since it began the weekly auctions almost 14 months ago. Last week the rate was 19.890 percent. Two weeks ago it was 15.045 percent, the previous high. The holding company, which owns Citibank, said it had received $616.55 million in bids for the notes and sold $150 million at rates ranging from 14.740 percent to 15.095 percent.

title: Seoul Inquiry Says Park's Slayer Originated Coup Plot 4 Months Earlier
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 6  Milltary investigators here have issued the third report in 10 days on the murder of President Park Chung Hee, saying that the assassin, the director of the Korean Central Intelligence Agency, had conceived his plot for a cow d'tat in June.

title: Pentagon Hints Air Force Jets Erred on Altitude in NearCrash
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (UPI)  A Pentagon spokesman today said that Air Force jets might have been at the wrong altitude when at least one of them came within 100 feet of colliding with an Air France supersonic airliner last week.

title: Brown, a Democrat, Is Elected Governor of Kentucky by Big Margin
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Nov. 6  John Y. Brown Jr., a Democrat, political neophyte and selfmade millionaire, was elected Governor of Kentucky tonight, defeating Louie B. Nunn, a former Governor and political veteran, by a wide margin.

title: Islanders Set Back Kings, 41
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., Nov. 6  Home is where the heart is, they say, and tonight the Islanders found not only their heart in Nassau Coliseum, but also their first victory in five games.

title: Louis lorio, 99, Designer of Glass And a Partner in Jersey Business
description: Louis Iorio, glassmaker, designer and cutter and partner with his son, William, in the Iorio Glass Shop on South Main Street in Flemington, N.J., died Monday of a heart attack at the Hunterdon Medical Center in Flemington. He would have been 100 years old on Nov. 22.

title: HOUSE ARREST ENDED FOR SEOUL DISSIDENT
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 6 Former President Yun Po Sun was released from, house arrest by South Korea's martial law authorities today.

title: Q&A
description: Q.My mother served Parker House rolls almost every day of her married life. Do you know where the name originated?

title: TV Guide Called Top Moneymaker
description: TV Guide is the country's biggest moneymaking magazine, according to Folio: The Magazine for Magazine Management, which compiled a list of the top 400 magazines with their advertising and circulation revenues. TV Guide's total revenues were $552.3 million for the 12 months ending last June.

title: Corporate Reports
description: For periods as shown.(N) indicates stock is listed on the New York Stock Exchange, (A) the American Exchange and (0) overthecounter.

title: Fewer Students With Top Marks Apply to City U.
description: The percentage of top high school students applying to the City University of New York dropped sharply immediately after the university was forced to impose tuition in 1976, according to a new university report.

title: Around the Nation
description: INDANAPOLIS, Nov. 6 (UPI)  One police officer and two other persons were shot to death today and at least four officers and the gunman were wounded in a gun battle apparently touched off by a domestic dispute, the police said.

title: Richard Fargo Brown Dead at 63; Led Ft. Worth's Kimbell Museum
description: Richard Fargo Brown, director of the Kimbell Art Museum in Fort Worth and a leading figure in the American museum world, died of a heart attack yesterday at St. Joseph's Hospital in Fort Worth. He was 63 years old.

title: Deaths
description: KATZIsfried The Rego Park Jewish Center and its affiliates mourn the passing of our devoted member iskied Katz and extend our heartfelt condolences to his beloved wife Gertrude and their family.

title: DISCOVERIES
description: The Gingerbread Artist

title: Venezuela vs. Foreign Banks
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Nov. 6 A recent decision by the Venezuelan Government to seek revisions of foreign loan agreements is causing consternation among foreign bankers here, according to banking circles.

title: Westchester Utility Proposition Is Defeated
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 6  Westchester County voters today decisively rejected a proposition that would have authorized the county to establish a public utility system. The measure had been seen as the first step toward a possible county takeover of the Consolidated Edison Company's electrical distribution network.

title: Prosecutor in KlanProtest Killings Terms 12 Suspects Equally Guilty
description: GREENSBORO, N.C., Nov. 6 (AP) The District Attorney said today that he would try to prove that all 12 men charged with murdering protesters against the Ku Klux Klan were equally guilty, regardless of who fired the fatal shots.

title: Satellite Photograph
description: Dense clouds cover the lake region and much of the Midwest, while a narrow band of clouds extends from the Tennessee Valley southwestward to the Texas Panhandle. Patches of clouds are visible in the Northeast and the Central Pacific States.

title: The Technology That Revolutionized Eating
description: WASHINGTON

title: MANDEL AND 5 LOSE PLEAS ON CONVICTION
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 6 (AP)  The United States Court of Appeals for the Fourth Circuit has refused to rehear an appeal of the 1977 Federal mail fraud and racketeering convictions of Marvin Mandel, the former Governor of Maryland, and five codefendants, the United States Attorney's office said today.

title: A Soviet Discovery Rocks World of Mathematics
description: A surprise discovery by an obscure Soviet mathematician has rocked the world of mathematics and computer analysis, and experts have begun exploring its practical applications.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Synthetic Fuel, Natural Caution
description: The prospect of synthetic fuels is alluring: all the oil and gas the nation needs for centuries, secure from foreign interference. But the potential costs of a rush to develop synfuels  the capital wasted on inefficient technology, the damage to the environment  are so great that caution is warranted. That is why the Senate Banking Committee now wants a program of Governmentassisted demonstration projects before committing the country to a major production effort. Such prudence deserves support.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS Centennial Of A War
description: LIMA, Peru  For a while, bottles of good Chilean wine seemed to be raining on the far end of the field.

title: Market Down in Slow Trading
description: Stock prices fell yesterday to hover just above their lowest level of 1979 under the pressure of adverse corporate developments and a gloomy assessment on inflation by the nation's chief antiinflation adviser.

title: Quake Hits Northwest Greece
description: ATHENS, Nov. 6 (AP)  A strong earth tremor jolted northwestern Greece today, causing minor damage but no injuries.

title: Swiss Price Index
description: BERN, Nov. 6 (AP)  Lower prices for heating oil and food helped reduce Switzerland's consumer price index by onetenth of 1 percent in October from the September level, the Government said today. However, the index was up 5 percent from a year before.

title: Wood, Field and Stream Craft of Knifemaking Is on Display in City
description: The work of many of this country's foremost custom knifemakers will be on display at the New York Sheraton Hotel Friday, Saturday and Sunday.

title: 60Minute Gourmet
description: IN French menu planning, several general, allpurpose names signify foods that are unpretentious and familystyle. These are not classic names like Du Barry (which always means cauliflower in a dish) or Argenteuil (which indicates asparagus) or Crcy (which indicates carrots). These are names like mnagre and paysanne and bonne femme. They stand for rustic simplicity.

title: N.F.L. Playoff Situation Far From Settled
description: If the National Football League's regular season had ended with Monday night's game between Houston and Miami, won by the Oilers, 96, the following 10 teams would qualify for the playoffs:

title: A.F.L.C.I.O. Offices Picketed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (UPI)  Two persons striking the Amalagamated Clothing and Textile Workers Union today picketed the national headquarters of the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations, keeping many federation staff employees from reporting to work. A federation spokesman, Al Zack, said that the two pickets were from a union that represented field representatives of the clothing workers union.

title: Winfred W. Murphy Dead at 96; Aide to Durant, Founder of G.M.
description: Winfred W. Murphy, the first corporate secretary of the General Motors Corporation and a longtime associate of its founder, William C. Durant, died Sunday at the age of 96 at his home in Stony Brook, L.I.

title: 2 Indicted in Gold Sales Plot
description: Two men were indicted in Manhattan yesterday on charges of defrauding hundreds of investors of $5 million to $10 million by selling them fake contracts to purchase gold and other precious metals.

title: Kahn Now Pessimistic On Inflation
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6  Alfred E. Kahn, the White House chief antiinflation adviser, recanted today his previous predictions that in the next few months the annual rate of price increases would fall below 10 percent.

title: Carter Asks Census Cooperation
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (AP)  President Carter issued a proclamation today reminding Americans that it was their legal duty to answer all questions by Federal censustakers next year.

title: Proviso Sought On Chrysler Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (AP)  The chairman of the House Banking Committee said today that he would support loan guarantees for the Chrysler Corporation if they were tied to a plan for oroducing fuelsaving vehicles.

title: New Yorkers,etc.
description: BEVERLY SILLS, at 50, says she is now in her dessert days. The dessert Monday night was chockfull of emotional calories as Miss Sills faced 150 friends and admirers, allowed as how she had reached the point where she needn't be too modest, smiled widely and concluded that she must have done something right.

title: Deaths
description: NICHOLSEthel E., suddenly on October 29, 1979. Wife of the late Herbert Nichols. Cousin of Walter E. Dottm, Madeline Enners, Gertrude Lafon. Interment in Memorial Abbey, Cypress Hills Cemetery, Bklyn, N.Y. at convenience of relatives and friends.

title: Democrats Retain Offices In Big Connecticut Cities
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Nov. 6  Democrats held on to the Mayor's offices today in Connecticut's largest cities of Bridgeport, Hartford, New Haven and Waterbury, while Stamford reelected its Republican Mayor by a surprisingly large margin.

title: Pakistan Man Flogged for Rape
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Nov. 6 (Reuters) A man was publicly flogged, sentenced to one year in prison and fined $500 today for raping a 4yearold girl. The sentence was handed down by a court martial as part of the military Government's campaign of public punishment for those convicted of what it called social crimes.

title: Strikes Continue in Bolivia as Natusch Refuses to Quit
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Nov. 6  A general strike against the military regime of Col. Alberto Natusch Busch that seized power in Bolivia last week continued today despite threats to striking workers and yesterday's violent repression of opponents to the coup.

title: Deaths
description: ANOLIKMax, age 90, died Tues., Nov. 6, 1979. Devoted father of Irving, Bernard and Abner. Dear grandfather of Charlene, Glenn, Steven, Gary, Miriam and Jonathan. Dear brother. Services at Gutterman's, 170 St & Jerome Ave, Bronx, Thursday 10AM.

title: Dick Clark Will Direct States Kennedy Drive
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6  Dick Clark, the Administration's former Coordinator for Refugee Affairs who recently joined Senator Edward M. Kennedy's Presidential campaign, has been named national director for political organization, Mr. Clark said today.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6  At this point in time, as they used to say in the Nixon White House, the situation in the Presidential election is perfectly clear. All you have to do is read the papers and listen to the experts to know precisely who's ahead.

title: Night Off for Jets: Football and Beer
description: POINT LOOKOUT, L.I., Nov. 6Every Monday night the Jets Monday morning quarterbacks saunter into a local tavern in this town on the South Shore. While watching on a huge TV screen, they analyze the game, review strategic errors of games past, and relax with a few beers.

title: Vietnam's Distinctive Food
description: FOR many Westerners, oriental cooking means Chinese or Japanese food. It is a selfimposed limit with shortcomings that are apparent at the first taste of Vietnamese cuisine. The food of Vietnam is unlike any other oriental food. It is distinctive in its seasonings, its basic ingredients and its method of cooking. And it is little known in New York City, where the Vietnamese community is as yet quite small.

title: TV: Cheever Puts Terror on the 5:48
description: THREE BY CHEEVER, WNETTV's series, concludes this evening on Channel 13 at 9 o'clock. The third John Cheever story is The Five FortyEight. It has been adapted for television by Terrence McNally, the playwright (The Ritz). The director is James Ivory (The Europeans).

title: Kuwait Said to Plan Oil Price Rise of 7.3%
description: BAHRAIN, Nov. 6 (Reuters)  Kuwait is expected to raise its crude oil prices by about 7.3 percent this month, the Kuwait news agency said today.

title: Commodity Tables Explained
description: Next to each commodity In the table is a key to the exchange on which it is traded, the minimum contract size and the monetary units represented by the figures in the table. Open interest is the number of contracts outstanding each month and not liquidated by delivery of the commodity or by an offsetting contract. The exchange keys are:

title: Kitchen Equipment
description: IT'S been a long time since I've had to shop for a metal spatula, and I wasn't quite prepared for what I saw as I walked from one kitchenware department to another last week.

title: 10 Slain in SouthWest Africa
description: WINDHOEK, SouthWest Africa, Nov. 6 (UPI)  A truck crammed with farm workers struck a landmine near the Angolan border today, killing 10 people and injuring 7, military officials said. The explosion occurred in the tribal homeland of Owambo.

title: Queens Man Shot Outside Home
description: Two men accosted a 48yearold Queens man at his home yesterday morning, handcuffed him, led him outside and shot him twice in the head, the police said. The victim, William Bermundez of 9415 54th Avenue, Elmhurst, was reported in critical condition in Elmhurst General Hospital.

title: EARNINGS
description: The Grumman Corporation, the nation's largest producer of carrierbased aircraft, has made some progress in its income account with thirdquarter net up 72.7 percent on a sales gain of 3.7 percent. it was reported yesterday. For the nine months, however, the net income fell 21.9 percent from the corresponding period a year earlier, with sales off 4.8 percent.

title: Mediator Invokes News Blackout On Green Bus Lines Strike Talks
description: William J. Glinsman, a state mediator, imposed a news blackout yesterday after reporting progress in a new effort to settle a dispute that has halted Green Bus Lines service since 500 drivers and mechanics struck July 1. Mr. Glinsman announced the blackout after meeting with company officials and Division 1179 of the Amalgamated Transit Union for four hours at the International Hotel at Kennedy International Airport.

title: Energy Dept. Accuses 9 Refiners Of $1.18 Billion Oil Overcharges
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6  Department of Energy investigators announced today the filing of formal charges against nine major oil refiners, accusing them of having overcharged the public by $1.18 billion from 1973 to 1976.

title: Quaker: Strength in Diversity?
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 6  When a recession is coming, among the first businessmen to hear the approaching footsteps are those who deal in staple foods, such as the executives at the centuryold Quaker Oats ompany.

title: G.O.P. Keeps Erie Executive Post
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 6  Edward J. Rutkowski, the Republican incumbent, handily won a full twoyear term as Erie County Executive today, but with most of the vote counted and one race still neck and neck, it appeared possible that the Democrats could regain a majority of the 20member County Legislature.

title: Mortgages Move Higher
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (Reuters) Mortgage rates for new singlefamily homes reached a record high in October and may be even higher this month, the Federal Home Loan Bank Board revorted today.

title: TV Networks Deny Violating Law By Denying Time to Carter Group
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (UPI)  The three commercial television networks denied today that they had violated the law by refusing to sell a halfhour of prime time to President Carter's reelection committee in early December.

title: McEnroe Drops a Set, Then Defeats Israeli
description: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 6 (UPI)  John McEnroe, taken by suprise by an unheralded player, pulled out a tough 60, 36, 63 victory over Shlomo Glickstein of Israel today in the first round of the $175,000 Stockholm open tennis tournament.

title: Bazargan Resignation Follows Long Internal Fight
description: The resignation of Prime Minister Mehdi Bazargan of Iran culminated a ninemonth struggle by him and his supporters to exercise the powers that civil governments normally have.

title: Holy Name in Brooklyn: The Babe
description: Babe Herman was 76 years old last June 26, baseball age.

title: FLOYD GAHMAN
description: Floyd Gahman, a realist painter, died last Thursday in St. Luke's Hospital. He was 85 years old.

title: Upstate Skeleton Linked To Erie County Slayings
description: BATAVIA, N.Y., Nov. 6 (AP)  A skeleton found last week in Cattaraugus County has been identified and linked to two slayings in Erie County, according to the state police here.

title: Macchiarola Cautions On Holocuaust Studies
description: Calling the Holocaust a universal lesson, School Chancellor Frank J. Macchiarola said yesterday that teachers must insist on a complete view of the event in social studies textbooks.

title: Questions and Answers on Providing Food to Cambodians
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6  The United States has pledged $69 million to help check starvation among Cambodians, which President Carter has said could become a tragedy of genocidal proportions.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Blasius Industries, a plastics and chemicals manufacturer based in Clifton, N.J., has named Thomas Riddles vice president and chief engineer.

title: F.A.A. Seeks Fine of $1.5 Million For Tnairworthy Braniff Flights
description: The Federal Aviation Administration moved yesterday to impose a record fine of $1.5 million against Braniff International Airways for conducting hundreds of flights with planes that were allegedly unairworthy.

title: Rise Is Sought In Silver Limit
description: The board of directors of New York's Commodity Exchange Inc. has voted to increase the daily trading limit for silver to 50 cents from 90 cents, subject to Government approval.

title: Hua Winds Up West Europe Trip
description: ROME, Nov. 6  Prime Minister Hua Guofeng, ending his visit to Western Europe, left Rome for the long flight back to Peking today. He had been touring France, West Germany, Britain and Italy for 23 days in the first visit ever by a Chinese head of government.

title: Wall Posters in Peking Raise Election Issues
description: PEKING, Nov. 6 Printed wall posters appeared in Peking today urging candidates for local elections now under way in the capital to support a policy of allowing Chinese to emigrate abroad freely and take up jobs overseas.

title: GORDON C. LANGE
description: Gordon C. Lange, an environmental consultant, died last Friday at Taylor Hospital in Philadelphia. He was 71 years old. He lived in Swarthmore, Pa.

title: Cyclone Strikes a German Town
description: CLOPPENBURG, West Germany, Nov. 6 (Reuters)  A cyclone swept through the outskirts of this northwestern town today, ripping off roofs and injuring at least 15 persons, the police reported.

title: Cardinals Hear Vatican Financial Data for First Time
description: ROME, Nov. 6  The College of Cardinals received information today on the Vatican's finances, which have been kept secret even from them for many centuries, but the data will not be made public.

title: Jersey Transit Bonds Pass
description: TRENTON, Nov. 6  Voters in New Jersey approved a $475 million bond issue for transportation today while rejecting a smaller $95 million issue for higher education, and voted to retain Democratic control of the 80member State Assembly.

title: Chinese Minister to Visit Nepal
description: KATMANDU, Nepal, Nov. 6 (Reuters)  Foreign Minister Huang Hua of China will visit Nepal Nov. 20 to 24 and sign protocol to the 1961 boundary agreement, the Nepalese Foreign Ministry said.

title: A Law Limiting Gas Station Ads Is Found Invalid
description: A Westchester County law restricting the way gasoline stations may advertise prices has been struck down by the New York Court of Appeals as an unconstitutional infringement on free speech.

title: FoodProfit Dip Seen as Costs Rise
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (AP)  Profits for the food industry should decline next year even though consumers will probably be paying at least 8 percent more for food, the Agriculture Department predicted today.

title: In Iran Crisis: Few Choices
description: Old cannons were inscribed in Latin with the slogan, the last argument of kings. Today, force is the last and most dangerous option open to a superpower caught, as the United States now is, in a seemingly insoluble situation in Teheran.

title: Sports Today
description: HARNESS RACING

title: Third Army Recruiter Acquitted
description: FORT BRAGG, N.C., Nov. 6 (AP)  A third Army recruiter was acquitted at a courtmartial today in the military's investigation of alleged widespread recruitine violations. The panel deliberated for 20 minutes before finding Sgt. 1st Class Harvey Lloyd, 35 years old, not guilty of failing to report malpractice by subordinate recruiters, possessing illegal test materials and threatening a subordinate. Sgts. 1st Class Marshall Brent Jackson of Charlotte and Clyde J. Waltman of WinstonSalem, were acquitted last week.

title: The Legacy of Chappaquiddick
description: What now about Chappaquiddick? Is it an issue in the 1980 campaign? Obviously. But what, precisely, is the issue? Is the episode only one of many private tragedies that have revealed and shaped the character of Edward Kennedy? Or is some unfinished public business lurking there, bearing even more directly on his fitness to be President?

title: TV RATINGS
description: Following are the top 1.5 national television shows of the past week (Monday, October 29, to Sunday, November 4), listed according to their rank in the ratings compiled by the A.C. Nielsen Company. A rating is a percentage of the total number of United States households with television sets.

title: CORRECTION
description: In the review of the film Don Giovanni in The Times yesterday the theater showing the film was incorrectly listed. The film is at the Plaza Theater on 58th Street east of Madison Avenue.

title: Man Is Stabbed in BMT Station
description: A man was stabbed in the stomach during a robbery attempt yesterday in front of a token booth in the BMT subway station at 59th Street and Lexington Avenue. The victim was listed in good condition at St. Luke's Hospital, according to the Transit Authority police. The identity of the man was not immediately released. The assailant escaped.

title: Semiholiday Slows Trading to a Walk
description: Without Government bonds to guide them yesterday, corporate and taxexempt fixedincome securities merely marked time. Trading was light and prices were unchanged in the semiholiday Election Day market.

title: Hawks Defeat Knicks by 9896
description: Pressure defense is a hallmark of the Atlanta Hawks' game. They thrive and survive on it.

title: Higher Dislocation Pay Urged
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (AP)  The Transportation Department recommended today that Congress increase to $25,000 the maximum payments to homeowners who were dislocated because of Federal construction projects.

title: Jaws Played to 80 Million on ABC
description: Reaching an average of 57 percent of the national television audience on ABCTV Sunday night, the motion picture Jaws was easily last week's biggest network program and the mostwatched telecast so far this season, surpassing the final game of the World Series.

title: Mayor Kucinich Concedes Defeat in Cleveland Voting
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 6  Lieut. Gov. George V. Voinovich, a Republican, defeated Mayor Dennis J. Kucinich of Cleveland tonight in a race that was widely regarded as a rejection of Mr. Kucinich's two years of abrasive politics.

title: About Real Estate; New York City Set to Gain From TaxDelinquent Parcels
description: When New York City enacted a law two years ago to speed the process of city takeover of taxdelinquent property, the principal target was residential buildings in moderateincome neighborhoods. The assumption was that blight could be retarded and housing could be redeemed at lower cost if the city could gain control of abandoned buildings sooner rather than later, before decay had infected surrounding properties.

title: The Region
description: ORANGE, N.J. (AP)  An Essex County police official told more than 50 protesters yesterday that a grand jury would hear testimony Friday in connection with last week's fatal shooting of a 17yearold by two officers.

title: Now Americans May Read What Alistair Cooke Told the British About Them
description: AMERICA and England, George Bernard Shaw once remarked, are two countries separated by the same language. And for almost four decades, that urbane Englishman Alistair Cooke has been serving as an interpreter between the two. Most Americans, of course, know him as the host of Masterpiece Theater. They are used to hearing him chat about the Bellamys or Lily Langtry while he casually relates a bit of British history relevant to the evening's show. But to Englishmen, the 70yearold Mr. Cooke remains their voice from America  the man who has broadcast a weekly Letter From America on the British Broadcasting Corporation's radio station for the last 34 years.

title: Egg Pelters Lead Koch to Accept Tighter Security
description: Mayor Koch, whose casual approach to his own safety has long concerned police officials, is about to have his personal security tightened as a result of the attack on him Monday at a convention at the New York Hilton Hotel.

title: Excerpts From Reports on South Korean Inquiry Into Murder of President Park
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 6  Following. as translated by The New York Times, are excerpts from the text of the report issued today by the joint investigation headquarters of the Martial Law Command on the assassination of President Park Chung Hee on Oct. 26:

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: Iran was reported yesterday to have stopped loading oil tankers at its major port in the Persian Gulf, and oil prices soared in the spot market. The report, stemming from industry sources, was widely circulated later by the C.I.A., the State Department and White House aides, who were unable to clarify whether the actions were related to Iranian demands that the United States return the Shah, who is in a hospital in New York. The runup in spot market prices began early in the day after reports that Iran's new oil minister would limit exports to the United States. [Page A1.]

title: Winter Wins Mississippi Governor's Race
description: JACKSON, Miss., Nov. 6  William Winter, a Democratic former Lieutenant Governor, easily defeated Gil Carmichael, a Meridian car dealer, tonight to become Mississippi's 58th Governor.

title: Mobil Canada Sets Drilling
description: CALGARY, Alberta, Nov. 6 (Reuters)  Mobil Canada Ltd., a unit of the Mobil Corporation, said today that it planned to have as many as three drilling rigs off the Grand Banks east of Newfoundland next year. Other companies that will participate in the drilling are Chevron Standard Ltd., Gulf Canada Resources Inc., PetroCanada Exploration Inc. and Columbia Gas Development of Canada Ltd.

title: Transportation Bonds Pass
description: New York voters yesterday gave their approval to a $500 million bond issue to improve rail and road transportation in the state. A strong showing in New York City and its suburbs edged out opposition from upstate voters, authorizing the state's first specialpurpose bond issue since 1974.

title: Chess:
description: Bent Larsen, the Danish grandmaster, was tied for the lead with the former world champion Mikhail Tal after 10 rounds of the Riga Interzonal tournament, but then disaster struck as he dropped three games in a row.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: Lehman Bros. Gets Part Of Schlesinger s Time

title: New Dispute Erupts in Israel Over Slaying in Lebanon
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 6  A new furor has erupted in Israel over lenient treatment of an army officer convicted in the murder of an Arab prisoner during military action in southern Lebanon. It is the second such case to emerge in recent months.

title: U.S. Is Stressing Diplomacy In Efforts to Free Hostages
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6  President Carter met with his foreign policy advisers today and decided to maintain a nonprovocative posture toward Iran in the hope that the 60 to 65 Americans detained by students in the United States Embassy in Teheran would eventually be freed.

title: Wine Talk
description: ONE of the sublime marriages of food and wine is fresh oysters with Chablis. There is something very special about the slight saltiness and silky texture of the shellfish taken off the half shell and washed down with a cold, steely mouthful of one of the world's greatest dry white table wines.

title: U. S. Explains Silence On Names of Hostages
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (AP)  A spokesman said today that the State Department had not issued a list of the hostages in the embassy in Iran for several reasons, not least because it does not know exactly who is there.

title: Cellist: Nancy Donaruma
description: ONE of the more unfortunate side effects of orchestral life is the tendency of so many players to settle into their anonymous roles and give up whatever ambitions they may have once entertained as solo artists. If the New York Philharmonic wanted to add spice to its corporate existence, it could do worse than to sponsor an annual series of chambermusic and recital programs that would lure rankandfile players out of their shells. In the absence of such a program, however, independent concerts such as the one Nancy Donaruma presented on Monday night at Carnegie Recital Hall can be wholeheartedly endorsed.

title: Health Exhibit Booths Offer Diverse Views
description: The 248 exhibit booths now in the public rooms at the New York Hilton Hotel reflect the diverse interests trying to attract the attention of the 12,000 professionals attending the 107th annual meeting there of the American Public Health Association

title: For Harbor Master of Inland City, Hardest Part of Job Is Getting It
description: EGG HARBOR CITY, N.J., Nov. 7 (AP)  It's been a long time since a boat docked here, so the new harbor master of Egg Harbor City  which is 10 miles inland  does not expect to have much to do.

title: High U.S. Interest Rates Pique Canada
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 7 Amid exasperation and frustration, Canada seems unable to veer from the same sort of high interest rates that exist in the United States.

title: Advertising
description: D.D.B. In Soft Drink Market

title: Interior Agency Changes Name
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 (AP)  After 78 years of water and power projects, there is no more Federal Bureau of Reclamation. The agency that built the Hoover and Grand Coulee dams has changed its name to the Water and Power Resources Service. Secretary of Interior Cecil D. Andrus said that changing conditions had expanded the agency's scope. The service now has responsibility for 138 water and power projects and 333 reservoirs in 17 states.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: The United States Defense Department wants the McDonnell Douglas Corporation to withdraw an offer to give Canada $545 million in cruisemissile business in exchange for Canada's $2.3 billion fighterplane contract.

title: U.S. Is Pleased With Its Record Under 1975 Helsinki Rights Pact
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7  A Government study of how the United States is observing the 1975 Helsinki accord on EastWest cooperation, while noting that its record is not perfect, concludes that its overall performance is very good, and in many cases second to none.

title: 1,385 Across Nation Are Interviewed in Poll
description: The latest New York Times/CBS News survey is based on telephone interviews conducted from Oct. 29 to Nov. 3 with 1,385 adult men and women around the United States.

title: COMMODITIES
description: Precious metals markets were buffeted again yesterday by contradictory reports from Iran, particularly those concerning the state of its oil exports, which were first said to be suspended and then reported by the White House to be continuing.

title: Fed's Rate Rise Is Criticized
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 (UPI)  The House Democratic leader, James C. Wright Jr. of Texas, charged today that high interest rates caused by a shortsighted Federal Reserve are making it impossible for most American families to buy homes. He urged a return to credit controls.

title: Carter, at Meeting With Environmental Leaders, Asks Their Support
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7  President Carter told a group of environmental leaders today that he was with them on most issues and asked them to support his policies.

title: Sutter, Cub Reliever, Is Cy Young Winner
description: In an era of specialists in sports, a raging specialist was voted the outstanding pitcher in the National League yesterday when the Cy Young Award for 1979 was bestowed on Bruce Sutter of the Chicaao Cubs bull Den.

title: Senate Heavily Supports Carter on Synthetic Fuel
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7  President Carter won a significant victory for his energy program today when the Senate heavily rejected an attempt to reduce the investment he proposed in synthetic fuel development and to eliminate the new corporation he wants to supervise the program.

title: Gold Price Down At I.M.F. Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 (AP) Successful bids for gold auctioned by the International Monetary Fund averaged $393.55 per ounce, down sharply from last month's $412.78 record price, the I.M.F. said today.

title: IRAN OIL STILL FLOWS, ADMINISTRATION SAYS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7  The White House said today that Iranian oil exports to the United States were continuing, but widespread concern remained in the Carter Administration that Iran might impose an embargo that could upset the delicate balance of supply and demand for petroleum.

title: Notes on People
description: In his 19 terms in the House of Representatives, Wilbur D. Mills, the Arkansas Democrat, learned how to buttonhole fellow Congressmen to win their support for legislation he favored. He left Congress in 1976 when alcoholism ended his legislative career, and, after undergoing a rehabilitation program, he returned to the capital in 1977 as tax counsel to the Washington office of the New York law firm of Shea, Gould, Climenko & Casey.

title: In Half a Store, A Range of Wares
description: DAVID HEGER always wanted a little shop of his own, where he could sell his ceramics and other craftoriented accessories that he liked. He had trouble finding a location but finally, a drycleaning store rented him part of its space. The length is normal, but the width is narrow, Mr. Heger said. It's sort of like having half a store. Mr. Heger installed track lighting, put up glass shelves and started displaying his wares in his refreshingly modest and unsophisticated interior. Once a Hebrew teacher at the Dalton School, he started making and selling his ceramics a few years ago. The shop now stocks his pieces, all based on naturalistic motifs and ranging from $1.75 for a napkin holder to $65 for a large basket or planter, as well as such things as Israeli olive twig baskets ($16 to $45), American brooms from Appalachia ($9, $10, $13), handblown Mexican glasses ($3, $4), Janet Girard's painted satin pillows ($18 to $45), and Californian Barbara Takiguchi's lovely celadon and mauve porcelain bowls ($9 to $20). David Heger is at 1335 Third Avenue, between 76th and 77th Streets (2498198). The shop is open Monday to Friday, 11 A.M. to 7 P.M., and Saturday, 11 A.M. to 6 P.M.

title: Canadian Companies Go South
description: TORONTO, Nov. 7  The Canadians are coming! The Canadians are coming!

title: Sports Today
description: HARNESS RACING

title: Peak 1% Prime Set By Chase
description: The Chase Manhattan Bank raised its prime lending rate by a quarter of a percentage point yesterday to a record 15 percent.

title: Deaths
description: REEDAlbert E. of Ardsley, NY on November 6, husband of Gloria, father of Lorraine and Stacey Reed. Funeral service 12:30 PM, Thurs. day at The Edwards Funeral Home, 64 Ashford Ave, Dobbs Ferry, NY. Interment Ferncliff. In lieu of flowers contributions to The American Cancer Society, Hartsdale, NY would be appreciated.

title: Finger Surgery to Sideline Rams Haden for Season
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., Nov. 7 (AP) Pat Haden, the Los Angeles Rams quarterback, will undergo surgery Friday to repair the fractured little finger on his throwing hand and will miss the remainder of the regular National Football League season, the club announced today.

title: Hammond Dropped By Giants for Odom
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Nov. 7  Bobby Hammond says Coach Ray Perkins of the Giants has never touched the surface of my talent, but the argument is now academic.

title: Love Canal Families Unwilling to Go Home Facing. Motel Eviction
description: NIAGARA FALLS, Nov. 7  A dozen Love Canal families faced eviction from a local motel tonight, a day after the state halted payments for their temporary lodgings and asserted that it was now safe for them to return to their homes.

title: Paulette Goddard Art Collection Is Auctioned for $3.1 Million
description: The Paulette Goddard Remarque collection of Impressionist art sold last night for $3.1 million, well above the actress's and the auction house's highest expectations of up to $2.9 million.

title: The Ulster Card in American Eyes
description: It was hardly by design, but the Prime Minister of the Irish Republic, Jack Lynch, turned up in America Just as two eminent IrishAmericans, Edward Kennedy and Jerry Brown, formally announced their Presidential ambitions. So when Mr. Lynch meets President Carter today, the troubles in Northern Ireland are certain to figure prominently in the discussion. An aroused Britain could be forgiven if it saw this encounter as a case of the White House playing the green card in ethnic politics.

title: Airport Operators Call on House To Kill Waiver on Noise Deadline
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 The operators of airports in 13 metropolitan areas, including New York, came to Congress today to urge the House of Representatives to block a bill that would permit airlines to fly noisy planes beyond an already established 1985 deadline.

title: World News Briefs
description: JOHANNESBURG, Thursday, Nov. 8 (Reuters)  South Africa's ruling National Party lost its first parliamentary seat in a decade today when the antiapartheid Progressive Federal Party won a byelection in the Johannesburg suburb of Edenvale.

title: Carter Aides Weigh Rebuttals to Kennedy
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7  A twopage memorandum has begun circulating privately at the White House suggesting ways for senior officials to promote President carter, including the assertion that Senator Edward M. Kennedy has had difficulty in developing a rationale for his candidacy.

title: Agencies Aiding Cambodians
description: The following agencies are providing food and supplies for Cambodian refugees in Thailand. Those wanting to contribute to the Cambodian relief effort may write to one of them.

title: Times Appoints Development Aide
description: The New York Times Company has named William T. Kerr Jr. vice president for corporate development, Arthur Ochs Sulzberger, chairman, announced yesterday.

title: Jazz: 2 Seeking Identity
description: GAP MANGIONE, the jazz pianist who is the older brother of Chuck Mangione, the flugelhorn player and bandleader, and Lana Cantrell, a singer from Australia, have been looking toward somewhat similar goals for the last dozen years, a search that has brought them together this week at the Grand Finale, 210 West 70th Street, where they are appearing separately, with their own groups, through Sunday.

title: Penn Central Accuses Reliance Chief Of Unlawful Scheme to Gain Control
description: Only one year after its successful emergence from lengthy bankruptcy proceedings, the newly rejuvenated Penn Central Company disclosed yesterday that it appeared to be facing a takeover battle with Saul P. Steinberg, board chairman, president and chief executive officer of the Reliance Group.

title: 3 Youths Go on Trial in Brooklyn In the Slaying of an Orthodox Jew
description: Three Brooklyn youths accused of slaying a 65yearold Orthodox Jew during a street robbery last year went on trial yesterday in State Supreme Court in Brooklyn before Justice Sybil Hart Kooper.

title: New York Primary Law, Drafted To Aid Kennedy, May Hurt Him
description: The new Presidential primary rules in New York  considered when they were designed as an aid to Senator Edward M. Kennedy, who was then a potential candidate  could hurt the Senator, now that he is a declared candidate.

title: Bette Midler Takes Her Party in Stride
description: IN THE film The Rose, Bette Midler plays a harddrinking hardrock singer who eventually keels over dead from an overdose of drugs. So it seemed only right that the film's glittery opening night party at Roseland was held for the benefit of Phoenix House, the drugfree therapeutic community.

title: Houston Oil Sells Interest in Coal Mine
description: The Houston Oil and Minerals Corporation said its Australian subsidiary ha sold a 40 percent interest in a big coalmining project in central Queensland to M.I.M. Holdings Ltd., based in Queensland, for $30 million.

title: The Dance: A Premiere Of Rainbow
description: JAMES CUNNINGHAM'S Rainbow Bridge, which had its premiere Tuesday night in the Dance Umbrella series, at the Camera Mart/Stage One, 460 West 54th Street, turned out be unexpectedly poignant.

title: After Kucinich Loss, Ohio Moves to Aid Cleveland
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 7  The official tally of yesterday's mayoral election here had not even begun before George V. Voinovich. the victor. was taking on the first task of a term that will not begin officially until he is sworn in Monday  a trip to Columbus to discuss a state program to get Cleveland out of default.

title: World Gold
GARDENING
description: SUNLESS apartments with north facing windows need not be without live greenery. Success lies in the right choices of plants. Many excellent plants will flourish in limited light.

title: Iran Unrest Depresses Stocks
description: Wall Street's growing concern over the turmoil in Iran depressed stock prices yesterday, with the Dow Jones industrial average closing below 800 for the first time this year.

title: Mississippi GovernorElect Plans To Guide State to Turning Point
description: JACKSON, MiSS., Nov. 7 It was past 2 A.M., and, though his blue Oxfordcloth shirt was wrinkled from the hugs of hundreds of wellwishers, the newly elected Governor's striped tie was still snug under a buttoneddown collar.

title: Shielding Furniture and Lungs From Soot
description: DUST, a quaint euphemism for the black stuff that seeps through New York windows and heads straight for white upholstery, can be controlled with a variety of new filtering products.

title: HOUSE PASSES A BILL MANDATING MINIMUM FOR WELFARE CHECKS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7  The House of Representatives voted by a narrow margin today to guarantee a national minimum welfare payment to poor families with children and to make other, more modest changes in the welfare system.

title: SEOUL SAID TO PLAN END OF MARTIAL LAW
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 7  The South Korean Government, gratified by the calm public reaction to the murder of President Park Chung Hee on Oct. 26, intends to end martial law fairly soon, according to a senior official today.

title: MANY NATIONS ASSAIL SEIZURE OF EMBASSY
description: The seizure of the United States Embassy in Teheran and the holding of about 60 Americans there by militant Iranian students has brought largely negative reactions from officials and newspapers around the world. Particularly strong condemnation has come from some Moslem countries.

title: Deaths
description: CUTLEREll H., on Nov. 5, 1979, beloved husband of Beverly, devoted father of Barbara Helfgott of La Jolla, Calif., loving grandfather of Emlly Ann and Amanda Jane. A Private service has been held. In lieu of flowers, a memorial contribution to the Heart Fund would be appreciated.

title: HUGH D. COMBS
description: Hugh D. Combs, a lawyer and former senior executive vice president of the United States Fidelity and Guaranty Company in Baltimore, died Tuesday in a nursing home in Annapolis. He was 89 years old and a resident of Baltimore.

title: Bills Hope Ferguson Doesn't Forget Jets
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Nov. 7  By now, Joe Ferguson can remember his telephone number. But he still does not remember last Sunday.

title: Market Place
description: Sharon Issue And Fed Policy

title: Klan Saw the Permit For Parade by Its Foes 2 Days Before Killings
description: GREENSBORO, N.C., Nov. 7 (AP) A man who identified himself as a member of the Ku Klux Klan was given a copy of the parade permit for an antiKlan rally two days before gunmen killed five persons at the demonstration, the police said today.

title: Books of The Times
description: In William Golding's first new novel in 12 years, we are introduced to madness, suicide, sadism, castration, witchery, robbery, drugs, kidnapping, terrorism, two devastating fires, Original Sin, predestination, Puritanism, mock crucifixion, selfbaptism, the higher order of cherubim and seraphim, Transcendentalism, entropy, sibling rivalry, Australia, lizards, chess, electronic surveillance, the gratuitous murder of a baby chick and, of course, John Milton, whose darkness visible in Paradise Lost illuminates Regions of sorrow, doleful shades, where peace/And rest can never dwell.

title: Saudi Ability to Lift Oil Output Doubted
description: Saudi Arabia may be unable to increase oil production much beyond its current level of 9.5 million barrels a day until some time next spring, according to several oil industry specialists interviewed yesterday.

title: Leading Peking Dissident Loses Appeal in High Court
description: PEKING, Nov. 7  An appeal of a 15year prison sentence by a dissident, Wei Jingsheng, was rejected by a high court yesterday. He was found guilty last month of having passed military secrets to foreign reporters and of having engaged in counterrevolutionary activities.

title: Remnants of an Era: Two Silent Stores
description: IT was not the marketing of opulence. It catered to anything except expensive excess. It was an idea based on frugality and the most for the least. It was, in fact,a matter of nickels and dimes; it was that great American institution, the fiveandten.

title: Governor's Pitch Draws Fine
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 7 (UPI)  Jerold C. Hoffberger, the former owner of the Baltimore Orioles, said today that he had been fined $2,500 by Bowie Kuhn, commissioner of baseball, for allowing Gov. Harry Hughes of Maryland to throw out the first ball at the second game of the World Series.

title: Sales Help Wanted 2677
description: SALES MANAGER DEALER PROGRAM

title: Soviet Agrees to Aid U.S. on Deportations of Nazis
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 (UPI) Attorney General Benjamin R. Civiletti said today that the Soviet Union had agreed to provide critical evidence and witnesses to help find and deport Nazi war criminals.

title: Poles Line Up To See Healer From the West
description: WARSAW, Nov. 7  The phenomenon of faithhealing is sweeping Poland in the person of a thin, intense, curlyhaired Canadian miracle worker named Clive Harris.

title: News Summary
description: International

title: Dividends
description: x2 for 1 split approved, payble & record dates unannounced.

title: FREDERICK ILSON
description: Frederick Ilson, a manufacturer of women's sportswear, died Monday at St. Clare's Hospital. He was 89 years old and lived on West 73d Street.

title: Satellite Photograph
description: Yesterday's Weather at 1 P.M.: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration/UPI

title: Bonn Aerospace Program
description: BONN, Nov. 7 (Reuters)  The West German Government approved a research and development program of about $722 million for the aerospace industry covering the period 197982, the technology ministry said today.

title: City Opera: A New Team In New Tito
description: THE New York City Opera gave its last performance this fall of its new production of La Clemenza di Tito on Tuesday night, and in its wonted fashion threw in a second team of singers. Only Thomas Moser, in the role of Titus, remained from the original cast. The replacements were Martha Sheil as Vitellia, Elizabeth Hynes as Servilia, Eunice Hill as Annius and Ralph Bassett as Publius. Mimi Lerner made her debut with the company as Sextus. Julius Rudel was again the conductor.

title: Sales Help Wanted 2677
description: If you're looking to make a higher income with the ease of taking candy from a baby, we have full & part time positions for individuals with outgoing personalities who enloy meeting people in motor dept stores. Call Mike Cohan MonFri 115, 7386352.

title: Money
description: Prime Rate;1515

title: Californians Vote to Restrict Busing and Spending
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 7  After 16 months of living under the fiscal constraints of Proposition 13, California voters yesterday added another limitation on government spending by adopting an amendment to the State Constitution that forbids spending increases in excess of the rates of inflation and population growth.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: HELLO, DOLL! Mame back, and about time. In a new reprise of the Broadway hit, the St. Bart's Players in midtown are serving up the popular Jerry Herman score and the breezy fable of a madcap, highstepping aunt, as adapted by Jerome Lawrence and Robert E. Lee from Patrick Dennis's novel. The show opens tonight and will run for 10 performances at the annex showcase of St. Bartholomew's Episcopal Church, Park Avenue and 50th Street. The Players have already won plaudits for Anything Goes, South Pacific, Guys and Dolls, Kiss Me, Kate and other revivals.

title: Stage: Devour the Snow, Sin of Survival
description: PERHAPS this is true of all horror stories. But in an absorbing horror story called Devour the Snow, newly arrived at the Golden, it is very, very clear that the real victims are the survivors.

title: The Burden Of Barry Beck
description: Through too many decades, the New York Rangers have had too many defensemen who were either polished or pugnacious. But none were both. Brad Park, Harry Howell and Bill Gadsby were stylish AllStars, but none had the soul of a bouncer. Lou Fontinato twice led the National Hockey League in penalty minutes; he also led his coaches to distraction. Oldtimers still rave about Ching Johnson, a bald and smiling executioner who was an AllStar twice, but half a century ago a defenseman seldom strayed beyond center ice. Now, however, Barry Beck, liberated from the Colorado Rockies for five players, provides th e Rangers with a dimension on defense that they have never had before. Barry Beck can shoot, skate. cnecK and maintain law and order in a sometimes riotous sport. At 6 feet 3 inches and 215 pounds, he is big enough to be a pro football linebacker. On skates, he is immense. More importantly, he appears mature enough, even at age 22, to shoulder the burden of having been obtained specifically to help the Rangers win the Stanley Cup for the first time in 40 years.

title: Archdiocese Increasing Its Ministry to Divorced Catholics
description: The Archdiocese of New York is increasing its ministry to divorced Roman Catholics, continuing a trend begun in many other dioceses in the United States.

title: U.S. Women Pros Rout Japanese in Team Golf
description: YOKAHOMA, Japan, Nov. 7 (AP) A United States women's professional golf team, led by Amy Alcott, beat a Japanese team by 11 strokes today in a $100,000, 36hole match.

title: Backlog Growing At Gates Learjet
description: The Gates Learjet Corporation, the Kansasbased aircraft builder, said that in October it received orders for 39 new business jets valued at more than $100 million.

title: About Jericho
description: JERICHO, L.I.  As bigtime production goes, the Jericho Cider Mill's plant on Route 106 in Nassau County is a Toonerville Trolley of an assembly line. It is a modest affair when on thinks of Detroit, where steel goes in one end and cars come out the other, but it is efficient at what it does.

title: Deaths
description: SIMEmily Nichols, 73, of Flemington, N.J., formerly of Yonkers, N.Y., on Nov. 5, 1979. Liturgy of Christian burial, 9:30 AM, Thursday, No. 8, 1979, from the Immaculate Conception Church, Annandale, N.J. Interment Woodlavm Cemetery, Bronx, N.Y.

title: How Fragile the Oil Machine
description: The disarray in Iran is another reminder of the growing vulnerability of the West. Even a suspicion that Iranian oil production had stopped again caused oil prices to shoot up overnight. And Iran, which in October exported fewer than 3 million barrels a day, is not the only Persian Gulf nation upon which the West depends. Saudi Arabia is the main exporter at 9 million barrels a day. But Iraq provides 3 million barrels, Kuwait more than 2 million, the United Arab Emirates nearly 2 million, and Qatar, Bahrain and Oman almost 1 million. World supplies are so tight that even a millionbarrel shortfall could cause further economic hardship across the globe.

title: Lamps Made From PhotoSupply Equipment
description: MICHAEL RUBIN and Henry SmithMiller,of the New York firm Rubin SmithMiller Architects, assembled two lamps from parts that can be bought at any wellstocked photography supply store. This kind of lamp is part of a tradition that includes Le Corbusier, Jos Luis Sert and Michael Graves, Mr. SmithMiller said. There's nothing new about it, it's a classic. Added Mr. Rubin: We just updated one of the lamps with the diffusing shield.

title: Mrs. Carter Leaves for Thailand To Examine Plight of Refugees
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 (UPI)  President Carter dispatched his wife, Rosalynn, on a mission to Thailand today to demonstrate the deep concern of the American people over the plight of the Cambodian refugees.

title: More Cuts Are Indicated In G.M. Car Production
description: DETROIT, Nov. 7  The General Motors Corporation, the nation's largest manufacturer of automobiles, may make further cutbacks in fourthquarter automobile production, Thomas A. Murphy, the company chairman, strongly indicated today.

title: French HeroCriminal Gets Life in Absentia
description: NICE, France, Nov. 7 (UPI)  The confessed mastermind of a $4 million bank theft who has eluded the police for over two years will spend the rest of his life in prison  if he is caught.

title: Kennedy Seems Pleased By Question About Wife
description: BOSTON, Nov. 7  There were boos and hisses this morning from the supporters and friends in Faneuil Hall when a reporter asked Senator Edward M. Kennedy what role his wife Joan might play in the coming campaign.

title: Columbia Move By Kerkorian
description: The president of Columbia Pictures Industries, Francis T. Vincent Jr., told shareholders at the company's annual meeting yesterday that he had just been informed of a new development centering on a 25 percent stake in the company currently owned by Kirk Kerkorian. the West Coast businessman.

title: CARTER TEAM WAITS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7  The United States clung to a slim hope tonight that a twoman mission sent by President Carter would be allowed into Iran to seek the release of the detained Americans despite a seeming rejection of talks by Iran's ruler, Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini.

title: Hospital Forced To Oust Patients With Psychoses
description: The first patient discharged in what has become a weekly effort to relieve overcrowding in the adult wards of the Kings County Psychiatric Hospital was a young man whose parents came for him Monday.

title: Technology
description: Cutting Costs For the Cities

title: 29 Auto Woodworkers Termed Cancer Victims
description: DETROIT, Nov. 7 (AP)  At least 29 automobile workers who handled chemically treated wood dust at three automobile companies have died of cancer, a Detroit newspaper reported today.

title: Theaters to Collect for Cambodia
description: Joseph Papp, a founder of the Theater Committee for Relief to Cambodian Refugees, said yesterday at a news conference that, for the first time, legitimate theaters would allow the collection of money from audiences for a cause other than the Actors Fund.

title: The City
description: The man accused of pushing Renee Katz in front of a subway train last June has passed a lie detector test in which he denied attacking the teenager,a defense attorney said.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: A Familiar Name in Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 7  In the fall of 1963, William Joseph Green 3d, then 25 years old, was riding in a hotel elevator. With him was his father, a Congressman and leader of the Democratic City Committee in Philadelphia, and President Kennedy.

title: Special U. S. Envoys Have Met Ayatollah Before
description: The two special envoys that Washington named to attempt to gain freedom for the 60 Americans held hostage in the United States Embassy in Teheran have had contacts with and expressed admiration for the movement that deposed Shah Mohammed Riza Pahlevi early this year.

title: Yields On Bonds Climb
description: Yields new taxexempt bonds were increased sharply yesterday as municipal bond prices fell in the face of uncertainty in Iran, a weaker dollar and declines in other sectors of the credit markets. The higher yields did not cause investors to rush to buy the new issues.

title: One Fight for Women's Rights: A Coal Miner's Life and Death
description: COALPORT, Pa., Nov. 2 What he would not forget, after he had left the hospital where she lay, still in her sweatshirt and long underwear and coveralls, on an emergency room cart, was that there was nothing to suggest she was dead.

title: $23 Extra Payout At Western Pacific
description: Western Pacific Industries, in a highly unusual move, announced yesterday that it would pay an extraordinary dividend of 323 a share. or $60 million, to its stockholders and set aside plans to expand through acquisition of another company.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Of Bs and Gs
description: The English language, in its generosity, once supplied two very useful words to describe male children and female children. The terms boy and girl were innocent in their connotations and in fact suggested innocence itself. They are innocent no longer. Both words are threatened with extinction, at least in polite discourse, and we are hard put to think of congenial substitutes.

title: Brown's Only Hope Is For Yale to Lose
description: The difference between Yale's perfect Ivy League football record (50) and Brown's 41 mark is the length of a forearm. That is how Yale's Mike Sullivan scored the winning touchdown in the final period  by extending his arm, with the ball in his hand, just over the goal line  after he apparently had been stopped by Brown on a fourthdown plunge.

title: In Pursuit of WellDesigned Table Lamps
description: AMID softly lighted dinner tables, colorfully lighted parties and functionally lighted kitchens, there is still a need for table lamps. And the city's retail stores provide a wide array of striking designs that will add interest to a room and fit into a lighting budget.

title: 79 Elections: No Big Victor
description: The 1979 elections seem more like a collection of fluttering ribbons than anyone's banner year. But some messages emerged from Tuesday's election results and in the postmortems of party professionals: Republican resurgence is still a tentative thing, and incumbency is not the fatal flaw it was beginning to be considered.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: The 197475 bookcollaboration project between John Z. DeLorean, flamboyant, nonconformist former top executive of the General Motors Corporation, and J. Patrick Wright, a writer, about Mr. DeLorean's life at G.M. has finally borne fruit. But there is an apparent controversy over what has actually emerged.

title: Deaths
description: MATTHEWSVIctoria Corse Thorne. Peacefully at her home 19 Riverview Drive, Toronto Canada M4N3C6 on Monday November 5, 1979. Daughter of the late Dr. & Mrs. Victor Thorne. Beloved wife of Albert Bruce Matthews. Dear mother of Bryn, Victor Bruce and Taddy (Mrs. Peter Harris). Dear sister of Jonathan Thorne of Florida and Stewart Thorne of Stamford Connecticut. A family service was held on Wednesday November 6. Interment Mt Pleasant cemetery, Toronto. A memorial service will be held at Yorkminster Park Baptist Church, Toronto on Monday, November 12 at 4PM.

title: City Says It Has Sufficient Fuel
description: The head of the city's Housing Preservation and Development Department said yesterday that there would be a sufficient supply of home heating fuel for New York City residents. Commissioner Anthony B. Gliedman made the prediction at a public hearing held by the Assembly's Housing Committee. I think we will have a sufficient supply of fuel, he said. The question is: Will the owners be able to afford it? Mr. Glideman said the city had stockpiled 60 million gallons of heating oil that would be available for 4,100 cityowned apartment buildings.

title: G.O.P. Gains in Rockland Voting
description: NEW CITY, N.Y., Nov. 7  Voters in Rockland County yesterday reduced the Democrats edge over Republicans in the County Legislature and imposed a new, lowered ceiling on county property taxes.

title: Opera: Ariadne Sung By Viennese in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 The final Vienna State Opera production of its visit to the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts was Richard Strauss's Ariadne auf Naxos, which received the first of three performances last night.

title: Awards To Honor Black Stage
description: Ten musical and dramatic productions and more than 60 people have been nominated to receive Audelco Recognition Awards created to insure that quality black theater productions and black theater productions will be recognized in the annals of theater history.

title: Shah Said to Offer to Leave U.S.
description: The deposed Shah of Iran, Mohammed Riza Pahlevi, offered to leave the United States at once from his sickbed to ease the crisis that has arisen because of his hospitalization here, according to friends who have seen him recently.

title: EARNINGS
description: The CocaCola Company yesterday reported a 13.9 percent profit increase in the third quarter on a sales gain of 8.3 percent.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Where to Turn for Special Lighting Parts
description: WHAT more can I say  it's not a very romantic business, said David Lyons, after enumerating the various lamp bulbs and spare parts carried by his store, Rosetta Electric Company. True enough. But some people, especially those who have wasted hours searching hardware stores, might get excited by Rosetta's endless bins of plugs, sockets and strangelooking bulbs.

title: Monthly Take Off at Casinos
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Nov. 7 (AP) The boardwalk's two legal casinos here took in $33.22 million during October, or an average of $1.07 million a day, the New Jersey Casino Control Commission reported today.

title: WoodBurning Stoves on Display
description: An exhibition entitled Potbelly opened this week at the New York Hall of Science and will continue through the winter. It is designed to explain and demonstrate the technology behind these stoves as well as fireplaces.

title: The Voters Speak, Gently
description: The random and parochial elections Tuesday could not possibly provide a coherent political pattern. Antibusiness populism failed to rescue Cleveland's embattled young mayor, Dennis Kucinich. Outrage over utility rates failed to pass a takever of Con Ed in New York's Westchester County. Rent control was approved in Baltimore but defeated in San Francisco. Californians who invented Proposition 13 put a cap on state and local budgets, but such virtue is easy so long as Federal subsidies keep flowing. The once mighty DemocraticFarmerLabor party of Minnesota rallied to make Donald Fraser mayor of Minneapolis. The dreams of a national Republican resurgence that would capture governorships in Kentucky and Mississippi turned out to be premature.

title: Bolivia Leader Ends Martial Law
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Nov. 7 (AP)  Col. Alberto Natusch Busch, who proclaimed himself President after a coup on Thursday, suspended martial law and press censorship today and announced he would permit elections.

title: Newest Nation Sets Election
description: KINGSTOWN, St. Vincent, Nov. 7 (Reuters)  Prime Minister Milton Cato has called general elections for Dec. 5, six weeks from the day when St. Vincent and the Grenadines gained independence. Four political parties are expected to put up candidates. The tiny state gained its independence from Britain on Oct. 27.

title: ESSAY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7  If the United States were to take over an African nation, round up thousands of its children, and ship them back to U.S. training centers for forced capitalist indoctrination, cries of kidnapping, brainwashing and even a new slavery would ring through an outraged third world.

title: Jersey Is Taking Over Trenton Schools
description: TRENTON, Nov. 7  Citing gross mismanagement by the Trenton Board of Education, Dr. Fred G. Burke, the New Jersey Education Commissioner, announced today that he would place control of the 16,000pupil school system in the hands of an independent monitor general to be appointed by him.

title: Korea Authorizes Projects
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 7 (AP) South Korea's new Government said today that it had authorized four foreign concerns to invest $16 million in three separate projects. One approval was for the Corning International Corporation of the United States to increase its equity investment in the SamsungCorning Company. The other approvals called for Lazard Brothers & Company and Barclays Bank International Ltd., both of Britain, to increase their combined capital share in the Korea Merchant Banking Corporation, and for the Lotte Company of Japan to make an additional investment in the Lotte Livestock Company.

title: Holmes, Tate Agree To Meet for Crown
description: At a riotous news conference  even Leon Spinks showed up early  Larry Holmes yesterday accepted John Tate's challenge for a fight to eliminate half the world's heavyweight boxing champions, and Don King challenged his rival promoter, Bob Arum, to a bout on the undercard with twominute rounds and 10ounce gloves.

title: Sales Help Wanted 2677
description: WITH BROAD PRODUCT KNOWLEDGE, CAPABLE OF SERVICING NATIONAL DISTRIBUTORS AND OEM CUSTOMERS.

title: Squibb Wage Compliance
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 (AP)  The Council on Wage and Price Stability said today that E.R. Squibb & Sons Inc. Of Princeton, N.J., was complying with the nation's antiinflation program. The council had ruled in August that the pharmaceutical company appeared to be violating the council's voluntary price standard.

title: G.O.P. Picks Up 10 Seats;In Jersey State Assembly
description: TRENTON, Nov. 7  Republicans defeated 10 incumbent Democrats seeking reelection to the State Assembly yesterday. It was the G.O.P.'s best showing in New Jersey state elections since before the Watergate scandal in 1973, when the party lost control of the State Legislature to the Democrats.

title: CURRENCY MARKETS
description: TOKYO, Nov. 7 The American dollar rose sharply in relation to the Japanese yen in today's currency trading here. The yen came under heavy selling pressure as a result of reports that Iran had suspended oil exports.

title: Angola Rebel Leader Says His Forces Are Beating Cubans
description: Jonas Savimbi jabbed a thick finger at the oilskin map of Angola and said flatly, We are winning the war against the Cubans.

title: Nets Lose To Rockets By 106101
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 7  Mike Newlin, the Nets reserve guard acquired from Houston just after the opening of the season, did not have a joyful homecoming tonight as his new team suffered its sixth consecutive loss on the road, bowing to the Rockets, 106101.

title: Britain to Ease a Few Rhodesia Sanctions Next Week
description: LONDON, Nov. 7  The British Government, expressing a new degree of optimism about the Zimbabwe Rhodesia conference here, announced today that it planned to allow a few of its economic sanctions against the breakaway colony to lapse next week.

title: A BETTER IDEA
description: TELEVISION sets, especially when they're turned off, aren't much to look at. For television addicts who can't live with or without their sets, the designer Anthony Lombardo has found a solution.
