title: New Face: Greg Mullavey
description: AT the Barrymore Theater the other night the audience suddenly interrupted the third act of Bernard Slade's Romantic Comedy to applaud the performance of a supporting actor playing a sensitive and slightly battered journalist.

title: Around the Nation
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 22 (AP) precautionary fire watch was maintained today against any rekindling of a blaze that briefly closed the San FranciscoOakland Bay Bridge and sent clouds of deadly chemical fumes into the sky.

title: Diseased Livestock Linked to Upstate Cattle Dealer
description: PATTERSON, N.Y.  The New York State Commission of Investigation is looking into charges that one of the state's largest cattle dealers smuggled hundreds of diseased cattle into New York by driving them across some flat desolate spot along the Canadian border, falsified health documents for the animals and resold them to unsuspecting fariners in other states and countries, according to sources close to the inquiry.

title: Clifton Is Victor, 63, On Late Touchdown
description: Dave Kaptein threw a 15yard touchdown pass to Bob Daley with one minute 12 seconds left in the game yesterday to give oncebeaten Clifton a 63 victory over Bloomfield at Clifton. Clifton (91), which will meet Passaic Val- ley for the North Jersey, Section 1, Group 4 title next week, marched 65 yards in nine plays for its touchdown. Randy Caligaro ran 25 yards to the Bloomfield 11yard line to set up the score. Bloomfield (36) had taken a 30 lead earlier in the final period when Ed Kozak kicked a 40yard field goal, following Darryl Brown's key interception.

title: Body of an L.1. Youth Discovered in a Marsh Near Kennedy Airport
description: The body of an I8-year-old student, home from an upstate New York college for the holidays, was found in a marsh north of Kennedy International Airport yesterday.

title: For Warhol Show, a Festive Opening.
description: There were French aristocrats and jetsetters from Argentina; movie stars; young groupies and elderly doyennes  all drawn together for one of those special New York evenings.

title: Books of TheTimes
description: IT seems so obvious when you look at the big picture. Here's this wonderful tool of ours, the internalcombustionpowered automobile, a box on wheels in which we can

title: Miner Killed in Alabama
description: ADGER, Ala., Nov. 22 (AP)  A West End miner was killed by falling rock last night, causing the shutdown of a Jim Walters mine in Adger pending investigation by state and Federal officials. Bessemer Carraway Hospital officials said Monroe Robinson, 26 years old, was dead of head wounds when he arrived for treatment.

title: Oil Outlook Worrying Japanese
description: TOKYO, Nov. 22  Japan has sufficient oil to keep its trilliondollar industrial economy going for the time being, but it is very hard to predict where supplies will come from after January, a senior official said here today.

title: Private Service Of Public Needs Sought in Cities
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla.  Five years ago this was just another rapidly growing Sun Belt town, attracting new businesses, building new houses and planning a new airport.

title: POLICY ON STUDENTS FROM IRAN ATTACKED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22  In Minneapolis, Iranian students who have been interviewed by Federal officials about their immigration status have been asked their views of the United States Government, Ayatollah RuhoIlah Khomeini and Shah Mohammed Riza Pahlevi.

title: Bridge:
description: CINCINNATI, Nov. 22  One of the world's great partnerships led the Blue Ribbon pair championships as the final session began at the American Contract Bridge League's Fall Nationals here tonight.

title: You Can't Call It Free Trade
description: GLENVIEW, Ill.  Public support for our international trade policy is evaporating. Americans have not lost confidence in their ability to compete but they no longer trust the Government to protect American jobs and interests against unfair and unlawful foreign trade oractices.

title: Dick Hyman in Hamptons
description: Tomorrow night at 8:30, the music for everybody series at Guild Hall in East Hampton, L.I., will feature the Dick Hyman Trio with Mr. Hyman on piano, Milt Hinton on bass and the drummer Ron Traxler. Tickets are $6 ($3 for students and the elderly). The hall is at 158 Main Street. Information: (516) 324.4050.

title: Mild Earthquake Jolts Tokyo
description: TOKYO, Nov. 22 (UPI)  A mild earthquake jolted Tokyo and surrounding areas this morning, the Japan Meteorological Agency reported. There were no reports of casualties or damage from the quake, which registered 1.0 on the Japanese earthquake scale of 8.0. The epicenter was believed to be in the southern part of Ibaraki Province, about 40 miles north of Tokyo.

title: A Hamlet
description: Shakespeare on Film will continue Sunday night at the Harold Clurman Theater, 912 West 92d Street, with screenings at 7:30 and 9:30 of the 1969 Hamlet directed by Tony Richardson and starring Nicol Williamson. The

title: Margaret Lesser Foster, Edited Children's Books
description: Margaret Lesser Foster, a retired editor of children's books, a number of which were awardwinning, died Wednesday morning in Doctor's Hospital. She was 80 years old.

title: Access Rules For Networks
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 Hardly anyone feels comfortable with the role of the Federal Government in deciding who shall have access to the airwaves, but while Congress is reexamining the rules, there seems to be no quick or obvious alternative.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAIL ING TODAY

title: CARTER'S IRAN MOVES WIN BACKING ABROAD
description: Governments and newspapers throughout much of the world are continuing to express support for President Carter in his attempts to win the release of Americans held hostage in the United States Embassy in Teheran. But some have questioned the wisdom of the decision to allow the Shah of Iran to enter this country.

title: P.L.O. HINTS AT SHIFT IN IRANIAN DEMANDS
description: TUNIS, Nov. 22  A spokesman for the Palestine Liberation Organization hinted today at a softening in the stand of the militant Islamic regime of Ayatollah Ruhllah Khomeini by saying that the hostages being held in the American Embassy in Teheran would probably be released if the deposed Shah left the United States.

title: ISRAELI COURT BARS RELEASE OF MAYOR
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 22  Israel's Supreme Court today refused to release the Mayor of Nablus, Bassam alShaka, from prison pending judicial review of an order for his deportation.

title: Advertising
description: Christmas Catalogue For TV

title: Pop Music: 4 Freshmen
description: TIME has always moved slowly for the Four Freshmen. They were actually freshmen at Butler University when the group was formed in 1947. But it took them nine years to reach Graduation Day, one of their biggest hits, which they recorded in 1956. Even after they graduated, musically, they went on being the Four Freshmen and now, 32 years after they started, the quartet has the aura of one of the older reunion classes.

title: Art People
description: Grace Glueck

title: LTV's Steel Operations Prospering After Merger
description: YOUNGSTOWN, Ohio  When the Lykes Corporation, which owned the nearly bankrupt Youngstown Sheet and Tube Company, and the LTV Corporation, which owns the Jones & Laughlin Steel Corporation, merged last fall to form the nation's thirdlargest steel company, there was considerable skepticism that the combination would prove viable.

title: Wall-to-Wall Brahms to Echo at Symphony Space
description: Wall-to-Wall Brahms! Twelve hours of his chamber music laid out from 11 A.M. to 11 P. M. tomorrow and all free, no tickets required. It's at Symphony Space which invented the wall-towall events, and the address is Broadway at 95th Street.

title: WASHINGTON A Talk With Mr. Ohira
description: TOKYO, Nov. 22  Japan is watching the turbulence in the Middle East with a kind of helpless concern, but at least with a more outspoken compassion for the United States in the present crisis.

title: Body of 2d American Is Found in Islamabad Embassy
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, Nov. 22  The body of a second American was found today in the stillsmoking ruins of the United States Embassy compound where the passionate frenzy of yesterday, when thousands of angry demonstrators trapped 90 people in a vault for nearly seven hours, seemed to have lapsed.

title: Getting the Transit Debate Moving
description: Nothing is more important to the head of a governmental agency than the first few days on the job, as Richard Ravitch, new chairman of the Metropolitan Tranportation Authority, has just demonstrated. Mr. Ravitch is taking full advantage of his honeymoon in office by asking himself and the public the right question: How shall the authority's perennial, growing operating deficit be eliminated?

title: Colleagues Offer Views on N Y. U. Professor in Drug Case
description: Several hours after Prof. John BuettnerJanusch was indicted last month on charges of converting a New York University anthropology laboratory into an illegal drug factory, several of his colleagues at the university met to toast what they saw as his downfall.

title: WEEKENDER GUIDE; Friday
description: CIRCUSES ON LONG ISLAND

title: Gromyko Warns NATO Plan Could Hurt Detente
description: BONN, Nov. 22  Foreign Minister Andrei A. Gromyko of the Soviet Union warned the North Atlantic Treaty Organization tonight that its approval of plans to upgrade its nuclear missiles in Europe could only worsen prospects for further progress in detente.

title: Piano: Lettvin Is Back
description: THEODORE LETIVIN was 11 years old when he made his debut as pianist with the Chicago Symphony Orchestra and, on Wednesday night, he returned to New York after an absence of six seasons to mark the 40th anniversary of that event with a recital at Alice Tully Hall. Mr. Lettvin has, of course, done a lot of playing over the last four decades. In fact, the biographical notes for this program stated he had performed in more than 1,600 concerts in North America, Europe, Asia and Africa. In the early days of his career, he also won a Naumburg Award, the Michaels Memorial Award and a Queen Elisabeth of Belgium Piano Competition.

title: Move to Sequester Jury Fails in RaceFixing Trial
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Nov. 22 (AP) Defense attorneys in a horse race fixing trial have unsuccessfully moved to have the jury sequestered because of expected publicity about the case.

title: Mexicans Start Listening to a Singular Leftist Voice
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 16  When Jorge Diaz Serrano, the head of Mexico's powerful oil monopoly, Pemex, went before Congress recently to defend his policies, his speech seemed to be aimed as much at a whitehaired man scribbling frantically in the visitors gallery as at the 400 deputies.

title: Three Mile Island to Get Environment Statement
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (UPI)  The Nuclear Regulatory Commission will prepare an environmental impact statement on the costly and potentially hazardous decontamination of the damaged Three Mile Island reactor near Harrisburg, Pa., it was announced yesterday.

title: Bucks Set Back Nets, 117 to 109
description: PISCATAWAY, N.J., Nov.22  The more things change, the more they remain the same. In each game there is new team to to face, a different crowd to cheer, a fresh night full of hope and determination.But no matter the time,

title: Weekend Football At a Glance
description: Other Games

title: Radio
description: 78 A.M., WNCN. Pikes de clavecin, Ordre No. 3, F. Couperin; Sonata for Organ and Guitar in D minor, Pasquini; Fugue in E flat, St. Anne, Bach; Cantata, Wachet auf, Bach.

title: Murdoch Hints Revival Of Australian Media Bid
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Nov. 22  Although Rupert Murdoch has withdrawn his $143 million offer for control of the Herald and Weekly Times Group, the biggest newspaper chain in Australia, he has indicated he might consider

title: 25 Food Establishments Fail Sanitary Inspection
description: The New York City Department of Health has released the names of 25 food establishments that it said had violated the health code.

title: PRAGUE'S HARD LINE STRAINS TIES TO U.S.
description: PRAGUE, Nov. 17  More than 30 years after the Communists came to power here, and more than 10 years after that power was consolidated by a hardline regime, Czechoslovakia and the United States are still scarcely on speaking terms.

title: Obituary 2 -- No Title
description: Death

title: $9.80 Dewan Keys Wins
description: Jeffrey Fell came up with another kind of Thanksgiving turkey yesterday, this one of the fourlegged variety. Fell finished eighth and last with oddson Music of Time as Dewan Keys ran off with the $54,940 Queens County Handicap at Aqueduct.

title: Resort at Minnewaska Closes, Victim of Own Victorian Charm
description: NEW PALTZ, N.Y., Nov. 20  One hundred years after it opened, the Lake Mirmewaska Mountain House, perched on top of the craggy cliffs of the Shawangunk Mountains here, closed its doors for the last time early this month, a victim of its own charming Victorian inefficiency.

title: Norman Name Lacks Poetry, Irks Shropshire
description: SHREWSBURY, England  Shropshire is a gentle county, a place where people seldom raise their voices.

title: Restaurants
description: MANHATTAN Market is a very urbane, twomonth old restaurant decorated with duskgray walls, glittering blackandwhite photographs of New York scenes and a back glass wall that opens on to a garden and skyscraper setting that echoes the feeling of the photographs. There also is a massive and handsome bar, which we were told, came from an old restaurant in the South Bronx, and beautiful chandeliers from a Philadelphia railroad station. Two experienced talents are at the helm. Robert Schapiro, who owns Hoexter's, has combined forces with David Liederman, a professional young American chef who trained in the kitchen of the Troisgros brothers in Roanne, France, among other places, and who also operates David's Cookie Kitchen next door.

title: Dietary Consultant, 23, Is Killed On Visit to U.S. Prison at Atlanta
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 22 (AP)  A dietary consultant from New York State was killed by an inmate with a knife while she was visiting the Atlanta Federal Penitentiary, according to the prison authorities.

title: Associated Press
description: REMEMBERING PRESIDENT KENNEDY: At Arlington National Ceme- tery, Ethel Kennedy, widow of Senator Robert F. Kennedy, placed flowers on the grave of John F. Kennedy with daughter, Rory on the anniversary of President Kennedy's death. In Dallas, scene of the assassination on Nov. 22,

title: Women Moving Into a Contentious Field Labor Arbitration
description: The graduating class was a little older than most, to be sure. And even before entering their school they were armed with a formidable array of advanced credentials, with Ph.D.'s and law degrees scattered after their names.

title: Charges Against Flynt Delayed
description: CINCINNATI, Nov. 22 (AP)  Robert S. Kraft, a Hamilton County common pleas judge, has continued until Jan. 8 several charges pending against Larry Flynt, the publisher of Hustler magazine. Mr. Flynt is charged with disseminating material harmful to juveniles and with pandering obscenity. Andrew Dennison, Mr. Flynt's Cincinnati attorney, requested the continuance yesterday because neither Mr. Flynt nor his out-oftown attorneys could be present in court at this time.

title: Shah Called Eager to Leave U. S.
description: The deposed Shah of Iran says he is eager to leave the United States and expects to return to Mexico within two weeks, Barbara Walters said last night in describing an interview she conducted with him at New York Hospital.

title: Catholic Party in Ulster Rebuffs London on Talks
description: LONDON, Nov. 22  The British Government's latest political initiative for Northern Ireland suffered a severe setback today as the principal Roman Catholic party in the province rejected it.

title: Publishing: Moles Have Their Day
description: THE big book at McGrawHill for next spring, for which the publisher has very high hopes indeed, is a 600page first novel in the fantasy mode of Richard Adams's Watership Down. Titled Duncton Wood, it is by an Oxford.. shire writer, William Horwood.

title: Art: The World Of Balcomb Greene
description: MOVEMENTS may be the stuff of art history and the easiest way of comprehending it, at least superficially. But they are of only negative use when it comes to individual artists, possibly because they have usually been established as much for pragmatic as for ideological reasons.

title: Pilot Subdues Hijacker On Flight Inside Japan
description: TOKYO, Friday, Nov. 23 (AP)  The pilot of a Japan Air Lines DC10 overpowered a lone hijacker who had forced the jetliner, with 345 passengers and a crew of 11, to land at Tokyo's new international airport at Narita, the police said.

title: SAUDIS SAY GUNMEN STILL HOLD MOSQUE
description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia, Nov. 22  The occupation of the Grand Mosque in Mecca by what were described as Islamic fundamendalists continued today, according to the Saudi Government.

title: The City
description: A 67-year-old Manhattan businessman has been convicted in Federal District Court of stealing large sums of rent money that were entrusted to him as a courtappointed receiver. The defendant, William Taub of 150 East 69th Street, faces up to five years in prison and fines of up to $11,000.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: Citicorp's announcement early this week of a management reorganization effective Jan. 1 included the promotion of many executives. But the name that most outsiders focused on at the company, which owns Citibank, was Hans H. Angermueller.

title: Barnard to Smooth the Way For People in Wheelchairs
description: Commuting to work in the morning, Julie V. Moistener knows just how fast to take the five hairpin turns along the way. She knows where she may run into pedestrians and where to swerve .so she ill, miss the bulky plastic . garbag6. bags.

title: Louis Carloni, 86, 5th Ave. Tailor; Designer of Clothes for Notables
description: MOUNT VERNON, N.Y., Nov. 22 (UPI)  Louis Carloni, who tailored and designed clothes for such people as Babe Ruth, Herbert Hoover and Loretta Young, died here Tuesday in the home where he had lived for 35 years. He was 86 years old.

title: A Mosque Is Set Afire By 3 Youths in Queens
description: The police yesterday sought three youths who set a mosque in Queens afire in an apparent protest over the holding of American hostages in Iran.

title: Three Ratelle Goals Spark Bruin Victory
description: BOSTON, Nov. 22 (UPI)  Jean Ratelle scored three goals in a game for the eighth time in his career tonight, including two during a fourgoal outburst in the Boston Bruins ninth straight victory, a 74 National Hockey League triumph over the Quebec Nordiques.

title: Ballet: Koslow Appear In Ailey's River
description: LEONID AND VALENTINA KOZLOV appeared again with the International Ballet of Caracas on Wednesday night at the City Center55th Street Theater, making their debuts in Alvin Ailey's The River.

title: The Pop Life
description: John Rockwell

title: U.S. Is Searching for Legal Remedies in Iran Crisis
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22  While continuing to maintain that the seizure of the United States Embassy in Iran is a violation of international law, the Carter Administration has begun examining possible legal remedies to strengthen its hand in pressing for release of the American hostages.

title: It's Roundup Time in Wilds of East Bolivia
description: EL CARMEN, Bolivia  Clouds of white egrets rise and wheel over the water holes as the cowboys drive the herds of humpback bulls and gray cows, with their new calves, toward the distant corrals.

title: NONAMERICANS FREE
description: TEHERAN, Nov. 22  Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini repeated tonight the threat of the students holding the American embassy to blow it up and destroy their hostages if attacked, and appeared to give it his assent. We cannot control these youths, he said.

title: U.S. Olympic Six Bows To Canadian Team, 76
description: CALGARY, Alberta, Nov. 22 (AP) Joe Grant scored on a 15foot slap shot with less than 10 seconds remaining to give Canada's Olympic hockey team a penaltyriddled 76 victory over the United States Olympic team last night.

title: South Africa Asks AntiRed Drive
description: JOHANNESBURG, Nov. 22  Prime Minister P. W. Botha formally opened his drive for a new antiCommunist alignment of nations in southern Africa today, telling businessmen at a conference here that the alliance would not be a fortress of isolation, but rather a bastion of freedom.

title: Donald Sanders, 64, Staff Writer And Editor for Associated Press
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (AP)  Donald Sanders, a staff writer and editor for The Associated Press since 1941, died today of cancer. He was 64 years old.

title: Ruling Party Wins 5 of 9 Seats in Ghana Legislative ByElection
description: ABIDJAN, Ivory Coast, Nov. 22 (Reuters)  Ghana's ruling Peoples National Party has won seven of the nine parliamentary seats contested in last week's byelections, the Ghanaian press reported today.

title: 13 Hostages Get a Joyful Welcome And Say Little of Captivity in Iran
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22  Thirteen hostages freed from the United States Embassy in Teheran arrived here today to an emotiol'il ThanksgiVing Day wel come from their ???. But the homecoming was muted by continued concern for the safety of 49 other Americans still captive in Iran.

title: Kerlan, Sports Physician, Stable After Heart Attack
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Nov. 22 (AP)  Dr. Robert Kerlan, the renowned orthopedic specialist and team doctor for the Los Angeles Rams football team, the Los Angeles Lakers basketball team and the California Angels baseball team, was reported in stable condition today after suffering a heart attack.

title: Blocked Punt Lifts Seaford
description: Seaford defeated Wantagh, 70, yesterday after blocking a punt into the end zone with only 18 seconds left in the Nassau nonleague game.

title: Miller Due For Talks In Mideast
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22  G. William Miller, Secretary of the Treasury, leaves tonight for a fiveday swing through the Persian Gulf countries.

title: Mendola Stars For Belleville
description: Len Mendola carried 16 times for 176 yards and scored five touchdowns as Belleville overpowered Kearny, 500, at Belleville. Mendola tied a school

description: Warning Given On Options Plan

title: Iranians Talk to Kurds About Autonomy Issue
description: MEHABAD, Iran, Nov. 22 (Reuters) Representatives of the Iranian revolutionary leader, Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini, are holding talks with leaders of Iran's ethnic Kurds on Kurdish demands for autonomy.

title: Radio City Is Staging A Christmas Spectacular
description: No Santa Claus with a bagful of presents could be as filled with gleeful anticipation these days as Robert F. Jani, the producer of the Radio City Music Hall's Christmas spectacular, which opens today and will run through Jan. 6. Mr. Jani has packed the 90-

title: 2 in Jersey Accused Of Acting in Concert To Slay Their Wives
description: HOBOKEN, N.J., Nov. 22 (AP)  Two 25-year-old men acted together to kill their wives, one of whom was seven months pregnant, according to the police in this milesquare city near the entrance to the Holland Tunnel.

title: Terrorists and 2 Seamen Jailed By Israelis for Attack on Tel Aviv
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 22 (Reuters)  Five Arabs who admitted that they had intended to carry out a terrorist raid against Tel Aviv were sentenced by a military court today to 22 years in prison. A sixth Arab was sentenced to 10 years.

description: Deaths

title: President of Transit Union Says Ravitch Seeks to Provoke Strike
description: John E. Lawe, president of the Transit Workers Union in New York City, yesterday accused Richard Ravitch, chairman of the Metropolitan Transporation Authority, of trying to provoke a subway and bus strike next spring.

title: IRANIANS NOW COURT U.S. NEWS COVERAGE
description: Last Sunday, the Iranian Embassy bought a fullpage advertisement in The New York Times and other newspapers to display a statement by Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini about the American hostapes.

title: 14 Hurt at Camden Stadium As Gangs Exchange Gunfire
description: At least 14 people, including a young mother and her 21/1-year-old son, were wounded by gunfire or otherwise injured yesterday afternoon in a shootout between motorcycle gangs outside a high school football stadium in Camden, N.J.

title: Stage: `Bernarda Alba Produced in Spanish
description: LA CASA de Bernarda Alba, a harsh and brooding piece that deals with family repression and honor written by Federico Garcia Lorca, the outstanding poetdramatist who died during the Spanish Civil War, is being infused with the breath of life by the Spanish Theater Repertory Company, New York's own fine Spanishlanguage repertory troupe.

title: Refugees Raped and Murdered by Thai Fishermen
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 22 Seventeen Vietnamese refugees, including four young children, were murdered by Thai fishermen at sea and most of the 37 women aboard four refugee boats raped many times by about 500 fishermen during a period of 22 days in which the survivors were held prisoner on an uninhabited island off southern Thailand.

title: Haitian Concert Hall Is Labor of Love
description: PORT-AU-PRINCE, Haiti, Nov. 23 In a city where art survives, if it does not conquer, poverty, Haiti's first and only philharmonic orchestra opened its own concert hall yesterday. For the first time, Brahms, Beethoven and Mozart were insulated from the futile honkings and incoherent noises of the streets below.

title: Fighter Is Critical
description: Willie Classen, a middleweight from Santurce, P.R., who now lives in New York, was listed in critical condition early today following a twohour operation at Bellevue Hospital. The surgery was performed within two hours after he was knocked out in the 10th round last night by Wilford Scypion at the Felt Forum. Classen was carried out of the ring semiconscious on a stretcher and was taken by ambulance to the hospital.

title: 3 in Cycle Gang, Shot in Camden, On Critical List
description: CAMDEN, Nov. 23  Three members of a motorcycle gang remained in critical condition at Our Lady of Lourdes Hospital here after surgery for gunshot wounds inflicted in a Thanksgiving Day shootout between rival gangs at a high school football game. Fortyfour gang members were arrested in the incident.

title: No Macmillan Bid Planned by Mattel
description: Mattel Inc. said in response to inquiries yesterday that it was not considering renewing its offer to acouire Macmillan Inc.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: THE WAY IT WAS Remnants of Grandeur will be tomorrow afternoon's neighborhood tour presented by New York WalkAbout. Starting at 2 o'clock, the group will explore the Astor Place area, a oncefashionable neighborhood of the mid19th century where Astors, Vanderbilts, Roosevelts and other prominent families lived. The tour will start at the southwest corner of East 11th Street and Second Avenue; the tab is $2.75. The most convenient subway stop is the Union Square station.

title: Federal Reserve; In millions
Miss Navratilova Wins, Aided by Old Foe
description: BRIGHTON, England, Nov. 23 (UPI)  Martina Navratilova, helped by serving hints from her arch rival Chris Evert Lloyd, routed liana Kloss of South Africa, 62, 61, today to gain the semifinals of a $100,000 tennis tournament.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: CARTER WARNS IRAN ON HOSTAGES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23  President Carter said today that the consequences would be extremely grave for Iran if even one of the remaining 49 American hnsta PPS in Teheran was harmed.

title: Utilities Creating System Of Atom Plant Standards
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23  Electric utilities in the United States are in the final stages of planning a new, private system of standards for nuclear plants, designed around the financial power of an insurance company that, for legal rea- sons, would be situated in Bermuda.

title: Brown Suspends Flight Training Of Iranian Student Pilots in U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23  Secretary of Defense Harold Brown today ordered the Air Force and the Navy to stop flight training of Iranian pilots and navigators in the United States as the Carter Administration continued its deliberate pace of I response to the crisis in Teheran.

title: P.L.O. Aide Calls Iran Ally of the Palestinians
description: PARIS, Nov. 23  The Palestine Liberation Organization's spokesman here said today that Yasir Arafat had never tried to mediate the release of United States hostages in Teheran because we are allies of the Iranian revolution.

title: Few Deportable Students From Iran Agreeing to Leave U.S. Voluntarily
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23  The Immigration and Naturalization Service said today that only 285 of 2,218 Iranian students found to be subject to deportation had agreed to leave the United States voluntarily.

title: Coal Outlook Found Mixed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 (UPI)  A study released by the World Bank this week says that soaring oil prices and worries about nuclear power have made the use of coal more attractive, but that it still faced obstacles as a substitute for oil.

title: Deaths
description: L I EBERMANBeniamin, Dr. Husband of the late Lillian Lieberman. Beloved father of Sidney and William, beloved grandfather and greatgrandfather. Survived by brothers Abraham and Samuel. Gramercy Park Chapel, 2nd Ave, 9:30am Sunday. Interment Cedar Park, NJ.

title: Korean Tanker Contract
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 23 (Reuters)  The Korea Shipbuilding and Engineering Corporation said today that it would build five crudeoil carriers, worth $101 million, for Ecuador's stateowned oil company, Flota Petrolera Ecuatoriana.

title: Woman Jailed As a Prostitute Wins Damages
description: A jury awarded $8,500 yesterday to a church administrator who was falsely imprisoned after police officers mistook her for a prostitute during a Times Square sweep.
