Thirty years can lot of memories.

title: WASHINGTON Wintry Winds In Moscow
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 24The mood of officials in Moscow these days seems almost as bleak as the weather. Winter is coming, and the Central Committee of the Soviet Communist Party will be meeting in a few days over a tangle of problems for the 80's.

title: Candid Glimpses Into Larry Rivers's Life and Art In Southampton
description: THIS one depresses me because I don't own it. It's called Southampton Backyard. My motherinlaw was still alive and she's in the garden here. There's a car or motorcycle. It was at the certain point when I was still adhering to a certain kind of realism and not worrying about it, and yet beginning to break away from it as you can see with these shapes and wipings and things like that. But there's enough in there that you can really feel the landscape quite strongly.

title: L.I. Ballet Taking First Stage Steps
description: IT should look like a compass, said Brett Raphael, the co-director of the newly formed Long Island Ballet, to a pre- cariously perched ballerina, Deirdre Carberry, and her partner, Carl Corry. You've got to sense when he's going to let you go. O.K., let's try it again.

title: Sunday Observer
description: I recently met a chairperson. That is one of the advantages of living in the present age. You can meet a chairperson. Grandfather couldn't do that. 1 remember him sitting by the potbellied stove in the parlor one day in nineteenoughtsix moaning about the disadvantages of being born too soon.

title: Spain After Franco: A Working Democracy
description: MADRID, Nov. 21  Four years ago, Generalissimo Francisco Franco Bahamonde, dictator of Spain since 1939, died at the age of 82. The Spanish people, with no clear oath ahead of them. were not without fears of another civil war. But most hoped that the future would bring greater liberty and prosperity.

title: Elderly Following Children to the Suburbs
description: OLD BRIDGE THE decision to leave the city so that they can be near their grown children in the suburbs is not an easy one for the elderly. Yet, more and more are making the move, leaving behind neighborhoods that have become increasingly dangerous for them.

title: How America Saw Itself
description: THIS is a magnificent book  a bountiful, beautiful offering of Americana that is also a good deal more than Americana.

title: LETTER TO THE WESTCHESTER EDITOR
description: Your story Plan for Drink Chests in Hotels Meets Opposition [Oct. 7] ends with a quotation from Morris Levovsky, chief of the wholesale liquor bureau of the State Liquor Authority.

title: U.S. Aides Doubt Khomeini Can Incite Religious War
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24  Administration specialists say that Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini may be able to cause new trouble for the United States outside Iran, but they see no possibility that he could unite the Moslem world for a political and terrorist holy war against the United States and the West.

title: FOOD Interesting Parts Of a Tepid Cuisine
description: AUSTRALIA may not have one of the world's great cuisines, but the price of food there makes it sound exceedingly tempting. According to Lee Gold, a native of Sydney who met and was married to James Pozarik, a photographer from New Hyde Park, while she was on a visit here three years ago, meat in Australia costs less than a third of what it does here.

title: Soda Flop
description: Where's the fizz in the soda pop? Just a year ago, it seemed that the the soft drink business was set to explode. Philip Morris Inc., the tobacco company that took over Miller beer and made it No. 2 to AnheuserBusch's Budweiser, bought control of the SevenUp Company and prepared a frontal assault on CocaCola, the CocaCola Company's Sprite and PepsiCo Inc.'s PepsiCola. Walter S. Mack, an octogenarian former chairman of Pepsi, also went after the leaders, with a new company and a lowpriced drink called KingCola. And AnheuserBusch jumped in with a notsosoft drink called Chelsea. It contained 0.4 percent alcohol.

title: Guerrillas in Italy Fire on Police
description: TURIN, Italy, Nov. 24 (Reuters) Guerrillas fired a rocket at an armored police car today outside the court where founders of the Red Brigades terrorist group will go on trial next week, but the police said it caused no casualties. They said the raiders, who also fired submachine guns at the police, escaped.

title: Petites: No Longer the Stepdaughters of Fashion
description: When designers such as Diane von Furstenberg and John Anthony start making clothes for petite women, and a Madison Avenue shop sells more than 300 of a $130 dress in sizes 2, 4 and you can be pretty sure that small women are finally taking giant steps into high fashion.

title: New Citizens Party Seeks Economic Democracy
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (UPI)  The Citizens Party, a new political movement on the near left of the political spectrum, is hoping to use the 1980 campaign to build a foundation for the future.

title: RushHour Crunch on L.I.R.R.It Could Get Worse
description: ONCE the subways were legendary for their crowds, masses of humanity so tightly pressed together that neighbors' bodies kept a person erect with- out the need of a handhold. Wily riders would find the precise spot on station platforms where the doors would most probably open, and if the engineer proved cooperative, they would rush in to claim a seat with elbows and umbrellas flailing.

title: Moscow Olympics Is Fencer's Target
description: FOR John Norma, the road to the Olympic Games in Moscow runs from his home in Pleasantville to the New York Fencers Club on West 71st Street in Manhattan.

title: Article 13 -- No Title
REPUBLICANS STUDY CONVENTION CHANGE
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Nov. 24 (UPI)The envelope, please, the chairman of the Republican National Convention may say one night next July, and a sealed list of names, each a potential Vice President of the United States, would be handed to him.

title: Pentagon Is Disputed on Exposure Of Troops to Herbicide in Vietnam
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24  Thousands of United States marines and soldiers were deployed in areas of South Vietnam that had been sprayed with the herbicide Agent Orange in the war in Vietnam, contrary to Defense Department assertions that the affected combat zones had been cleared of American personnel, the General Accounting Office said today.

title: Oswald Exhumation Bid Lost
description: FORT WORTH, Tex., Nov. 24 (UPI) The Tarrant County District Attorney's office has rejected a British author's offer to pay a $15,000 deposit on an insurance bond for the exhumation of the body of Lee Harvey Oswald. Assistant District Attorney Marvin Collins on Wednesday told Jerry Pittman, a lawyer who represents Michael Eddowes of London, that the offer for a $100,000 indemnification bond was insufficient, considering the legal risks. In his book, The Oswald File, Mr. Eddowes questions whether was Oswald or a lookalike Russian agent who killed President Kennedy in Dallas on Nov. 22, 1963.

title: Police in Florida Town Busy With Speed Limit
description: WALDO, Fla., Nov. 24 (AP)  The five policemen in this tiny north Florida crossing devote their time to traffic enforcement  writing tickets by the hundreds.

title: SPEAKING PERSONALLY A 2-Year-Old's Guide to Commuting Car
description: ARE we going your way or my way? demanded the 2-yearold navigator from his car seat.

title: Miss Waldgeir Wed To Mark Perlberg
description: Diane Waldgeir, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Max Waldgeir of Douglaston, Queens, and Mark Craig Perlberg, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Perlberg of Wyckoff, N.J., were married yesterday. Rabbi Bernhard Presler performed the ceremony in the Fresh Meadows (Queens) Jewish Center. Wyckoff, N.J., were married yesterday. Rabbi Bernhard Presler performed the ceremony in the Fresh Meadows (Queens) Jewish Center.

title: Art of Tattooing:
description: UNION BEACH ASK any serious tattooist when the profession began to go down hill, as some people say it has, and you probably will get a wide variety of answers.

title: Paperback Best Sellers
description: MASS MARKET

title: Between Bonn And Warsaw, A Softer Tone
description: WEST BERLIN, Nov. 24  In the 10 years since Bonn began normalizing relations with its eastern neighbors, West Germany and Poland have made unexpected progress, gradually moving from mutual distrust, based on centuries of conflict, conquest and hostility, to a growing sense of cooperation.

title: 2 Women Share Golf Lead
description: ATSUGI, Japan, Nov. 24 (AP) Aing Tsai of Taiwan shot a one-under- par 73 today to share a onestroke lead with Takako Kiyomoto of Japan after the first round of a $61,000 golf tournament. Cathy Thompson of the United States shot a 74 to place third. Debbie Meisterlin and Donna Capon Young, both of the United States, shared fourth place with 75's.

title: IN THE NATION
description: American Presidential elections usually come down to a choice among personalities. Since that tendency is enhanced in the era of television and the imagemakers, there is no reason to suppose it will not be true in 1980.

title: PHOTOGRAPHY
description: IN a remarkable essay on Photographs, Images and Words, which appears in the autumn number of The American Scholar, Wright Morris himself an accomplished novelist. critic and photographer  has some interesting things to say about the way words have now come to dominate our Interest in aphy. In determining what and where

title: JERSEY TO AIR PLAN FOR TRANSPORTATION
description: TRENTON, Nov. 23  Public hearings will begin Monday on the first phase of a new state transportation plan that calls for development of a lowcost and reliable statewide public transit system and reconsideration of the completion of more than $300 million worth of Interstate System highways.

title: RICHARD Q. YARDLEY
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 24 (AP)  Richard Quincy Yardley, an editorial cartoonist for The Baltimore Sun for more than 20 years, died today at the John L. Deaton Medical Center. He was 76 years old.

title: Knicks Win and Set Team Assist Record
description: By patiently executing their plays getter than they had at any previous time during this National Basketball Association season, the Knicks established a team record of 45 assists last night while routing the Cleveland Cavaliers, 133113, before a crowd of 12,080 at Madison square Garden.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: Most Americans employed in organizations are not so much leaders as they are superiors and subordinates mostly subordinates.

title: STILLAT LARGE
description: Eight years ago yesterday, a man identified only as D.B. Cooper bought a ticket aboard a Northwest Airlines jet, which he then hijacked. After receiving the $200,000 ransom and a parachute that he demanded from airline officials, the man jumped from the jetliner over a rural area of Washington State. So far, law enforcement officials have not found him.

title: Votes in Congress
description: Amendment to legislation for a tax on oil companies socalled windfall profits to cut from 75 percent to 60 percent the tax rate on oil from wells drilled before 1973. rejected. 58 to 32, Nov. 19.

title: A Millburn Cafe Serves Jazz, Too
description: MILLBURN

title: An AvantGarde Theesome in Brooklyn
description: On; couldn't ask, it seems, for more likeminded collaborators  Sol LeWitt, a founder of the Conceptual movement in art; Lucinda Childs, a member of the Judson Theater avantgarde of the 1960's and a choreographer who covers dance spaces with the lines and arcs of her dancers pathways, and Philip Glass, one of the originators of trance music. Practioners of the art of grand simplification or informal formality the three have come together to make dance called, naturally, Dance, to open at the Brooklyn Academy of Music on Thursday.

title: Music Holiday Bonzana of Concert is Near
description: DECEMBER is fast approaching, and with it our annual bonanza of choral concerts, Nutcracker ballets and assorted other holiday programs. This Tuesday, for instance, you can join the Danbury Community Chorus for an 8:15 P.M. holiday concert conducted by James Humphreville. Among the festive offerings at Rogers Park Junior High School will be works by Ives, and Benjamin Britten's radiant A Ceremony of Carols.

title: Oil and Water?
description: The Mobil Corporation is perhaps the most outspoken company in the oil industry, and Herbert Schmertz, director of its aggressive multimilliondollar ad campaign, has become one of the most recognizable spokesmen for Big Oil. So the news last week that Mr. Schmertz had joined forces with senator Edward M. Kennedy, one of the industry's harshest critics, came with an intense aura of strange bedfellowship.

title: Firewood Prices Up
description: ELWOOD HOYT is not a newcomer to the wood business. His grandfather established the Eastern Fuel Corporation in Hamden in 1868. Years later, Mr. And So Are Thefts

title: Prosecutor to Appeal Verdict
description: DETROIT, Nov. 24 (AP)  Robert F. Leonard, the Genesee County prosecutor, says he plans to appeal his conviction on charge of embezzling Federal revenuesharing money from a crimefighting fund at his office. Mr. Leonard, who has held the post for 16 years, is required by state law to step down after the Federal jury verdict yesterday. He faces a maximum of 28 years in prison and a $35,000 fine, according to the United States Attorney's office in Detroit. No sentencing date was set.

title: Stocking Stuffer
description: Here is a little stocking stuffer for the toddler who has everything. It's a 57ounce set of small, solid gold building blocks, available at Autonomics Inc. of New York for $46,000. The Pieces of Eight, as they're called, were designed by Roland Gebhardt, a sculptor, who signs a block of each set.

title: Ballet: D'Amboise's 30th Anniversary
description: Jacques d'Amboise and Suzanne Farrell on stage, Robert Irving in the orchestra pit, and a little Balanchine and Tchaikovsky  what could be much righter with the world, or at least the world of dance? The New York City Ballet celebrated Mr. d'Arnboise's 30th anniversary with the company Friday at the New York State Theater with a characteristic minimum of fuss. But despite its modesty, this was an occasion to savor and a perfect addition to the long years of other memories Mr. d'Amboise has given to those who have grown up, like him, with the City Ballet.

title: Islanders and Kings Duel to 44 Deadlock
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 24 (AP) Steve Jensen and Dave Taylor scored goals early in the final period tonight to give the Los Angeles Kings a 44 tie with the New York Islanders in a National Hockey League game.

title: All Singapore Chinese Must Learn Mandarin
description: SINGAPORE, Nov. 24 (Reuters) The Singapore Government has set a period of 10 years in which to phase out southern Chinese dialects completely and introduce mandarin as the common language of the island republic's Chinese majority

title: Radio
description: 77:30 A.M., WBLS: Tenant Survival Program.

title: BEHIND THE BEST SELLERS
description: For one who seemed to enjoy the limelight as Secretary of State, Henry A. Kissinger has assumed an uncommonly low profile in his new role as bestselling author of White House Years. Al- though he made several television appearances in connection with the book (one of which resulted in the widely publicized setto with David Frost), Mr. Kissinger has rejected scores of invitations for personal appearances.

title: A Nonassertive Branch of Abstract Expressionism
description: STAMFORD BORN in . 1922, Theodoros Steams was not quite old enough to take part in the founding of Abstract Expressionism, the achievement of men in their 40's and 50's who had lived through the Depression and World War II as adults. He was nevertheless very much part of the movement and, with his contemporaries Sam Francis and Grace Hartigan, was included in the Museum of Modern Art's landmark international traveling show of 1958, The New American Painting.

title: The Art of Creating  Great Restaurants
description: It is quite possible to fantasize that behind the imperiously arched right eyebrow of Paul Dessibourg lives the soul of Henri Soule, that Soule of unremitting gastronomic legend, for whom Monsieur Paul ran the dinin room at

title: A SOVIET TEACHER'S J'ACCUSE
description: This year of 1976, I will turn 50. Mathematics has always been the most important thing in my life. I have enjoyed studying it, teaching it, writing about it. After finishing one article, I would go straight on to the next. When I had put the finishing touches to one book, I would begin thinking about the next.

title: A Simple Success Story: The Last Women's Hotels
description: In days gone by New York City's hotels for women not infrequently pro. vided afternoon teas, evening concerts, quiet libraries, private writing rooms and practice rooms with pianos. No longer. Only three hotels exclusively for women remain. They are moneymakers, but what they offer is neither luxury nor elegance. The emphasis is on safe and inexpensive accommodations.

title: Dairy Farms a Vanishing Breed
description: FARMINGDALE LONG before sunrise each day, Roger Merrick heads toward the faded green barn on his farm here, something he has done just about every day for the last 50 years.

title: A Preview of the 20 Top College Basketball Teams
description: Not since the early 1960's, when Jerry Lucas, John Havlicek and Larry Siegfried were the stars, has Ohio State gone into the college basketball season ranked as the nation's top team in many preseason polls.

title: Fashion
description: Don't forget the presence of the horse, and the delicious life of the country the sleighs, the music, the lights of the chandeliers, urges the voice, in its singular accent, as it describes imperial Vienna over the telephone. It is Diana Vreeland speaking. As special assistant to the Costume Institute at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, she is in the midst of mounting her eighth annual costume exhibition, Fashions of the Hapsburg Era: AustriaHungary, which premieres with a blacktie benefit dinner on Dec. 3, and opens to the public on Dec. 11.

title: THEATER Stage Not Set for a Successful Kismet
description: WHEN the defunct Nanuet Star Theater was being converted to the needs of the Dinner Theater, the daughter of the theater's comanagers, Rita and Abe Renko, used to jog around the outer circle of the table area. She computed it at eight and a half laps to the mile. In short. as dinner theaters go, the Coachlight  which has a sister theater of the same name in East Windsor, Conn.  is huge.

title: The Suburban 'InBetween' People
description: ALOT of inbetween people live in affluent suburbia. Not rich, not poor, not avantgarde, jetset people. Just ordinary folks.

title: Unfair Rates,
description: TRENTON  There was a time when lameduck legislative sessions in New Jersey were for confirming a few judges, then enjoying the holidays and waiting for the start of a new session in January. Last week, however, Governor Byrne gave the lawmakers a heavy yearend agenda topped by the longawaited reform of the state's automobile insurance laws.

title: Pincay's Goal in Danger
description: Laffit Pincay, hoping to reach the unparalelled mark of $8 million in purse earnings in one season, turned in another strong performance at Aqueduct yesterday in scoring with Robert N. Lehmann's $15.20for$2 Googolplex in the $54,250 Nashua Stakes.

title: U.S. Bows in Hockey
description: CALGARY, Alberta, Nov. 24 (UPI)  Shane Pearsall scored two goals, including the gamewinner in the third period, in the Canadian Olympic hockey team's 43 victory over the United States today. Canada swept the threegame exhibition series. Warren Anderson and Paul MacLean got the other Canadian goals. Dave Silk, Ralph Cox and Buzz Schneider scored for the losers.

title: Mahala Tillinghast Bride of Richard Beams
description: Mahala Willard Tillinghast, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Gardner Tillinghast of Easton, Md., was married yesterday afternoon to Richard Blanchard Beams, son of Mrs. Thadeus Williams of Summit, N.J., and the late Robert Hall Beams.

title: In Anything Goes, Not Enough Goes
description: PORT JEFFERSON LAST season, when it was in the confines of a church basement, Theater Three presented perfectly respectable productions of Euripides and Shaw. In its scrumptuous new Scrimshaw Theater, the repertory has been, so far, not so presentable.

title: Marriage Announcement 11 -- No Title
description: Julia Johnson Plans May Bridal

title: PAPERBACK TALK
description: Christmas story. Once upon a time, many years ago, few book people gave softcover books a second thought during the weeks between Thanksgiving and Christmas. In bookstores across the land, cash regis- ters rang merrily as clerks wrapped expensive hardcover books that were being bought for giftgiving. In stationery stores the paperback racks were shoved aside to make room for displays of more profitable merchandise, such as greeting cards. Even publishers did not think of paperbacks as gifts worthy of the season. The new titles they issued during December were lusterless; they held those for which they cherished high hopes for release after the new year.

title: WESTCHESTER GUIDE
description: In order to raise attendance at cultural institutions and at the same time encourage the use of mass transportation, County Executive Alfred B. DelBello has initiated a home free program.

title: Bostonians Are Falling Short in Drive to Keep Art
description: BOSTON, Nov. 24 (AP)  Five weeks before their deadline, Bostonians trying to raise $5 million to keep Gilbert Stuart's famous portraits of George and Martha Washington in the city concede that they will fall far short of their goal.

title: U.S. May Oversee State Districting
description: WASHINGTON

title: Ellen Robin Kaufer Married
description: Ellen Robin Kaufer and Joel Harris Komisarow were married yesterday by Rabbi William Orenthlichter at the Bayside (Queens) Jewish Center.

title: Inside Maxim's: A Refuge Against Real Life
description: PARIS  When Maxim's disappeared from the Michelin Guide last year it simply confirmed what most Parisians already knew. Maxim's is not a restaurant. Food is served, to be sure, but no one goes there to eat.

title: Manhattan Women Bow
description: Five East Carolina players reached double figures yesterday as the Lady Pirates spoiled Manhattan College's women's basketball season opener with a 9832 victory at Draddy Gymnasium. Rosie Thompson and Kathy Riley led East Carolina with 18 points each. Manhattan was led by Anne Flannery's 18 points and 12 rebounds.

title: Ghaith Pharaon
description: PARIS  I guess you can say the sky is the limit, said Ghaith Pharaon. He was speaking in the office building he owns here, one that comes close to anyone's limit on earth. It occupies the choicest location in Paris, at 4 Place de la Concorde, facing the obelisk in the center of the huge square, with the American Embassy and the Hotel Crillon immediately to its right and the Tuileries Gardens to the left.

title: Shades of Red and Greene
description: Spy scandals, like beer, tend to have a native tang. The typical American spy usually turns out to be a debtridden engineer in need of ready cash to take the wife on a Hawaiian holiday. After the culprit is exposed, neighbors invariably marvel that such a nice boy could turn out to be a Red agent.

title: Desert Bighorns Captured to Halt Epidemic
description: WHITE SANDS MISSILE RANGE, N.M., Nov. 24 (AP)  Tim Wallis, the pilot, skirted the cliffs of the desolate San Andres Mountains, looking for movement below. In the rear of the helicopter, Colin Yeates cocked a special type of gun and fired, casting a billowing orange net over his target  one of the last surviving Desert Bighorn sheep in New Mexico.

title: U.S. SCIENCE SEEKING SURE MISSILE KILLER
description: Military science has started to explore the largely unknown field of laser and chargedparticlebeam weapons that could be fired in space against Soviet ballistic missiles.

title: Briton Divulges Steps to 56 Decision to Seize Suez
description: LONDON, Nov. 24  A close observer of events surrounding the Suez crisis of 1956 revealed this week how Prime Minister Anthony Eden not only rejected the advice of his military advisers and President Dwight D. Eisenhower but also dismissed threats of a Soviet missile attack as twaddle.

title: Article 2 -- No Title
Relief Groups Report Cambodian Aid Drive Draws Huge Response
description: Relief organizations are reporting overwhelming responses in the first weeks of the campaign to aid Cambodian refugees.

title: Engagements
description: BLATTGROSSMAN

title: Atlantic City Shows Attract 5,520 Dogs
description: Boardwalk and Park Place are familiar names to Monopoly players and dog show devotees. The Boardwalk Kennel Club will hold its annual extravaganza next Sunday in Convention Hall in Atlantic City, just five blocks from Park Place.

title: Autumnal Rite Of Suburban Tribes
description: THE setting is mellow and suburban: a highschool football field ringed by trees, a living catalogue of L. L. Bean and Bloomie's leisurewear scattered throughout the wooden stands. There is comfortable laughter as neighbor greets neighbor. Men shake hands or slap backs. Women brush cheeks or pat arms.

title: MUSIC Noteworthy Choirs
description: DECEMBER is fast approaching, and with it the annual bonanza of choral concerts, Nutcracker ballets and assorted other holiday programs. Lest next Sunday's more complete details arrive too late to inspire attendance, herewith a word on two fine county choir programs.

title: Shah's Disputed Wealth a Key Issue in U.S.Iran Conflict
description: The fortune purportedly removed from Iran by the deposed Shah has become a central issue in the tense conflict between the United States and Iran's revolutionary regime. But neither Government is able to say with much precision just how large that fortune might be, or what forms it may have taken, or where it might be.

title: Yesterday's Playthings on Display
description: OLD SAYBROOK THEY whirl and twirl, slide and spin, tumble and roll, and almost provoke a smile. They're toys  antiques that manage to delight children of the plastichappy 20th century at least as much as the children they were originally intended for.

title: Probing Industry's Conscience
description: The analytical eye of the Council on Economic Priorities has focused on many hot, emotional issue since its first report, Efficiency in Death, revealed the identities of manufacturers of antipersonnel weaponry.

title: CAPITAL REPORT
description: GOVERNOR BYRNE has persuaded Dr. Joanne E. Finley, the state's Commissioner of Health, to do something that even her husband and children could not get her to do: cut down her smoking.

title: Temple Conquers Villanova
description: VILLANOVA, Pa., Nov. 24 (AP) Brian Broomell, the Temple quarterback, scored his first touchdown of the season as a pass receiver, threw for three scores, and engineered two other touchdown drives as the Owls defeated Villanova. 4210. today.

title: In Education Debate, the Child Is Forgotten
description: DURING the last year a host of articles and news items have appeared that addressed the problem of how to finance education in our state. A great deal of impetus for this heavy coverage appears to have been provided by Governor Carey's creation of the Special Task Force on Equity and Excellence in Public Education. In reviewing much of this material, I have been struck by the relatively obscure position occupied by the child in the delineation and the analysis of the problem.

title: Judge Seized on Drug Charge Battles to Keep Post
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 24  A state appeals judge, arrested two months ago on the felony charge of growing marijuana, now appears likely to fight in court to hold onto his position. He is contending that the plants seized by the drug enforcement authorities belonged to his wife and that the tenuous state of their marriage forced him to accept her plan to grow them.

title: Columbia Tops Hartwick, 32, Gains in Soccer
description: ONEONTA, N.Y., Nov. 24  Steve Charles scored two goals and assisted on a third as he led Columbia to a 32 victory over Hartwick in the first round of the National Collegiate Athletic Association soccer playoffs today.

title: Two Elderly Women Are Burned When Holiday Dessert Explodes
description: CORAL GABLES, Fla., Nov. 24 (AP) Two elderly women were burned, one of them critically, when a cherries jubilee dessert at a country club dinner exploded and set their clothing on fire, officials said.

title: HOME CLINIC  A Plumber's Friend': Getting Acquainted
description: EVEN the most inexperienced of do-it-yourselfers is likely to be familiar with the tool many call the plumber's friend otherwise known as a force cup or plunger. After trying a chemical drain cleaner, and often even before using a chemical drain opener, this is the tool that the home handyman or handywoman will reach for when a drain gets clogged or starts to act sluggish.

title: Theater Music by Purcell
description: Henry David Purcell is one of music's great tragedies. It was bad enough that, like Mozart and Schubert, he died young, at the age of 36 in 1695. Sadder yet, he stands as the greatest composer of dramatic music that England ever produced but his gifts were, if not exactly squandered, never fully realized. This situation was hardly Purcell's fault, but of the times in which he lived. In those days England did not take to the continental notion of opera, preferring spoken drama in which music played an important but essentially decorative function, and Purcell spent much of his short life supplying these divertissements.

title: Corruption Curb Urged For U.S. Food Inspectors
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (UPI) Government study group yesterday called for creating an anticorruption unit to keep the nation's inherently vulnrable food inspectors from engaging in bribery and extortion.

title: Larry Brown: In the U.C.L.A
description: LOS ANGELES LARRY BROWN, the new head basketball coach at U.C.L.A., stood on the floor in Pauley Pavilion, the campus arena that Edwin W. Pauley helped pay for, J.D. Morgan helped fill, television showcased, cheerleaders glamorized, basketball players glorified, and John Wooden decorated. It was a little more than two weeks ago, in his first public appearance on this floor, before an intrasquad game in front of about 2,000 people, when Brown became the third may in four years to dare to stand in a spot where Wooden the Wizard of Westwood himselfhad never stood. That is, underneath the decorations; 10 banners, gold trim on a blue background, that hang from the roof and proclaim:

title: Fighting the AlcoholCrime Tie
description: MINEOLA TERRY had been arrested eight times by the age of 21 for assault, petty larceny and drug possession. He had also been a heavy drinker since his teens. Despite drinking around the clock for the last four years, however, he managed to hold onto his job as a gardener and to keep out of the way of the law.

title: Iowa to Permit Use of Cameras And Microphones in Courtrooms
description: DES MOINES, Nov. 24 (AP)  Live coverage of Iowa court proceedings by radio and television and the use of still cameras in the courtroom will be permitted next year as a oneyear experiment, the State Supreme Court has decided.

title: McEnroe Is Toppled
description: BOLOGNA, Italy, Nov. 24 (AP)  In one of his rare losses since winning the United States Open, John McEnroe was upset by Butch Waits, 64, 67, 63, in the semifinals of the $75,000 Italian indoor tennis championships today.

title: Future Events
description: Tickets for the following may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: LIMA, Peru  The other night I had dinner at a fish place with Ricardo Toledo, an expert in catastrophies. He is no witch doctor but a topnotch Mexican engineer who wears a classical Mayan profile, English tweeds and a rather bookish air when he talks of earthquakes, hurricanes, floods, and also of coups and civil wars. There is a relationship between one and the other, you know, he said thoughtfully.

title: Meeting of 2 Key Politicians Seen as Threat to Giscard
description: PARIS, Nov. 24  A recent meeting between two leading politicians has raised the possibility of dramatic shifts in the French political scene and threatened the power of President Valery Giscard d'Estaing.

title: Four Hurt as Plane Loses Engine After Takeoff From the Bahamas
description: FREEPORT, the Bahamas, Nov. 24 (AP) A chartered plane taking a group of gamblers back to Florida made an emergency landing here early today when one of its two engines caught fire and fell off, officials said. Four persons were injured.

title: Farmingdale Is Upset, 86, By Sewanhaka
description: GREENVALE, L.I., Nov. 24  Sewanhaka High School of Floral Park defeated Farmingdale today at C.W. Post College, 86, to win the Nassau Conference I football championship. A crowd of 5,679 witnessed the upset of the defending Rutgers Cup champions, who had entered the game with a wonlost record of 80 and a 17game winning streak.

title: Pakistani Says Troops Were Not Ready in Attack
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, Nov. 24  A member of the military Cabinet conceded today that Pakistan's security forces were not prepared to deal with the attack on the United States Embassy on Wednesday, but said that he considered the subsequent evacuation of American dependents to have been an overreaction by Washington.

title: Design
description: Beginning in 1819, in the midst of the Hapsburg rule, a German style of furniture had a rare period of influence. The Biedermeier style, a provincial nephew of the neoclassical Directoire, encompassed an approach to interiors which is still in evidence today  banquettes, slipcovers, walltowall carpeting and, in its heyday, galvanized much of the populace, from burgher to courtier. Then the style fell victim to bad press

title: CAMERA
description: 0 ne of the first steps on the long road to becoming good photographer is to familiarize yourself with the technical aspects of picturetaking You must learn about such things as how different lenses change the perspective of a scene, how different shutterspeeds will either freeze a moving subject or allow it to blur, how different f /stops affect depth-offield, and how different films and filters can change the mood of a photograph.

title: The Novels That Got Away
description: SOMEWHERE on these premises in Paris along with boxes of old Christmas decorations or in a trunk in Maine there must be the vestiges of two novels I started and abandoned decades ago. It will be no great loss if they are never exhumed. The first, titled The Lost Week, was inspired by a descent on Truro, on Cape Cod, by Charlie Jackson, the novelist, in the summer of 1945. Spurred on by friends (the subject was made for me, they thought), I began it there and then in the first heat of amusement. A satire, it was to be, on the literary life and the thirst for fame, just as dangerous to selfrespect as the thirst for alcohol; the protagonist was called Herbert Harper. That is about all I remember, though the manuscript ran to 80 or 90 typed pages.

title: CONNECTICUT HOUSING Law Delaying Condominiums
description: HARTFORD THE growing national backlash against condominium conversions has finally arrived in Connecticut. The idea of a temporary moratorium on condominium conversion as a political response to the seemingly wholesale loss of rental units reached into the State Capitol last week during the special pre-Thanksgiving energy session.

title: Elly Ameling's Calling Is Lieder
description: EIly Ameling's very lack of novelty attests to her centric city in our musical life. In other words: the Dutch soprano and lieder specialist is giving a recital at Alice Tully Hall this afternoon, the first of three there this season. This is nothing new; indeed, Miss Ameling's frequent annual appearances here, in song recitals and with orchestras, have become commonplace.

title: Jane Schmidt Becomes Bride Of a Lawyer
description: Jane Elizabeth Schmidt and Walter Briggs Connolly Jr. were married yesterday in St. Paul's Episcopal Church in Westfield, N.J. Canon Richard J. Hardman performed the ceremony, assisted by the Rev. Richard Garcia, a Roman Catholic priest.

title: Liv Ullmann Discusses Acting On TV, Directors and Love
description: Her body lies sprawled on the floor, exposed and vulnerable in a fleshcolored nightgown; her face is hidden by a tangled mass of bright hair. Frozen into a fetal clench, she is so still she might be dead.

title: Editors Choice
description: DARKNESS VISIBLE, by William Golding. (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, $10.95.) A magic fable that explores the darkness of human nature through the fortunes of Matty, brushed by fire as a boy during the World War Il blitz, and of numerous people he later encounters In Britain and Australia.

title: Dianne Marie Sullivan Engaged
description: Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Roger J. Sullivan of Tupper Lake, N.Y., of the engagement of their daughter, Dianne Marie Sullivan, to Richard Keane Bowden, son of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Hopuston Bowden of Timonium, Md.

title: Connecticut/This Week
description: ART

title: Study Links Higher Fees To Doctorinsurer Ties
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (AP)  A new Federal study links higher doctors bills to physician control of many of the nation's Blue Shield insurance plans.

title: Stage: Shem Plays at the Ragtime
description: Samuel Shem, the pen name of a psychiatrist who last year gave us an irreverent and somewhat scary account of the workings of a training hospital in his novel The House of God, is now making his debut as a playwright with The Shem Plays, two oneact plays, both of which are receiving their pre miere performances at the Impossible Ragtime Theater Thursdays through Sundays through Dec. 9.

title: A Swordfish Leaps From Water For Attack on Fijian Fisherman
description: SUVA, Fiji, Nov. 24 (Reuters)  A swordfish leaped from the water and plunged its long jawbone into the side of a fisherman in a boat off the island of Koro yesterday, local officials said.

title: How Much Longer?;
description: President Carter, as it turns out, spoke prematurely when he called the first days of the Iranian crisis the worst week of his Administration. Last week was even worse  in deed and in the prospect for early release of the remaining 49 Americans held hostage in the United States Embassy in Teheran since Nov. 4.

title: Reexamining the Ozone
description: Remember the skepticism last year when the United States banned most aerosol sprays containing chlorofluorocarbons? People found it hard to believe that squirting deodorant out of a can was jeopardizing the stratospheric ozone layer, which protects the earth from excessive ultraviolet radiation. It was like finding out that eating candy causes earthquakes.

title: F.C.C. Moves to Permit Paging Devices for Deaf
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (AP)  The Federal Communications Commission has moved to set aside radio frequencies for special paging devices for the deaf, blind and physically handicapped.

title: Philadelphia Asks U.S. To Free Housing Funds
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 24 (UPI) The city of Philadelphia, its Mayorelect preparing for a fencemending trip to Washington, has asked the Federal Government to releaqe $20 million in community development funds blocked in a disputed over public housing.

title: Headliners
description: When it comes to high thoughts and noble language in the Soviet Union, they don't just whistle Dixie. Last week in Moscow, Leonid I. Brezhnev was immortalized by the performance of a new oratorio based on the third volume of his memoirs. According to Tass, the official press agency, Soviet critics were deeply impressed by the work's sincere pathos.

title: Jets Brace for Assault From Seattle's Zorn
description: The matchup was made in Hollywood, or at least on Monday Night Football: the wild and woolly gamblers from the West, led by a southpaw slinger, against the conservative Easterners whose biggest weapon is the hohum run.

title: Bringing Walt Kelly's Toge To the Screen
description: WASHINGTON Crammed into a small cluster of rooms in the back of northern Virginia shopping mall, the studio for the first film version of the comic strip Pogo looks more like a factory than a soundstage. In this unlikely setting, the actors stand waiting in the studio, silent, while film makers carefully twist their arms and mold their faces into position under glaring lights. No complaints are expected from the local actors union, however, because the cast of characters for this drama Albert the Alligator, Churchy La Femme and P.T. Bridgeport  are three to fourinch, malleable figures made of plastic, clay, magnetic metal and sundry other bits and pieces.

title: Priest, 82, and Aide, 71, Fight Off Three Robbers
description: DALLAS, Nov. 24 (AP)  An 82yearold priest says he landed a pretty good punch on one of his knifewielding attackers while his onelegged, 71yearold secretary battled another with a frying pan.

title: Snares Line Path of Trappers; Fur Prices Increase
description: ANCHORAGE, Alaska, Nov. 24 (AP) Warmerthanusual temperatures and ban on trapping in national monuments are plaguing trappers whose early take of furbearing animals is sharply down this year.

title: THIS WEEK IN SPORTS
description: PRO BASKETBALL

title: ExDancer Expert on Costumes
description: ALLENTOWN

title: Oil Legacy to Coast City Multiplies During Dispute
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif., Nov. 24 (AP)  A widow's $20 million bequest to Santa Barbara has more than doubled in value in two years of legal difficulties and detective work that established her Italian lover's claim to a $5 million share

title: In Defense of Sentimentality
description: WELL over a century ago, Dickens gave his first public reading of A Christmas Carol  it was just two days after Christmas, and 2,000 people gave the author their rapt attention (and frequent applause). The reading took three hours, though in later years Dickens would prune A Christmas Carol to a twohour performance; he liked it well enough that first time, however,. to repeat the reading three days later  to an audience of 2,500, almost exclusively composed of working people, for whom he had requested that the auditorium be reserved. He thought they were his best audience. They lost nothing, misinterpreted nothing, followed everything closely, laughed and cried, Dickens said, and [they] animated me to that extent that I felt as if we were all bodily going up into the clouds together.

title: Mona D. Shapiro, Lawyer, Married
description: Mona D. Shapiro, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Myron L. Shapiro of Yonkers, was married yesterday afternoon to Christopher C. Parke, son of Dr. and Mrs. William M. Parke Jr. of Scarsdale, N.Y. State Supreme Court Justice Hortense W. Gabel performed the ceremony at the Shapiro home.

title: MUSIC VIEW
description: Marcel Prawy asked, a hard question the other week in Washington, during the visit of the Vienna State Opera. The occasion was a panel on Opera set up by the .Music Critics, ASSociation. Mr. Prawy, anurbane trilingual, knowledgeable man, isan official of the Vienna State Opera He also is an admirer 0f Leonard Bernstein, and he simply cannot underStand why certain American crit, ics refuse to realize the clearly obvious fact that Mr. Bernstein is the greatest thing that has: happened to music in America since Thomas Jefferson played the fiddle.

title: Elevator Falls 7 Stories; 10 Riders Hurt Slightly
description: Ten persons were reported slightly injured late yesterday when an elevator in which they were riding in a West Side hotel fell seven stories after a cable snapped, the police said.

title: Carolyn Zoller Affianced
description: Dr. and Mrs. Philip A. Zoller of Oyster Bay, L.I., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Carolyn Stanton Zoller, to John Ritter Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Ritter of Hicksville, L.I. The future bride, an alumna of Skidmore College and the Cornell UniversityNew York Hospital School of Nursing, and her fianc, who attends Columbia University, plan to be married in June.

title: Colorado Schoolboy Gains 404 Yards, Scores 6 Times
description: STEAMBOAT SPRINGS, Colo., Nov. 24 (AP)  Tom Southall, a high school tailback born with only half of his left arm, rushed for 404 yards and scored six touchdowns today as Steamboat Springs routed Sheridan, 5215, in the semifinal round of Colorado's Class AA football championships.

title: Ideas &Trends
description: If the prehistoric landscape was muddy, and modern excavators are skilled and lucky, they can find the footprints of man's early relatives left on the sands of time. Last week, scientists announced the possible discovery of a new set of such footprints along Lake Turkana in northern Kenya.

title: Spanish Politicians Meet On Basque Kidnapping
description: SAN SEBASTIAN, Spain, Nov. 24 (UPI)  A group of politicians working unofficially to gain the release of Javier Ruprez, a member of Parliament who was kidnapped two weeks ago by Basques, met today with a politician and a former guerrilla of the Basques.

title: Ventures
description: MONTREAL  Canadian developers began moving across the border seeking investment opportunities in the United States about five years ago, having grown too big for their own market. They moved into the Sun Belt. the West Coast. the Southeast and elsewhere.

title: Manhattanville Trying to Cut Castle Costs
description: PURCHASE THE trouble with castles is . . . In 1892, Whitelaw Reid, the principal owner of The New York Tribune, erected a huge stone mansion with crenelated tower on a hill in this central Westchester community. It is an imposing building with a large, ornate interior, a marble center hail, big rooms, tall windows and high ceilings. In its woodpaneled corridor off the main hall a standing suit of armor would seem very much in character

title: GALLERY VIEW
description: Drawing is fundamental to life. Without drawing in one form or another  we should have no medicine, no engineering, no maps, no architecture and no mode of transport more advanced than a handcart. We should also have no art. Michelangelo made the classic pitch on that subject when he said that Painting, sculpture and architecture culminate in drawing. It is both the primary source and the soul of all painting and the root of every science.

title: Publisher's Goal: Explaining America
description: NEARLY hidden among the rolling hills of Litchfield County, just a stroll away from the banks of the shepaug River, is a sturdy red brick building that until recently served the town of Washington as a grammar school.

title: 50YearOld Caterpillar Finishes Smithsonian's Tractor Collection
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (UPI)  The Smithsonian Institution celebrated Thanksgiving by placing a 50yearold Caterpillar farm tractor on display to mark the 75th anniversary of the first successful demonstration of a crawlertype tractor.

title: 1,500 Israelis in Protest Over Settlements Policy
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 24 (AP)  About 1,500 demonstrators from the Peace Now movement marched on Prime Minister Menachem Begin's home today to protest Government spending on Jewish settlements in occupied Arab territory.

title: New Hampshire Bear Hunters Doing Dental Work
description: CONCORD, N.H., Nov. 24 (AP)  Bear hunters in New Hampshire have found that not only does it pay to be a good shot, but a little knowledge of dentistry also helps.

title: Yesterday's Rock Stars Try for a Future in Film
description: HOLLYWOOD It's almost three in the afternoon at the MGM lot, a sprawl of lowlying stucco barracks buildings, narrow alleys and secondfloor walkways, but Robbie Robertson, still keeping rockandroll hours, has just ar, rived. Mr. Robertson, a handsome Canadian in This mid30's, was one of the most respected rock songwriters and guitarists of the 60's and early 70's. His songs  The Weight, The Night They Drove Old Dixie Down  were generational anthems, and The Band, the group he piloted through a 16year career without a single personnel change, backed Bob Dylan on some of his most memorable recordings and tours as well as making its own classic albums. But the 60's are over. In fact, it's almost the 80's, and Robbie Robertson is in the movies. Here at the MGM lot, he makes his way to a secondfloor office which looks like most of the other cubbyholes in this teeming warren  except for the gold records on the

title: Words of Violence, Paths of Reason
description: It is getting harder by the day, but the obligation of Americans remains what it has been for three trying weeks. A decent concern for the remaining 49 hostages in Teheran requires restraint, and the recognition that words are still the main weapons in this war over the Shah. The agitation of smoothfaced men in business suits can be just as reckless as that of a bearded priest in a turban, but diplomatic remedies have not been exhausted.

title: Katherine Doyle, Hector Guenther Plan a May Bridal
description: Mr. and Mrs. Edward L. Doyle of Hingham, Mass., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Katherine Frances Doyle, to Hector Innis Guenther, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Guenther of Rye, N.Y. A wedding is planned in May.

title: Plan for Study of Dome Over Town Is Approved
description: WINOOSKI, Vt., Nov. 24 (AP)  The City Council has decided to go ahead with plans for a study aimed at determining whether a dome could be placed over much of Winooski.

title: Practice of Excluding PublicBy Zoning Boards Attaced
description: ARTHUR KATZ is a lawyer, and he knows the law. when he wanted to install a solar hotwater system in his home in Mamaroneck, he asked the town's Zoning Board of Appeals for permission to put the necessary pipes and equipment on his roof.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE A 50Cent Tax Hike On Gasoline?
description: WASHINGTON  The two last Presidents, Richard M. Nixon and Gerald R. Ford, refused to do it, much as it might have appealed to them philosophically. Since then, the circumstances have changed a bit, but when Jimmy Carter first tried to do it, he was roundly rebuffed by Congress.

title: Recent Openings
description: A twocharacter play by Stephen Magowan about an emotional confrontation between two homosexuals. Directed by Elaine Shore. John Corry: It makes homosexual love not so much naughty as tedious, and not so much erotic as egocentric. At Theater Four, 424 W. 55th St. (2468545)

title: Article 5 -- No Title
LETTERS
description: To the Business Editor:

title: Mary Thornton Broman Wed
description: Mary Thornton Bromari, daughter of Mrs. Carl Braman of Staunton, Va., and the late Mr. Braman, was married there yesterday to Alec Wyton, organist and choirmaster at St. James Episcopal Church in New York and coordinator of the Standing Commission on Church Music of the Episcopal Church. The Rev. David Pittman performed the ceremony in Trinity Episcopal Church. The bridegroom's previous marriage ended in divorce.

title: A Crown Awaits Leonard in His Stiffest Test
description: There will be two other world championship fights on the nationally televised card. Across the ring from him will be the undefeated World Boxing Council welterweight champion. But Friday night is expected to be Sugar Ray Leonard's night.

title: Excerpts From Court of Appeals Opinion on Excluding Public
description: The petitioner, Westchester Rockland Newspapers Inc., commenced this proceeding to vacate an order which excluded the public and the press from a pretrial mental competency hearing in a criminal case in which the accused was charged with race. The order had been entered, at the request of the accused, by the respondent, Judge Russell R. Leggett, who presided at the hearing.

title: Seoul Business Ready To Vote for Democracy
description: SEOUL, South Korea  South's Acting President will formally succeed President Park Chung Hee next month, rubberstamped by the electoral college the late Mr. Park established to perpetuate his rule. Choi Kyu Hah is expected to serve, however, only until Mr. Park's autocratic 1972 constitution is reformed, and the big question in Seoul is who will take over after him, sometime in 1980.

title: Letters
description: Iran and the Dignity of the U.S.

title: On Language
description: A new American art form is emerging: the formal declaration of candidacy for President of the United States. In English classes across the country, students are being given the assignment: Write a 500word declaration of your candidacy for President, including your vision for America and the reason you are uniquely qualified to lead us into the 80's. Try to avoid the word leadership and the phrase prayerful consideration.

title: Drivers Warned to Heed Flashing Lights
description: BLUE, red or green. The color does not seem to make much difference, according to fire officials, who say that an increasing number of motorists appear to be ignoring the flashing lights on emergency fire vehicles, causing accidents and. in some cases, death.

title: 3 Bombings in Chicago Laid to Puerto Rican Group
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 24 (UPI)  Bombs exploded at a Naval Reserve armory and two military recruiting offices last night and early today. No injuries were reported in the bombings, which the authorities attributed to a Puerto Rican nationalist group.

title: Miss Stoddard Amherst Bride Of a Lawyer
description: Tracy Stoddard, daughter of Mrs. Esther Stoddard Graves of Amherst, Mass., and the late Col. Edward F. Stoddard U.S.A.F., was married yesterday to William F. Martin Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Martin of New York and

title: The French of New England Are Getting Nearly Speechless
description: FALL RIVER, Mass.  When Albina Roy sat down with her family on Thanksgiving Day here half a century ago, the banter that passed across the table along with the turkey was all in French. Last week, when Mrs. Roy sat down with her daughter and son-in-law and her grandchildren, all the requests for more dressing and cranberry sauce were in English. Not a word of French was spoken, even though everyone at the table was of French Canadian background.

title: In Britain, Class Counts Despite Social Revolution
description: LONDON, Nov. 24  While a social revolution has swept Britain since World War II, an obsession with class differences still appears to be strong.

title: L.I. Helicopter Crash Injures Pilot After Santa Claus Is Dropped Off
description: OAKDALE, L.I., Nov. 24 (AP)  A pilot was injured when his helicopter crashed behind a shopping plaza today minutes after he had dropped Santa Claus off to visit a crowd of children.

title: A NotSoMerry Chiristmas
description: EVEN at F.A.O. Schwarz, spirits seem a little down for this time of year. The giant Fifth Avenue toy store is hiring 10 percent fewer parttime salespeople than it did a year ago to help it through the crunch. Sears, Roebuck & Company, the Country's higgest retailer, says it might hire fewer too. And the Emporium in San Francisco, which hung a 68foot spruce from its central dome last week, says it won't be hiring any fewer workers  but that it will let many of them go right after Christmas, far earlier than usual.

title: Article 1 -- No Title
Arrest of 22 Klan Members at Jersey Home Foils Group's Plans for Rally
description: VINELAND, N.J., Nov. 24  Twentytwo Ku Klux Klan and American Nazi Party members were arrested on weapons charges two and a half hours before a scheduled Klan rally here today.

title: NEW JERSEY JOURNAL
description: EVERY year since 1974, the first week of December in Moms and Somerset Counties has brought a revival of ancient antagonisms between hunters and antihunters.

title: ABOUT WESTCHESTER
description: YONKERS MAUN a pukka pull evite vervet's vestas? The answer is moot, unless you want to know whether genuine Hungarian farm dog must avoid a monkey's friction matches.

title: Health
description: Mary S. is a 39yearold woman living on a farm in the Maryland countryside. When she was only 9 years of age, she developed a skin cancer on her face. Although skin cancers rarely occur in children that was the first of many for Mary S. In fact, over the past 10 years, physicians at the National Institutes of Health in Bethesda, Md., have treated her for more than 100 skin cancers, including several dangerous, malignant melanomas. In addition, the sun has so severely damaged her eyes that she is now blind.

title: CHESS
description: James Tarjan, a Berkeley, Calif., grandmaster, did not make it into the upper half of the score table in the Riga Interzonal Tournament, but he did have the satisfaction of winning one of the most brilliant games of the competition, against Edmar Mednis, an international master from Queens.

title: Jeremy Patricia Stone, Art Consultant, Betrothed to Wallace E. Rutherford 3d
description: Mrs. John A. Hesse of Scottsdale, Ariz., and Allan Barry Stone of Purchase, N.Y., and Seal Harbor, Me., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Jeremy Patricia Stone, to Wallace Eugene Rutherford 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Rutherford Jr. of Con- cord, Mass. Plans have been made for a wedding next June in Purchase.

title: Elizabeth Rice Neuhaus Is Wed
description: In Christ Episcopal Church Cathedral in Houston yesterday evening, Elizabeth Rice Neuhaus, daughter of Lacey T. Neuhaus and Philip R. Neuhaus. both of Houston, became the bride of Charles Dudley Armstrong, son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas M. Armstrong of Falmouth, Me. The Rev. Warren E. Haynes performed the ceremony. He was assisted by the Rev. Robert Gibson.

title: Around the Nation
description: HONOLULU, Nov. 24 (AP)  The negotiating committee of Hawaii's United Public Workers union voted overwhelmingly today to recommend rejection of a tentative agreement to end a fiveweekold strike by 7,700 public workers.

title: Wood, Field and Stream Meditations in Apple Orchard
description: UNITY, N.H.  I saw no deer during three days of hunting in New Hampshire, but that really wasn't depressing, because I found another abandoned apple orchard.

title: NEW JERSEY HOUSING Irvington: A Town in Transition
description: IRVINGTON LIKE many young married couples, Mr. and Mrs. Paul DeFilippo had spent more than year looking for a house they could afford. After combing the suburbs, they finally settled on a home in this Essex County community.

title: U.S.C. Romps To Bowl
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 24 (A.P) Charles White ran for 194 yards and four touchdowns today as Southern California wen the Pacific10 Conference championship and a Rose Bowl berth with a 4914 rout of the University of California, Los Angeles.

title: BOOK ENDS
description: Rumer Godden made the most intriguing comment we have heard all year about the novelistic process: I write my story first, and do my research afterward.

title: The NBC'of Baseball: 26 Rhymes for Hot Stove League Fans
description: The NBC's of Baseball: 26 Rhymes for Hot Stove League FansTHE NBC's of Baseball might not be the best title for these verses, but I'm damned if I'm going to use the name of that other television network that persists in using announcers that don't know  or apparently careanything about the National Pastime.

title: Article 10 -- No Title
Smu!Iling Exotic Birds on Rise; Quarantine Facilities Planned
description: MIAMI, Nov. 24 (AP)  Illicit traffic in exotic birds is nearly as active as the traffic in cocaine, say Federal officials, who plan to open new bird centers to deal with the traffic.

title: ART  A Show That May Stir Reverie and Anger
description: FOUNDobject sculpture first made claims to legitimacy in 1917, when Marcel Duchamp created his Fountain from a standard urinal and considerable chutzpah. At the time, Duchamp's anarchistic statements questioned the very nature of art; but ultimately, his lowly plumbing fixtures, bicycle wheels and bottle racks were elevated to the status of art objects merely by his having designated them worthy of notice.

title: Electric Cars Defect: Too Quiet for Safety
description: DENVER, Nov. 24 (AP)  The Department of Energy says electric cars are so quiet that a way must be found to make them noisier, to warn unsuspecting pedestrians.

title: Some at Instrument Sale Find Passion and Price Out of Tune
description: On the auctioneer's stage was a rare 18thcentury Italian violin, an object of desire for an audience of 400  instrument dealers and musicians who had come to buy, and music lovers who could afford no more than a look and a sigh.

title: Grandmother Held in Shooting
description: FREMONT, Neb., Nov. 24 (AP) A 67yearold grandmother, May Hurley, has been charged with shooting her grandson after they quarreled while she was fixing Thanksgiving dinner, the authorities say. The grandson, William Cookman, 17 years old, was in satisfactory condition yesterday at Dodge Memorial Hospital, recovering from a shotgun wound in his right hip.

title: From Iran, Arc of Crisis
description: WASHINGTON  It began on Nov. 4 as a test of nerves between the United States and an aging, Iranian holy man, Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini. But after three weeks of stalemate over the fate of Americans held hostage at the embassy in Teheran, Washington's travail was transformed into a fullblown regional crisis, threatening chaos throughout the Middle East and undermining Washington's strategic position in that vital area.

title: Teheran Crisis Said to Prompt U.S. Cohesion
description: A town in New Jersey has planned boardwalk Shout for America Day. An Iranian expatriate, now a United States citizen living in California, has applied for a vendor's license to sell American flags. A released hostage from Pennsylvania returned home to a parade.

title: HOME CLINIC A Plumber's Friend': Getting Acquainted
description: EVEN the most inexperienced of doityourselfers is likely to be familiar with the tool many call the plumber's friendotherwise known as a force cup or plunger. After trying a chemical drain cleaner, and often even before using a chemical drain opener, this is the tool that the home handyman or handywoman will reach for when a drain gets clogged or starts to act sluggish.

title: GARDENING Adolescence and Maturity in Plants
description: CONSIDER Hedera helix, the English ivy. It seems that the commonlygrown forms, those with the pointed lobed leaves, are immature forms  juveniles, if you will. While they can be propagated by rooting cuttings, they are not yet capable of flowering and sexual reproduction.

title: ANTIQUES
description: The current revival of interest in needlework commenced with the rediscovery of petit point and gros point 20 years ago, and it is still unraveling for those skilled in stitchery and those who collect period examples. Indeed, since needlework was popularized in the 1960's, enthusiasts have found that they could, if they chose, pursue such other alternatives to needlepoint as crewel embroidery, macrame, quilting and lace making. And judging by recent historical exhibitions, there is long way to go before all of the techniques explored by artisans through the ages are reinterpreted by today's needleworkers and acquired by collectors who covet them.

title: CHINESE NUTRITION IS FAULTED IN STUDY
description: PEKING, Nov. 24  The growth rate of Chinese children slows significantly after they are weaned, compared to American infants, apparently because they are put directly on adult food, a researcher from Columbia University has found.

title: Athletics Programs Take Off at purchase
description: THE State University of New York College at Purchase, known for its academic excellence in the arts, has begun a varsity athletics program, and the gymnasium is full of activity.

title: COOKING
description: BECAUSE newly published cookbooks provide insight into the development of eating habits and changing tastes in cooking, there is much to be learned from a detailed critique of an entire year's production. But while that is perhaps a worthy project, it may be better suited to another time and place. At this time of year, when the pressure of holi- day shopping is upon us, it seems more the point evaluate some of the notable and interesting new cookbooks that are the most likely gift candidates. If one had to pick a theme for this year's crop, it would be Plain and Fancy, for the offerings seem almost equally divided between the fundamental and the comolicated and recherch.

title: FastGrowing Tree Is Seen Saving Tropical Forests
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (AP)  A tree that can produce things from a cocktail snack to a soderosion barrier is being promoted by United States experts as a partial remedy for the massive destruction of forests in tropical and semitropical countries.

title: Poland's National Five Beats Princeton, 6862
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Nov. 24 Krzysztof Kikiel and Andrzei Suda sparked a late secondhalf rally and led Poland's national basketball team to 6862 triumph over Princeton at Jadwin Gym tonight.

title: The Nation
description: Jimmy Carter has the money, and last week he got the time. The Federal Communications Commission decided that television networks should not have denied a Carter campaign committee request to buy a halfhour, primetime slot for the official reelection drive kickoff on Dec. 4.

title: Kennedy Oil Statement Is Challenged by Strauss
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (AP)  Robert S. Strauss, chairman of President Carter's reelection panel, today disputed Senator Edward M. Kennedy's contention that decontrolling oil prices would cost the average family $1,000 a year.

title: Jolanne E. Luchak And James Stanton Plan Jan. 12 Bridal
description: Dr. and Mrs. George Luchak of Princeton, N.J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Jolanne Elizabeth Luchak, to James Locke Stanton, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert J. Stanton of Tulsa, Okla., formerly of Riverside, Conn.

title: ExPrime Minister says U.S. Caused Iran Crisis
description: PARIS, Nov. 24 (UPI)  Shahpour Bakhtiar, the former Prime Minister of Iran, said today that the Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini is a crazy old imbecile and that the United States helped cause the current situation in Iran.

title: THEATER MAILBAG
description: The article on Evita by Michael Owen [A London Hit Arrives  With a Controversial Heroine, Sept. 23] was gem. His account clearly reflects my feelings and, I am certain, those of many others.

title: ARCHITECTURE VIEW
description: This is a tale of two vintage Broadway buildings: Exchange Court at 52 Broadway. built in 1898 by the architectural firm of Clinton and Russell, Cats Gilbert's Woolworth Building of 1913 at 233 Broadway Each has its place in the history of New York skyscraper. Exchange Court is an increasingly rare example of early steel frame construction. with a facade of sixinchthick Indiana limestone and terracotta trim. Designed when architects were architects and stone was stone, and a building was naked without cartouches, voussoirs and cornices, its 12 stories are rich in the kind classically detailed masonry that a leading architectural firm of its day produced as a matter of course for its business clients. Even with some alterations at the base and the loss of the statues that once topped the Broadway entrance, the building still has the kind of substance and presence that marks an endangered architectural species.

title: Greek Conducts Music  and Leftist Drive
description: ATHENS, Nov. 24  Mikis Theodorakis, the 54yearold bard of leftist Greek politics who composed the music for such film hits as Zorha the Greek and Serpico, recently conducted the Athens State Orchestra, 35 years after the opportunity was first offered to him. A scheduled appearance in 1944, when he was only 19 years old and a political rebel, was canceled as punishment for burning down his teacher's house.

title: Belfast Prison Officer Shot Dead
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 24 (Reuters)  A Belfast prison officer was found shot dead in his home last night, the police said today. An anonymous caller told The Press Association, the British domestic news agency, that the man was killed by guerrillas of the Irish Republican Army.

title: REAL FAMILY INCOME ROSE SLIGHTLY IN '78
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (UPI)  The median income of American families was slightly higher last year, after accounting for inflation, than it was in 1977, the Census Bureau said today.

title: TV VIEW
description: In their continuing efforts to establish a workable niche within the giant television industry, independent producers are running up against a new code word. Suddenly, prestigious seminars and learned essays, attention has turned to something called gate keeping. The real issue, complicated and important, is editorial control. Can an independent producer have totally free access to a station that is licensed by the Federal government? When is some editorial oversight enough? Is any interference too much? One extreme example of tight controls can be found at the commercial networks where the news departments are traditionally reluctant to accept any material produced outside their precincts. When David Frost, who is technically an independent, recently created a public flap about the way NBC was handling his interview with Henry Kissinger, the immediate response of William Small, president NBC News, was that the network's use of outsiders would have to be reevaluated. On the other hand, NBC is not beyond using exclusive stories filed by outsiders. John Alpert's reports from Cambodia and his interviews with Fidel Castro en route to the United Nations were given prominent network showcases, complete with generous onair credits for Mr. Alpert.

title: Technology
description: DETROIT  Last week, as part of a national advertising campaign, General Motors told readers The New York Times Why GM Cars Will Get Better Mileage Than the Government Requires. The ad was only one symptom of the automotive industry's most recent change of heart. Detroit is now, it seems, voluntarily surrendering its allegiance to the big cars of the 1960's and 1970's.

title: GARDENING Adolescence and Maturity in Plants
description: CONSIDER Hedera helix, the English ivy. It seems that the commonlygrown forms, those with the pointed lobed leaves, are immature forms  juveniles, if you will. While they can be propagated by rooting cuttings, they are not yet capable of flowering and sexual reproduction.

title: Mom's Paycheck; Instead of Apple Pie
description: LOT of inbetween people live in affluent suburbia. Not rich, not poor, not avantgarde jet set people. Just ordi- nary folks.

title: Atlanta Gets Curb on Pistols
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 24(AP)  The Atlanta City Council has passed and Mayor Maynard Jackson has signed into law an ordinance setting a 60day waiting period to buy a pistol in the city. Under the law, gun dealers will be required to wait 60 days before turning a weapon over to a purchaser while the police check whether the wouldbe buyer has a criminal record or a history of mental illness.

title: Ocean County: Retiring Spot
description: MANCHESTER TWP. FOR many years, Florida and Arizona have been magnets for those retiring couples who want yearround sunshine, but Ocean County is fast becoming the center for retirement villages for people who prefer the four seasons.

title: SUBWAY TRANSFORMS VENEZUELAN CAPITAL
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Nov. 24  Construction of a new subway system is changing the face of this crowded South American capital. Block after block of buildings have been demolished and thousands of residents and businesses have been relocated to make way for Venezuela's first rapid transit system.

title: Advice From a ReaderAloudtoChildren
description: Do parents still read to children in this age television? I hope they do, and not only because reading to children when they are young is alleged to be one of the best ways of encouraging them to read to themselves when they are older More important, I think, is the fun shared and remembered, One of the great pleasures recalled from my own childhood was my mother reading to me. She was a splendid readeraloud, spirited and expressive. She was also an astute skipper. When I discovered that she was leaving out static descriptive passages in Ivanhoe and footnotes in Francis Parkman's Conspiracy of Pontiac, Iobjected and insisted on the unexpurgated text. As a readeraloud in later times, however, I have become a skipper myself.

title: Cuomo Takes Control Of State's Carter Effort
description: Having campaigned for President Carter's renomination for some weeks now, Lt. Gov. Mario Cuomo made it official late yesterday with the announcement that he was heading the CarterMondale Reelection Committee in New York State.

title: Sun to Heat New Mexico Home on Winter Nights
description: SUNLAND PARK, N.M., Nov. 24 (UPI)  A farm worker's family in southern New Mexico will be basking in warmth from the sun even at night this winter because of a demonstration project designed to show that solar power can be used economically in the most modest home.

title: Letters to the Travel Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Article 7 -- No Title
Penguins Set Back Rangers
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 24  John Davidson played in Syracuse tonight while the New York Rangers played here against the Penguins. Both the team and their No. 1 goalie lost, 53.

title: CHANGES ARE URGED IN PRESS SHIELD LAW
description: An Assembly subcommittee began hearing testimony last week on a proposed amendment to a New York State law protecting the confidentiality of reporters notes and sources of information.

title: LaborStyle Negotiations Tested To Coordinate City Plans in U.S.
description: ST. PAUL, Nov. 21  W.J. Usery, the former Secretary of Labor, has had a long and successful career in settling labor disputes. Now he is a private mediator using the same techniques in a new arena, an arena in which the negotiators are not labor and management but representatives of the Federal, state and city governments as well as private interests.

title: CONNECTICUT GUIDE
description: 'Three Centuries of Connecticut Folk Art, the first exhibition of its kind in New England, is moving from Hartford to the Museum of Art, Science and Industry in Bridgeport, where it is to open Thursday and remain until Jan. 13.

title: DINING OUT
description: YOU have to know exactly where to look in order to find the Upstairs Restaurant, which is situated over a bakery in Great Neck. By way of identification there is but a small blue neon sign in the vestibule window. Once you locate it, however, your efforts will be rewarded with dining that is interesting, sophisticated and often very good.

title: School Boards' Head: HomeRule Partisan
description: ACCORDING to the new edition of The Almanac of American Politics, New Jersey is a muchmaligned state, an object of derision for New Yorkers and a place little known by almost everyone else.

title: New Face of Scout Leaders
description: WHEN I first started as a Brownie leader, people thought it was odd, said Trish Lamb. They wondered why someone like me, who wasn't married and wasn't a parent, would ever want to take on a troop.

title: DayCare Center Presses Search for Home
description: PORT WASHINGTON AFTER occupying three different locations in its two years of existence, the Port Washington Children's Center has begun a complicated series of steps its staff members and directors hope will lead to a permanent or at least longterm home.

title: POLITICS
description: DESPITE pressure from Ronald Reagan, in particular, the Nassau and Suffolk Republican organizations have adopted a neutral stance, at least for now, in the multicandidate race for the G.O.P. Presidential nomination.

title: San Francisco Held in Contempt
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 24 (AP) The city of San Francisco has been found in civil contempt of court for not having enough Chinese translators at the polls in the Nov. 6 election. Federal District Judge Cecil Poole said yesterday that the city was in violation of a court order issued in 1978 to protect the rights of nonEnglishspeaking citizens.

title: 44 Killed and 600 Hurt By Quake in Colombia
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Nov. 24 (AP)The most powerful earthquake to hit Colombia in 20 years left 44 persons dead and 600 injured, and caused $20 million in damage, Government officials said today.

title: 2 New Polls Show Reagan Ahead Of Republican Nomination Rivals
description: The latest Gallup and ABC NewsLouis Harris polls both show former Gov. Ronald Reagan of California well ahead of all his rivals for the Republican Presidential nomination.

title: Family Fights Stigma of Illness
description: PHILIP Behrman is 11 years old and extremely disruptive and hard to control in class, says a spokesman for the school he goes to. We don't know what to do with him.

title: Prague Says Washington Is Using Military Threats
description: PRAGUE, Nov. 24 (AP)  The United States is making a clatter of weapons around the world, posing a threat to international development and third world countries, the Communist Party daily, Rude Pravo, said today.

title: Article 8 -- No Title
Brooklyn Tech Captures Borough Harrier Crown
description: Brooklyn Tech easily won the team title yesterday in the Public Schools Athletic League crosscountry borough championships at Van Cortlandt Park in the Bronx.

title: Plan to End Inpatient Care at Sydenham Criticized
description: A plan by the Koch administration to begin closing inpatient services at Sydenham Hospital in Harlem by mid-December was assailed yesterday by critics of the Mayor's program to consolidate health care services.

title: Nuclear Chief Taking Wider Role
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (UPI)  The chairman of the Nuclear Regulatory Commission said today that he had taken charge of the agency's emergency response team and planned to assume control of the commission's entire daily operations.

title: BRIDGE
description: you are the world's topranked player. In a career spanning 23 years you have won 16 world team titles, a record that will probably stand for all time. You are desperately anxious to win just one more, for this is your last chance: At the age of 56, battling with players half your age and with not quarter of your experience, you have announced your retirement from international play.

title: NO ACTION IMMINENT, U. S. MILITARY SAYS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24  President Carter briefly discussed with his senior Pentagon advisers at Camp David today the military options open to him in the Iranian crisis. But Defense Department officials said later that no military action was imminent or had been decided on.

title: DANCE VIEW
description: The first premiere of the New York City Ballet season has turned out to be very interesting, well within the City Ballet mold but absorbing the company's ruling esthetic rather than merely copying it. The choreographer is Peter Martins and the ballet is Sonate di Scarlatti, which is set, in fact, to 11 piano sonatas by Domenico Scarlatti. Mr. Martins takes a firm step forward here as a choreographer with what is his fourth work, one major enough to hold its place without any apology in the City Ballet repertory.

title: Wittenberg Tops Widener For N.C.A.A. Final Berth
