description: SPRINGFIELD, Ohio, Nov. 24 (AP)  After missing two earlier tries from inside 30 yards, Mike Dowds booted a 41yard field goal with two seconds left in the game to give Wittenberg a 1714 victory over Widener today and a berth in the National Collegiate Division III championship game next week.

title: HOW CARTER CAN WIN
description: Conventional Wisdom is one of those Usually Reliable Sources beloved of political pundits, a shadowy figure whose opinions reek of selfserving rumor and selffulfilling prophecy. These days C.W. has it that Jimmy Carter's campaign for reelection is neckdeep in trouble  and he's already standing on his toes.

title: CHRISTINA NEUHARTH
description: HURON, S.D., Nov. 24 (AP) Christina Neuharth, mother of Allen Neuharth, chairman and president of the Gannett Company, died yesterday at nursing home. She was 86 years old.

title: ANTIQUES
description: HARTFORD LOOKING GLASSES may be regarded by their owners today as decorative accents for a room or a necessary adjunct to vanity. They had the same uses in the years before homes were brightened by gaslight or electricity, but in those earlier centuries they also reflected firelight from the hearth and the flames of candles, multiplying the light in a mom.

title: Aggressive Music Is In His Future
description: ROSLYN

title: Landing Pad for Greenwich Resident's Copter Upsets His Neighbors
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Nov. 24  Gerald Tsai's hobby is his helicopter, and it has stirred up a flap among some of his neighbors here as well as officials. The issue is whether he should use his boat dock as a landing pad.

title: Catholic Church in Spain Attacks Regime's Plan for Legal Divorce
description: MADRID, Nov. 24 (Reuters)  Spain's Roman Catholic Church hierarchy today attacked Government plans to legalize divorce, which has been banned since the 193639 civil war.

title: Lawmakers Disregard Deficit Warnings and Override Vetoes
description: Last Monday, as the Assembly prepared to return to Albany to try to override Governor Carey's vetoes of bills to help the needy with their heating bills, the state budget director called reporters to a conference. He grimly announced that the state faced a budget gap of $200 million to $400 million next year.

title: BOSTON:THE PROBLEM THAT WON'T GO AWAY
description: More than ever, Boston is a city of postcard beauty and charm. Tourists are impressed by its architecture and history. To those who troop its Freedom Trail, to the brigades of parents who park their station wagons at its dormi- Boston looks like a city that blight has somehow bypassed. Even late on midweek nights, downtown is alive, the subways relatively safe. The renovation of the Faneuil Hall area three oncedilapidated 19thcentury wholesale food markets  has created an urban buffet of openair restaurants and shops on a revitalized waterfront.

title: Police Recruit Arrested In a Gun and Drug Case
description: A probationary police recruit, appointed to the force earlier this month, was arrested early yesterday morning in south Brooklyn on charges of illegally possessing a handgun and a small amount of hashish.

title: Paperbacks: New and Noteworthy
description: These recently published volumes are especially suitable for giftgiving.

title: Letter TO THE EDITOR
description: Early in Isaac Stern: The Power and the Glory (Oct. 19), Stephen Rubin ticks off a tiny list of the violinist's peers in age and reputation: Jascha Heifetz, 78, Nathan Milstein, 79, and Yehudi Menuhin, 63. It seems puzzling and strange that a writer with the apparent knowledge of Mr. Rubin should have omitted from this group the name of Ruggiero Ricci, 61, one of the most brilliant technicians of this or any other age. I trust I speak for each one of the hundreds of thousands whom Mr. Ricci has thrilled in concert and on records when, for this snub, I demand, not an explanation, but an unqualified apology.

title: ANTIQUES
description: ANDOVER

title: SPORTS
description: THEY arrived by the hundreds last week to honor the past, celebrate the present and mourn the future.

title: A Rich Sampling of Anita Ellis
description: Avita Ellis is a singer who is both elusive and a perfectionist. Her elusiveness results from a combination of stagefright and her drive for perfection. The stagefright, she concedes. is an illness. But having overcome her stagefright sufficiently to give her first fullscale concert at Alice Tully Hall last February, she interrupted herself several times to make new starts on songs that were not going well enough to satisfy her.

title: WESTCHESTER JOURNAL
description: DELAYS on Conrail's Harlem Division 6:46 A.M. train from Brewster is not considered news to the hundreds of commuters who ride each day. But its arrival on time is.

title: Helen Mulford Is Fiance Of Harold Peter Cook 3d
description: The engagement of Helen Elizabeth Mulford, daughter of Dr. Felix G. Mulford of Totowa, N.J., and the late Nell Harris Mulford, to Harold Peter Cook 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Cook Jr. of North Haledon, N.J., has been announced by the bride-to-be's father. The wedding is planned for November of next year.

title: Another Letter From Phil Bieber
description: In the early 1920's, Phil Bieber writes, Meyer Boston and his brother Sam were smalltime hus. tiers working the Lower East Side of Manhattan. They handled bets from immigrants, pushcart peddlers and small storekeepers. They took bets as small as a nickel. rarely one for more than a dollar. They opened Sports of The Times room for poker, stuss and other card games. They prospered.

title: Judge Denies Move to Bar Funds For Spraying Mexico Poppy Crop
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (UPI)  A Federal district judge has rejected a request by the National Organization for the Reform of Marijuana Laws for a halt to all United States funds for spraying of dangerous herbicides on poppy crops in Mexico.

title: HOME CLINIC A Plumber's Friend Getting Acquainted
description: EVEN the most inexperienced of doityourselfers is likely to be familiar with the tool many call the plumber's friend otherwise known as a force cup or plunger. After trying a chemical drain cleaner, and often even before using chemical drain opener, this is the tool that the home handyman or handywoman will reach for when a drain gets clogged or starts to act sluggish.

title: McKinney Keeps His Hat On
description: WHEN Representative Stewart B. McKinney recently bought three new suits and new eyeglasses, some of his staff members thought it was the tipoff that the 48-year-old Fairfield Republican was going to run for the United States Senate.

title: Arts and Leisure Guide
description: Last month, children in the school of the New York City Ballet turned out in force for tryouts for The Nutcracker. Now that the coveted roles of mice and toy soldiers have been filled, the company will commence its annual monthtong presentation of the ballet with its Gothic tale by Hoffman set to a Tchaikovsky score. The Nutcracker opens Friday and runs through Dec. 31, with a schedule convenient for children. (See Dance)

title: Wine
description: They are called monster wines, perhaps the biggest and most intensely flavored wines that most consumers will ever encounter. Their color is dark as ink, and they emit an odor of virile wildness laden with intense fruit. They are mysterious, for their origins are unknown, perhaps somewhere in Italy, perhaps in Eastern Europe. They are the zinfandels of California, enormous and exciting reds that are now emerging as the best that California can produce.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (AP)  The World Boxing Association lightweight title fight between Ernesto Espana of Venezuela, the champion, and Leonidas Asprilla of Colombia was canceled at the last minute today because, the fighters said, they did not receive the purses promised them.

title: Utah Symphony Appoints Proteg of Mehta
description: Varoujan Kodjian, a 34-year-old protg of Zubin Mehta, has been appointed the new music director of the Utah Symphony, the orchestra has announced. Mr. Kodiian, born in Lebanon of Armenian parentage and trained at the Paris Conservatory and the Curtis Institute in Philadelphia, became assistant concertmaster of the Los Angeles Philharmonic at the age of 19, and subsequently studied conducting in Vienna at Mr. Mehta's expense. of Armenian parentage and trained at the Paris Conservatory and the Curtis Institute in Philadelphia, became assistant concertmaster of the Los Angeles Philharmonic at the age of 19, and subsequently studied conducting in Vienna at Mr. Mehta's expense.

title: Centerpiece of Vancouver: GimmickFree Courthouse
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia The new courthouse in this western Canadian city is clearly the centerpiece of downtown, and that is so despite the fact that it has no classical columns, no formal portico, and no marble lobby, the way most courthouses that stand as syInbols do. Moreover, the new Law Courts, completed this autumn, is just seven stories high, making it dwarfed by many of this city's gleaming new skyscrapers.

title: World News Briefs
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, Nov. 24 (AP)  Thirtyfive Vietnamese refugees died when their boat broke up in rough waters in the South China Sea near the Malaysian port of Kuala Trengganu, the police said today.

title: Westchester/This Week
description: ELMSFORD  Same Time, Next Year, starring Betsy Palmer, tonight. Hello Dolly, Tuesday to next Sunday, through Feb. 10. Opens 6:15 P.M., buffet at 7, show at 8:30. Sundays one hour earlier. $18.15 to $20.35. Reservations. An Evening Dinner Theater, 11 Clearbrook Rd. 592.2222.

title: ALLIGATOR IS MAKING A STRONG COMEBACK
description: MIAMI, Nov. 24 (AP)  Just a dozen years ago, after being shot, snared and speared for generations, the American alligator was considered so scarce that was declared an endangered species.

title: Fer Sale 9002
description: Period Furniture, Fine English and Oriental Porcelains, Quilts,Stoneware, Miniatures, Faintings, and Select Decorative Accesories. RUTH SIGEL ANTIQUES TuesdayFriday 11 to 5 PM Saturday 11 to 4 PM 45 East 80th Street New York, New York 10021 212 9883116

title: 6YearOld Boy Is Slain By Playmate in Newark
description: NEWARK, Nov. 24 (AP)  An 11yearold boy accidentally shot a 6yearold friend to death yesterday in the apartment building where they lived, the police said.

title: CHOICE OF A WOMAN ON HIGH COURT SEEN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (AP)  The next vacancy on the Supreme Court, where 116 men have served in its 189year history, will probably be filled by a woman.

title: It Takes Needles and Pins and Enkephalins
description: For more than 2,000 years the Chinese have pierced one another with needles as a way of relieving pain and other symptoms of illness. Medical and lay visitors to China have seen needled patients, fully conscious and seemingly pain free, as surgeons drilled into their skulls to remove brain tumors. Now, an effort is under way with modern medical methods to explain the anesthetic effects of acupuncture.

title: The Impasse Is Due for Debate at Dublin Meeting This Week
description: LONDON  Europe will not be built in a day nor as part of some overall design, declared Robert Schuman, the French statesman and champion of European unity, almost 30 years ago. It will be built through practical achievements that first create a sense of common purpose.

title: Television This Week
description: Today

title: Court Ruling Studied
description: WHITE PLAINS THE decision last week of the Court of Appeals, the state's highest court, narrowing the grounds for excluding the press and public from courtrooms decision on a matter that arose in Westchester  was being reviewed last week by the two sides.

title: Lowering the Cost Of a World Cruise
description: Despite the soaring cost of fuel, labor, food and all the other ingredients of travel, you do not have to be very very rich to cruise around the world. In fact, the main wealth that you need is the time to do it.

title: Curtis Read Jr. Marries Louise D. Lindsay
description: Louise D. Lindsay, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George N. Lindsay of New York and Cold Spring Harbor, L.I., was married in Cold Spring Harbor yesterday to Curtis S. Read Jr., son of Mrs. Read of Oyster Bay, L.I., and the late Mr. Read. The Rev. Carleton Lee, rector of St. John's Episcopal Church in Cold Spring Harbor, performed the ceremony at the Lindsay home.

title: LONG ISLAND JOURNAL
description: LIKE most antiques shops, this one is properly cluttered with colored glass bottles, ship models, pewter goblets, paperweights and old furniture. But this particular shop and its contents are all in miniature, on a scale of one inch: :one foot. So small are they that some of the things, such as the tiniest of a group of pewter goblets, can be picked up only with tweezers.

title: Iran Executes 2 It Says Operated A Prostitution and Abortion Ring
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Nov. 24 (Reuters) Two men were executed today after an Islamic revolutionary court found them guilty of running a prostitution and abortion ring in the northeastern city of Mashhad, the Pars news agency reported.

title: Barbara Tallaksen Engaged
description: Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Tallaksen of Essex Fells, N.J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Barbara Ann Tallaksen, to Morgan Thomas Browne, son of Mr. and Mrs. Morgan Trew Browne of New Canaan, Conn. A wedding is planned on April 26 in Essex Fells.

title: Article 11 -- No Title
To Cowboys, Error Is Inhuman
description: David Stalls, hitherto an obscure although important member of the Dallas Cowboys, suddenly attained renown equal to that of teammates such as Roger Staubach, Tony Dorsett or Drew Pearson halfway through the final period of the Thanksgiving Day game against the Houston Oilers. But Stalls scored no touchdown, caught no pass, and made no blocks or tackles to save the game.

title: Mylar Now a Practical Sailcloth
description: After several years of testing, the first breakthrough in sailcloth in nearly 25 years has become practical. Mylar sailcloth, which is exceptionally strong but light, has been developed and now is superior to Dacron for use in onedesign sailboat sails and Genoa jibs on offshore racing yachts.

title: Fuel Aid Legislation Is Called `Significant'
description: HARTFORD

title: Curb on Homosexuality in Texas Is Challenged in Suit by Teacher
description: DALLAS, Nov. 24 (UPI)  A homosexual teacher has filed a suit in Federal District Court challenging the Texas law on homosexuality, in part to demonstrate tc young people the effectiveness of the American justice system.

title: Hotel Complex Sought For Kentucky Fire Site
description: SOUTHGATE, Ky., Nov. 24 (AP)City officials say a $30 million hotel and entertainment complex may rise within a year on the site of the Beverly Hills Supper Club, which burned in a 1977 fire that killed 165 people.

title: Pique Behind the Kitchen Door
description: Everyone wants to be a host, the saying goes, with a warm smile and glad hand. And for many people, it's compelling reason to go into the restaurant business. But although chefs and restaurant owners may like to expound upon the joys of their profession and their hardwon skills, they rarely talk openly of the headaches that running such establishments entail.

title: Giving Shakespeare A Voice for the 80's
description: SHAKESPEARE is an image of custom and manners, Jan Kott said the other day. Each age looks for a new mirror, and this is why there are new productions each year. The contemporary Shakespeare reflects the change of each generation.

title: The Case of Mr. L., A Tourette Victim
description: M R. L., 58 years old, who lives in Bergen County and does not want to be identified as a victim of the syndrome, tells a typical story.

title: Mecca Attack Provokes Riots in Southern India
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 24 (UPI)  Violence erupted for the second successive day today in the southern city of Hyderabad in reaction to the seizure of the Grand Mosque in Mecca by a band of Islamic zealots. The Hyderabad police fired on looters and arsonists.

title: THE HUMAN FACTOR IN INFLATION
description: It was an authentic genius who penned the concise Austrian Army communique of World War 1 that our troops advanced 25 miles today in a retrogressive direction. Even he would wince, however, at the news releases of President Carter's Council of Economic Advisers: it keeps sending us the glad tidings that we may shortly suffer from only a 10 percent annual increase in prices (as long as OPEC cooperates, of course, which it shows no inclination to do). Mr. Carter's retrogressive economic troops, combining inflation with unemployment, managed some time ago to reach what became known as stagflation. Now, marching further backward, they seem to be combining inflation with recession to reach slumpflation.

title: The Family Doctor Makes a Comeback
description: PISCATAWAY

title: A Selection of the Best Books of 1979
description: ALBERT CAMUS. A Biography.  Herbert R. Lottman. (Doubleday. $16.95.) The first biography the author of The Stranger is exhaustive, a labor of love and of wonderful industry

title: Who Is Ambivalent About Women?
description: TRUE or False: Tis an evil lot to have a man's ambition and woman's heart? If you are a business or pro- fessional woman who is beyond the struggle and you always feel comfortable in the role of powerseeker, you can skip this article. Or if you and Phyllis Schlafey are soul mates and you yearn only to be a happy servant, read no further.

title: Tribute to Ernest Bloch
description: Ernest Bloch (18801959) is today chiefly remembered for his Schelomo (1915), which in fact may be programmed more than all his other music put together. Friday night at Alice Tully Hall, as a slightly premature centennial tribute to the composer, the Cleveland Quartet offered something far less familiar  the String Quartet No. 2 (1945). Both the performance and the strong, strenuous score proved nothing less than memorable, and left one looking forward to future anniversary explorations of Block's output.

title: Mailbox: N.Y.R A. States Its Case
description: I feel it is imperative to set the record straight on Horse Racing's Neglected Regulars, as they were described in Steve Cady's column of Nov. 13.

title: FIGHT TO SAVE THE CITY'S FINE WATER
description: Most New Yorkers regard the Central Park Reservoir as a body of water to jog around. Yet anyone who lives in the Manhattan sections whose pipes are full of Croton water sip from the Central Park Reservoir every day. Framed by apartment towers and surrounded by a high wire fence, the reservoir is a working unit in the water supply system that, in addition, keeps New Yorkers clean, extinguishes their fires, stores heat as steam in their radiators, turns their cement into concrete, and washes their streets (though that not particularly well).

title: No Cause Is Found For Inquiry on Fight
description: The New York State Athletic Commission, after a special meeting yesterday, said there would be no inquiry into Friday night's bout at the Felt Forum, in which Willie Classen, a middleweight, was critically injured.

title: Ballet Theater Dancers Set Benefits for Own Fund
description: The dancers of the American Ballet Theater plan two benefits for their unemploymentsupport fund. Many of the company's principal dancers will appear in a performance today at Goucher College in Towson, Md.

title: Phone Data of Kennedy Workers Subpoenaed in New Hampshire
description: MANCHESTER, N.H., Nov. 24 (UPI)  The Federal Election Commission has subpoenaed the telephone records of about 1,500 draftKennedy workers in New Hampshire because of charges by the Carter campaign committee that the Kennedy workers violated Federal election laws.

title: Dutch Protest NATO Missiles
description: UTRECHT, the Netherlands, Nov. 24 (Reuters)  several thousand people attended a rally here today to protest NATO plans to station nuclear missiles in the Netherlands and four other West European countries, the police said. It was the second such demonstration in the Netherlands in eight days.

title: ...and They Expand Operations in Region
description: Two titans among Canadian real estate developers are expanding their activities in the New York area.

title: Carter Woos Jewish Vote But It's Still Up for Grabs
description: WASHINGTON  A few hours before Philip M. Klutznick's nomination as Secretary of Commerce was made public a fortnight ago, a prominent Jewish leader in Washington received a courtesy call from the White House. That makes three, the leader replied, noting, as the White House hoped he would, that Mr. Klutznick's confirmation would put more Jews in the Carter cabinet than in any previous Administration's.

title: W.D. Smith Fianc Of Claire de Tarr
description: Mr. and Mrs. Francis de Tarr of Berkeley, Calif., and Brussels have announced the engagement of their daughter, Claire Vivienne Angela de Tarr, to Winthrop Davenport Smith, son of Mr. and Mrs. Marcel A. Smith of Litchfield. Conn.

title: Katherine Fletcher Is Betrothed
description: Katherine Fletcher, a former assistant director of the domestic policy staff for environmental affairs at the White House, and Kenneth S. Weiner, deputy executive director of the White House Council on Environmental Quality, plan to be married next spring.

title: What's Doing in CAMBRIDGE, Mass.
description: COLLEGE TOWN  Cambridge is the quintessential college town, a suburb of Boston but a city with a character and grace of its own. Home of two of the world's leading centers of learning  Harvard University and the Massachusetts Institute of Technology Cambridge has long influenced the nation's intellectual and cultural life. The redbrick sidewalks of Harvard Square offer visitors a mixture of street musicians and political activists, peddlers and Pulitzer Prize winners. Even with the main street, Massachusetts Avenue, torn up for subway construction, the many coffeehouses in the square still serve as the favorite meeting place of students and teachers.

title: New Jersey/This Week
description: BLOOMFIELD (Bloomfield College, Franklin and Fremont Streets) - Death of a Salesman. in an Actor's CafeTheater production. Thursday through Saturday, 8:30 P.M. (through Dec. 15). $3.50$5.50; students and the elderly, $2.50-$4.50; group rates. (201)

title: Diana Kubitsky Married To John A. Fields Jr.
description: St. Michael's Roman Catholic Church in Hollidaysburg, Pa., was the setting yesterday for the marriage of Diana M. Kubitsky and John A. Fields Jr. The Rev. Faber Malloy performed the ceremony.

title: DRAWINGS
description: WHAT is a cartoon book? Is it a collection existing work or an offering of new drawings? If it is an anthology, should it be arranged by theme, by time, or by some other principle? And how much should be written about the artist? Does the book mean to introduce the artist to a new public (with the necessity for some background information), or is it intended to appeal to the artist's established audience? Of course, cartoon books are all these things, and here are four new specimens so different in structure and content as to constitute a short course in cartoon publishing.

title: SHOP TALK Reaping for Sewing
description: TEN years ago, Pat McGuire's sewing was limited to making an occasional pair of curtains or a Halloween costume. Then a friend showed her a quick, easy way to make a master pattern and gave her some basic sewing lessons.

title: Jan E. English Sets Wedding
description: Mr. and Mrs. William R. English of Clinton, N.Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Jan Ellen English, to John E. Leary Jr. of Chicago, son of Mr. and Mrs. Leary of Berryville, Ark. A wedding next spring is planned.

title: Winning Football at Army Still a Possibility
description: I has been 21 years since Army had a truly first class, nationallyranked football team. More than half of the 4,000 cadets at West Point were not born then.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: Premarital Pact Is Upset
description: SANTA FE, N.M., Nov. 24 (UPI)  The New Mexico Supreme Court has concluded that a man's alleged agreement to marry a terminally ill woman if he was named sole heir of her estate violated a public policy against marrying for money. In a ruling written by Chief Justice Dan Sosa Jr., the court rejected the assertion of Robert W. Lord that he was entitled to the estate of his late wife, Bernice Jarrott Lord, because of an oral agreement they had reached before their marriage in November 1974.

title: One Question Last Week Was Will It Play in Teheran?
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y.  The season here, like Broadway's, begins soon after Labor Day, and the big hit at the glass and concrete playhouse at Turtle Bay could well be titled, The Power of Negative Thinking.

title: Best Sellers
description: This Week

title: F.B.I. AGENTS SUBDUE A HIJACKER IN TEXAS
description: EL PASO, Nov 24  A teenager armed with a knife seized an American Airlines jetliner today and held about 20 persons captive for four hours at El Paso International Airport before being overpowered by agents of the Federal Bureau of Investieation.

title: Caryl T. S. Stern Bride Of Robert Stock, Editor
description: The marriage of Caryl Theresa Siegel Stern, an actress and freelance writer, to Robert W. Stock, a senior editor of The New York Times Magazine, took place yesterday. Civil Court Judge Seymour Schwartz performed the ceremony at the couple's Manhattan apartment.

title: LETTERS TO THE CONNECTICUT EDITOR
description: I read with interest and amusement the article Help Wanted: Girl Scout Leaders [Nov. 11]. Buried deep near the end of it was the telling phrase, not- ing an experiment in which women were paid a nominal amount to encour- age them to take the job. Why not? When men volunteer their time, often their companies or businesses under- write it. Men who devote hours to the United Fund, for example, usually come from companies that pay their salaries and volunteer them. No man must choose between a job and doing volunteer work.

title: SAUDI ARABIA ASSAILS OIL COMPANIES IN U.S.
description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia, Nov. 24  Secretary of the Treasury G. William Miller said today that Saudi leaders were annoyed at American oil companies for failing to pass the benefits of lower Saudi prices along to consumers and that they might raise their prices as a result.

title: Interest in Irish Culture Proves Boon to Bookstores
description: I started with a few Irish biographies, Angela Carter said. They quickly sold out, and I immediately began stocking other books on Ireland. It grew from that.

title: What Companies Pay for Pensions
description: Santa Claus doesn't seem likely soon to turn up on anyone's board of directors, but the contributions of major corporations to their employees pension plans appear generally to be growing more generous than they were five or 10 years ago.

title: First the Anger, Then Apathy, Now the Involvement
description: BERKELEY, Calif.  After a long struggle to take control of Berkeley's city government, a coalition of radicals and progressives finally succeeded in April. It was a surprising victory because it came despite the general political apathy that has plagued Berkeley since the turbulence of the late 1960's and early 1970's, when the city became a national symbol of political radicalism.

title: Tough Mike Shayne; Helped Out a Writer
description: SHARON ROBERT TERRALL is in select company: He is one of the few authors who have been able, over the years, actually to earn a living from their books. And, for that distinction, Mr. Terrall owes some thanks to a tough private eye named Mike Shayne.

title: A 2Jury Murder Trial Is Ordered
description: A State Supreme Court justice has ordered that two men accused of a Manhattan murder be tried simultaneously by two juries in a single courtroom.

title: Study Charts Century of Progress to `the Good Life
description: BOSTON, Nov. 24 (AP)  Americans are now leading a good life that their ancestors of a century ago never dreamed of, according to a study by the United states Department of Labor.

title: 10 Weeks on the Job, Leventhal Is a Strong Man in the Middle
description: Nathan Leventhal, one half of the team of Leventhal and Wagner, the top deputies in the Koch Administration, finishes his 10th week tomorrow as the nuts-and-bolts man a streamlined City Hall. While his role has not been public as that of Robert F. Wagner Jr.  who, as deputy mayor for policy and mayoral liaison in health and education, figured in last week's public handwringing over projected deficit in the Board of Education budget  Mr. Leventhal has wrought some subtle changes in the way the business of government is being conducted.

title: Study by House Committee Sees Financing Gap for New Weapons
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (AP) A Congressional report says that Congress would have to double spending on new weapons to pay for those already being built and urged that some programs be halted.

title: Laurie Rolfe Bride Of Gary Helminski
description: The marriage of Laurie Elizabeth Rolfe to Gary John Helminski, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edmund F. Helminski of Bayonne, N.J., took place yesterday in Jamestown, R.I. The Rev. Charles E. Cloughen Jr. performed the ceremony in St. Matthew's Episcopal Church, where the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. James Doster Rolfe of Seattle, were married 35 years ago.

title: At Skating Rinks, the Good Times Roll
description: With rollerskating gaining momentum as a fashionable sport for adults and children alike, owners of roller rinks have begun spending thousands of dollars sprucing up their facilities. And new rinks are opening.

title: ABOUT LONG ISLAND
description: ROSLYN HE WAS used to pizzas from Willis Avenue, and his Grandma Lucy's cooking; getting out meant the Nassau Coliseum or Madison Square Garden.

title: Insuring That You're Not Underinsured
description: ASMITHTOWN homeowner paid $233 in 1973 for a homeowner's insurance policy that, insured the home for $45.000.

title: SPORTS TODAY
description: CROSSCOUNTRY

title: ABOUT CARS
description: HOLIDAY giftbuying for the car buff in the family sometimes takes a rather obvious route  a tape deck or CB radio, for example  but there are any number of interesting and inexpensive items whose only moving parts are their pages, and they shouldn't be overlooked.

title: Oklahoma Beats Nebraska For Berth in Orange Bowl
description: NORMAN, Okla., Nov. 24  For the fourth time in 16 years, Nebraska brought a perfect record into Oklahoma today, only to go away a loser as the Sooners came from behind in the second half to beat the Cornhuskers, 1714, and win the trip to the Orange Bowl as Big Eight Conference champions.

title: Scott Faces Crucial Prison Bout
description: James Scott, whose shaved head, fierce demeanor and running feuds with boxing associations and promoters are rapidly becoming staples of the ring world, faces Alvaro (Yaqui) Lopez in a 10round lightheavyweight bout Saturday in Rahway State Prison.Scott, usually a rather softspoken and articulate fellow, wants nothing more to do with the promoter of the Rahway prison bouts, Murad Muhammad, president of Triangle Productions.Scott, meanwhile, has two hopes for the immediate future. The first is to get on the outside to engage in some bouts and the other is to get a title shot at Victor Galindez, who defends his W.B.A. lightheavyweight title on Friday.

title: News Summary
description: International

title: Parents of Child Who Died of Leukemia Still Press Laetrile Cause
description: OMAHA, Nov. 24 (AP)  Chad Green's parents lost their battle to save their 3-year-old boy from leukemia, but they say they intend to continue another bat- tle, for the use of laetrile in cancer treatment.

title: CALENDARS
description: Motor Sports

title: Yeshivas Prospering In Bergen County
description: ENGLEWOOD

title: Birth
description: AKST

title: Olympic Torch to Go; Through County
description: HE Olympic flame will be carried up Route 9 through the county on Feb. 4 in an Olympic Torch Relay. The team carrying the flame to Lake Placid, N.Y., will spend that night in Peekskill. The torch will be the first in the United States to carry a flame from Olympia, Greece.

title: ANTIIRAN FEELINGS REACH U.S. MOSLEMS
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 24  American hostility toward Iranians has apparently begun to spill over to other Moslems in the United States, including blacks who embrace the Islamic faith.

title: Chief Justice Stays I.C.C. Order On Burlington Northern Refunds
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (UPI)  Chief Justice Warren E. Burger today stayed Government order requiring Burlington Northern Inc. to pay shippers more than $4 million in refunds by Monday.

title: This Time, Stoppard Plays It (Almost) Straight
description: WASHINGTON Tam Stoppard, verbal gymnast, master of the mindbending pun and the literary backflip, whose plays are notorious for standing logic on its head and history on its ear, has put aside his bag of theatrical tricks for a while. Not that the still youthful British playwright doesnt indulge his love of linguistic PingPong in his latest venture, Night and Day, which opens Tuesday at the ANTA with Maggie Smith in the leading role. This time around. however, Mr. Stoppard is playing it relatively straight. In fact, he admits almost sheepishly to having written one of those beginning, middle and end plays with one set and eight characters, including a woman who's falling for somebody.

title: Pope Attacks Political Systems That Subject People to Violence
description: ROME, Nov. 25 (Reuters)  Pope John Paul II today condemned political systems that seek to condition mankind and subject oeoole to violence.

title: ANTHONY P. KURAS
description: SUFFIELD, Conn., Nov. 25 (AP)  Anthony P. Kuras of Suffield, a retired diary and tobacco farmer and former Connecticut State Representative, died Friday in a local convalescent home. He was 78 years old.

title: Second 73 Day Stirs Memory of Summer
description: Not so, Mr. Lowell. Rarer still are nearperfect, New York City days in late November, especially two in a row on a Thanksgiving weekend.

title: Spain's Papers Regain Liberty, But Few Bother to Read Them
description: MADRID, Nov. 25  Freedom of expression arrived a bit before other freedoms in Spain's transition to democracy, as young journalists took advantage of a liberalized 1966 press law and tested the limits of tolerance of the decaying regime of Francisco Franco.

title: Fraser Board Role Riles Critics, Raises Questions
description: Over the last month, Douglas A. Fraser has said it in various ways. But in the current issue of the United Automobile Workers newsletter, Solidarity, he is strident, if not defiant, in describing the novel role he expects to play as a director of the Chrysler Corporation.

title: Edmonton Captures Grey Cup Again
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 25  Is it wideopen football you want?

title: Wilting Nets Lose, 112103
description: RICHFIELD, Ohio, Nov. 25  The secret ingredient that the struggling New Jersey Nets have been seeking for 22 games this young season might be right at Coach Kevin Loughery's side, dressed in street clothes on the bench.

title: When the Police Kill
description: FALMOUTH, Mass.  When Gary Gilmore was shot to death by a firing squad in 1977, he was the first person legally executed in the United States in 10 years. However, in the preceding decade of no courtordered executions, over 6,000 men, women and children ranging in age from 10 to 81 were shot to death by policemen.

title: Cuban Refugee Leader Slain in Union City
description: The director of a Cuban refugee services center, whose moderate stance had apparently prompted a bombing and numerous threats on his life, was slain yesterday, apparently by antiCastro extremists, in a hail of gunfire on a street in downtown Union City, N.J.

title: When Prejudice Changes Its Address
description: WASHINGTON  No one knows what to say about race any more. With organized racism respecting no regional boundaries, it's more difficult to get a handle on the subject. In polite circles, there is a progressive attitude of whites who rightly condemn the Ku Klux Klan but are themselves scared to death of blacks.

title: Pershing Trot Victor
description: MILAN, Italy, Nov. 25 (UPI)  Pershing, a Swedish horse, won the European trotting championship today by finishing first, ahead of The Last Hurrah, in the $90,000 Grand Prix of the Nations.

title: Portuguese President Says Army Will Never Again Resort to Coup
description: LISBON, Nov. 25 (Reuters)  President Antbnio Ramalho Eanes, speaking as Portugal's election campaign entered its final week, said today that the military would never again use force of arms to impose a political solution on the country.

title: McDonald's Raises Nearly All Prices
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 23 (AP)  The McDonald's Corporation, which used a national advertising campaign to announce a 5 cent cut in hamburger and cheeseburger prices last summer, has quietly raised prices on nearly all other products.

title: A Town Christmas Tree in Maine Is Felled by Persistent Vandals
description: MADISON, Me., Nov. 25 (UPI)  Vandals sawed down the town Christmas tree at the base over the weekend, but officials managed to get the 30foot spruce back up again and posted a round-theclock police guard.

title: Obituary 4 -- No Title
description: Deaths

title: Pianist: Jack Winerock
description: WITH one exception, Jack Winerock presented a fairly conventional but musically substantial program at his piano recital in Alice Tully Hall Saturday afternoon. The unusual item was William Albright's Five Chromatic Dances, which was composed in 1978 and received its Nev York premiere at this concert.

title: Article 2  No Title
Intruder Slays West Side Woman
description: Answering the door of her Upper West Side apartment, a 32yearold woman was shot and killed by an intruder and her husband was critically wounded last night in what the police said appeared to be a drugrelated incident. Killed was Edith Allen of 278 West 118th Street who was shot in the face. Her husband, Frank, also 32, was shot in the chest and head. He is in critical condition at Harlem Hospital. The police found drugs and a pistol in the apartment.

title: Outdoors: How the Lost Woodsman Can Find His Way
description: ALTHOUGH being lost in the woods is, at best, an unpleasant experience, thousands of deer hunters contrive to do every year.

title: A Man Kills His Former Fiancee And Himself on a Queens Street
description: A 20yearold woman who lived in Elmhurst, Queens, was killed on a neighborhood street last evening by her former fianc, who then committed suicide by shooting himself in the head with the same weapon. a shotgun, the police said.

title: Pakistan Jet Carrying 151 Crashes In Remote Region of Saudi Arabia
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Monday, Nov. 28  A Boeing 707 owned by Pakistan International Airlines and carrying 151 people crashed in Saudi Arabia today on a flight from Nigeria to Karachi, an airline spokesman said. There was no report of any survivors.

title: Jesuit Official Disciplines a Priest For Outspoken Views on Women
description: The Rev. William J. Callahan, a strong supporter of the ordination of women to the priesthood in the Roman Catholic church, has been ordered to leave his activist community near Washington, D.C., because of his outspoken views.

title: Bridge:
description: CINCINNATI, Nov. 25  The Aces team  composed of Ira Rubin of Paramus, N.J.; Fred Hamilton of Los Angeles, and Bob Wolff and Bob Hamman of Dallas  held a commanding lead going into the final session of the Reisinger boardamatch team championship here tonight at the American Contract Bridge League's Fall Nationals.

title: FrancoArab Bank at Crossroad
description: PARIS  After a decade of harmonious growth, the largest and most successful FrancoArab consortium bank is entering a period of uncertainty over the position it should stake out in the financial world. Both the Arab and French bankers who run the Union de Banques Arabes et Franaises are wondering whether the venture would not benefit from a redefinition of its role and perhaps a restructuring of its membership.

title: Rhode Island Beats UConn, 32, Advancing in N.C.A.A. Soccer
description: In a battle marked by 95 fouls, Rhode Island defeated Connecticut, 32, on penalty kicks yesterday to capture the New England regional of the National Collegiate soccer tournament.

title: Judith Tanzer, Teacher, Bride of Barry Charles Winters
description: Judith Deena Tanzer, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Solomon Tanner, was married at the WaldorfAstoria yesterday to Barry Charles Winters, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harold Winters. Both families are of Fresh Meadows, Queens. Rabbi Charles G. Agin of the Free Synagogue of Flushing, Queens, performed the ceremony.

title: Dividend Meetings
description: Partial list of scheduled meetings for week follows:

title: Deaths
description: MULKEENThomas P., M.D., father of Nancy Mulkeen Leblond and Janet Mulkeen, brother of Anne Mulkeen Marcus. Services were held on November 20.

title: Sports World Specials
description: When Darryl Dawkins made his shot heard round the basketball world the week before last, shattering a backboard with his dunk and leaving the defender, Bill Robinzine of Kansas City, with a cut hand, the gigantic center ror the Philadelphia 76ers heard the awesome effort described in many ways. But none of the descriptions could compare to the one he gave it.

title: Slow Improvement Is Seen in White House Relations With Congress
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25  In the first two weeks of the Iranian crisis, the White House did not consult the Senate leadership. The Senate majority leader, Robert C. Byrd, complained to President Carter, who then ordered daily consultations.

title: Sports Today
description: Seahawks vs. New York Jets, at Seattle. (Television  Channel 7, 9 P.M. Radio  WCBS, 9 P.M.)

title: Ballet: City Troupe In Agon
description: NO the surface, the formal beauty of George Balanchine's more abstract ballets would seem to stand on its own, with the performers the trained and gifted instruments of their execution. But only on the surface, as shown by the New York City Ballet's program on Saturday afternoon at the New York State Theater.

title: The City
description: A group of pet owners, citing reports that dogs have been poisoned with chemicals meant for rats, called on New York City yesterday to cancel its ratkilling program in the parks.

title: Books of The Times
description: WHAT if Dostoyevsky's Underground Man escaped from the Columbia University bookstore, wearing corduroys or blue denim, armed with an icepick, to terrorize the Hilton Hotel and Gramercy Park? What if all the other characters in all the other books in the store escaped with him  Odys seus, Hamlet, Othello, the Count of Monte Cristo, D'Artagnan, Sam Spade, Lafcadio, Mike Hammer, Tarzan, Destry, Michael Corleone, Garp, the fevered brainchildren, the male chauvinist piglets, the existential trashers of Hemingway and Mailer? Would feminism stand a chance?

title: 13 Fly From Vietnam to Singapore
description: SINGAPORE, Nov. 25 (Reuters)  A Vietnamese Air Force pilot and 12 other refugees he flew out of Vietnam aboard a military transport plane were being held in detention here today waiting to hear whether they would be allowed into the United States.

title: Sporting Gear
description: For the amateur football players who don't like to see their games called on account of darkness, a new football, the Flamer, may be worth trying. The Flamer is perforated like a Whiffle Ball and has two batteryoperated bulbs on a rod inside, so that its soft white plastic shell glows in the dark. It can be thrown or carried, though not not punted, and, because it is waterproof, it can also be used in water at the beach. Divers enjoy producing an eerie underwater effect by carrying the ball to the bottom and watching it float slowly upward with its light blazing. The Flamer is available for $10 at Herman's, Woolworth's and F.A.O. Schwarz stores. It is manufactured by Pick Point Enterprises of Mirror Lake, N.H.

title: New York Votes Sought on Chrysler Aid in Congress
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25  Logrolling, the practice of one legislator voting for a measure favored by another in hopes of reciprocity in the future, goes on, everyone agrees, but it is usually done quietly, since there is some odor

title: ABROAD AT HOME Mr. Kissinger's Role
description: BOSTON, Nov. 25  Henry Kissinger has urged the Shah of Iran not to leave the United States unless and until the Carter Administration directly asks him to go. Word of that advice comes from a person intimately involved in the effort to deal with the Shah and the Iranian crisis.

title: CREDIT MARKETS
description: Old habits die hard in the credit markets.

title: Jazz: Peterson's Trumpet
description: IF the legendary New Orleans jazz trumpeter Buddy Bolden blew as brightly and as boldly as Hannibal Marvin Peterson, who led his Sunrise Orchestra at the Public Theater late Friday night, then the stories of Mr. Bolden's playing through a hole in a park fence and being heard for miles are surely true. Like the original Hannibal, Mr. Peterson has spectacular force and stamina, but while there was nothing particularly subtle about that army of elephants, the trumpet-playing Hannibal has more than lung power in his bag of tricks.

title: Dollar Stronger in Tokyo
description: TOKYO, Monday, Nov. 26 (AP)  The dollar opened at 249.50 yen, up from Thursday's 248.375, in foreignexchange trading today. In light early trading, it stayed around 249.5070 yen. Markets were closed Friday, a holiday.

title: Market Place
description: THE complete investor who held stocks, corporate and government debt and real estate would have received his best results from farm land and overthecounter shares during the last generation.

title: Japanese Triumph
description: ISEZAKI, Japan, Nov. 25 (AP)  The Japanese national volleyball team beat the United States national team by 159, 155, 1115, 157 today in the final game of a fourgame exhibition series in Japan. It was the American team's fourth straight defeat.

title: Heir Apparent Of Ali
description: LESS than three years after he took a job as a professional fist fighter, 23yearold Sugar Ray Leonard had earned something like $1 million. But by the end of this week it will be something like $2 million. If Ray Charles Leonard has a proper sense of the fitness of things, he will pause on his way to the bank, face Mecca, and make obeisance to Muhammad.

title: Satellite Photograph
Washington Watch
description: WASHINGTON THE White House is considering issuing a statement of reassurance to foreign investors that would emphasize the unusual conditions that led to the freezing of Iran's assets.

title: Sal Alaimo, a Sales Aide, Marries Susan D. Chiesa
description: Susan Denise Chiesa, daughter of Mr and Mrs. John Chiesa of the Bronx, was married there yesterday afternoon to Sal Louis Alaimo, son of Mr. and Mrs. Louis Alaimo of Englewood Cliffs. N.J.

title: Survey Finds Big Rise in People Living Alone or Without Family
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 (UPI)  One of every four households in America consists of a person living alone or with an unrelated person, an increase of 66 percent in such arrangements since 1970, the Census Bureau reported today.

title: Condominium Blaze Fatal to 4
description: HUNTINGTON BEACH, Calif., Nov. 25 (AP)  A fire that started in the downstairs part of a condominium today swept up a stairway and killed three sleeping children and a teenager, the authorities said. Another child who had been sleeping downstairs ran up to awaken his parents, but because of the intense heat the parents were unable to reach the victims, officials said. The dead were identified as Dawn Marie Clarke, 7 years old; her sister, Carol Elizabeth, 2; her brother, Robert, 4, and their cousin, Dawn Michelle McMillan, 18.

title: Regan Charles New York City Failed To Acton Recommendations in Audits
description: State Comptroller Edward V. Regan has charged that New York City officials have not been implementing the recommendations of outside audits.

title: Advertising
description: IN this age of magazine specialization, an audience of special interest to fledgling publishers is the affluent reader. Magazine after magazine comes off the drawing boards, one slicker than the next but each almost interchangeable in editorial content. They seek the coffee tables of the rich.

title: Car Makers Scrambling For Sales
description: DETROIT, Nov. 25  The American automobile companies, in the midst of a sales slump that began last spring and shows little prospect of improving, are casting about for something to lure buyers back into showrooms, with the possibilities said to include a rush to conversion of plants to produce smaller cars and early introduction of 1981 models.

title: Airport Security Studied After Attempted Piracy
description: EL PASO, Nov.25 (UPI)  Airline officials said today that they could not explain how a teenager got through airport security with the large knife he used to commandeer a jetliner with 71 persons aboard.

title: Around the Nation
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Nov. 25 (AP)  Richard M. Nixon hosted a $1,000perperson farewell brunch at his Casa Pacifica estate today in an expression of thanks to longtime supporters before he moves to New York City.

title: Radio
description: 78 A.M., WNCN. Marches, C.P.E. Bach; March in G minor, Weber; Sicilano, Francoeur; Rhapsody Overture, Nielsen; Fantasia in D minor, Bach.

title: Israel Gives Up an Oilfield to Egypt In Biggest Sacrifice for Treaty Yet
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 25  Israel gave up the Alma oilfield in the Gulf of Suez to Egypt today, its most serious sacrifice so far in carrying out their peace treaty.

title: News Summary
description: An urgent meeting of the Security Council was called by Secretary General Kurt Waldheim of the United Nations to take up the Iranian crisis. He said the dispute could have disastrous consequences for the entire world. Mr. Waldheim said: I don't know how the governments will react to this proposal, which, he stressed, was made entirely on his own initiative. It was not yet known when the Council would meet. [Page A1, Column 6.]

title: Trojans Regain Bowl
description: Southern California established something of a modern college football record Saturday, becoming the only team to qualify for a major bowl twice in one season. Such is the nature of this rather odd football season, in which good, average and mediocre teams are going to postseason games.

title: RapidAmerican Extending Offer
description: The RapidAmerican Corporation says it is extending to Friday its offer to exchange a new series of $3 preferred stock for common shares and convertible preferred shares.

title: The Waldorf Hysteria: Rooms Are Misplaced And Telephones Fail
description: It was billed as Dimension Feature Package 9, a $2 million computerized telephone system that was put into operation at the WaldorfAstoria Hotel in the wee hours of Saturday morning.

title: Classen's Family and Manager Blame Nobody for Ring Injury
description: Upstairs on the seventh floor of the East Wing of the Bellevue Hospital Center, where Willie Classen still lay immobile under sedation yesterday in the intensivecare unit, his wife and mother and sister sat in the aseptic waiting room trying to comfort one another.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: 4Year Dispute Over Free Abortion Is Going Into Federal Courts Again
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25  The fouryear controversy over free abortions, settled temporarily again in Congress, is about to unfold further in the courts.

title: Amy R. Harris Married To Dr. David M. Pollack
description: Amy Rachel Harris, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Matthew N. Harris of Great Neck, L.I., was married at noon yesterday to Dr. David Mark Pollack, son of Mr. and Mrs. Irving J. Pollack of Cedarhurst, L.I. Rabbis Carl Wolkin and Mordecai Waxman officiated in Temple Israel of Great Neck. Cantor Benjamin Siegel assisted.

title: Colombian Earthquake Toll Is 41, Aides Say, but Could Go Higher
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Nov. 25 (Reuters)  At least 91 people were killed and hundreds injured by an earthquake that struck Colombia Friday, but the final death toll could be as high as 60, civil defense spokesmen said today.

title: A Wrong Nuclear TimeOut
description: Proposals for a nuclear moratorium are proliferating. Two Democratic Presidential candidates, several Congressmen and petition groups in at least four states are calling for a halt in the construction or operation of new reactors. Tomorrow, the House of Representatives is scheduled to vote on a moratorium proposal for the first time. But virtually all the proposals under consideration are defective. They either fail to specify what is to be accomplished during the moratorium or they set forth goals that seem arbitrary or disingenuous. A moratorium may be needed, but no sensible version has yet been designed.

title: World News Briefs
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Nov. 25 (Reuters) Bolivia's interim President, Lydia Gueiler Tejada, appointed a new army chief today in an effort to end a revolt by officers opposed to the military leadership.

title: A New Generation Is Discovered By Peace Corps Grandparents
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (UPI)  The Peace Corps, which had fallen into relative obscurity in recent years, is beginning to attract people from a whole new generation  older American men and women who have chosen early retirement.

title: Yield of 10% Expected On 5-Year U.S. Notes
description: The Treasury is scheduled to sell five-and-a-half-year notes tomorrow, and the securities are expected to yield about 10 percent.

title: Barefoot Ramsey Convinces the Jets
description: On the Jets, the placekickers come and go but the punter, Chuck Ramsey, stays. I guess, says Ramsey in a Tennessee drawl, using a plastic cup to get rid of some tobacco juice, you could say I'm the secondbest punter in New York City.

title: Obituary 9 -- No Title
description: Alfred Wegener, a studio and portrait photographer for The New York Times for 36 years, died Saturday of cancer. He was 69 years old.

title: A New Fair Lady Delights London Theatergoers
description: LONDON, Nov. 25  A dazzling new Eliza Doolittle has come to the West End of London, delighting the critics and sending one happy houseful after another out into the cold night humming about the rain in Spain.

title: Planners, Citing Population Rise In Chinatown, Urge Help by City
description: New York City's Chinese population, currently estimated at 135,000 or more, will continue to rise and to place increased pressure on housing and business accommodations in Chinatown, municipal planners predicted yesterday.

title: Mexican Crude Sets a Record
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 25 (UPI) Mexico's daily production of crude oil has reached a record 1.8 million barrels a day, according to an announcement by the state oil agency, Petrleos Mexicanos.

title: U.S. Student Loans Said To Be Approved in Error
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Nov. 25 (AP)  A bureaucractic slipup caused the Federal Government to commit $2.7 million in student loans to a company that was under investigation for cheating on the loan program, The Kansas City Star reported today.

title: GOING OUT
description: NIGHT AND DAY Elizabeth Hardwick, author of the novel, Sleepless Nights, will read from her works tonight at the uptown Poetry Center, sharing the program with Francine Du Plessix Gray, author of Lovers and Tyrants. The place is the 92d Street Y, near Lexington Avenue. Tickets are $4. Time: 8 o'clock.

title: PERIL TO PEACE SEEN
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 25  Secretary General Kurt Waldheim of the United Nations today requested an urgent meeting of the Security Council to deal with the Iranian crisis.

title: BUSINESS
description: Treasury Secretary Miller failed to get Saudi Arabian assurances on oil production or price levels during his twoday stay in Ryadh. The leading oil exporter appeared to be waiting on the out. come of next month's OPEC meeting in Caracas before making any commitments. [Page D1.]

title: Article 1 -- No Title
Deborah Joy Demos, C.P.A., Wed to Dr. Philip Efthimion
description: The St. George Greek Orthodox Church in Piscataway, N.J., was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Deborah Joy Demos, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George C.

title: Pakistan to Try Reporter For His False Accounts
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, Nov. 25 (Reuters)  Salamat Ali, a correspondent of the Far Eastern Economic Review, was charged today with violating martiallaw regulations by allegedly presenting a false picture of Pakistan in the weekly magazine based in Hong Kong.

title: Deaths
description: ZOMBSLucy (nee Bonynge), In New Milford, Ccnn on Nov 24, 1979 of Lake Shore Road (The inn), Warren, Conn., age 84. There will be a memorial service at The inn on Lake Waramaug on Wednesday, Nov 28 at 11AM. in lieu of flowers, friends may make donations to the Warren Congregational Church, Warren, Conn.

title: Bruins Triumph, 42, Over the Canadiens
description: BOSTON, Nov. 25 (AP)  Rick Smith's bouncing shot from the blue line late in the first period broke a 22 tie tonight and sent the Boston Bruins to a 42 victory over the Montreal Canadiens.

title: HOSTAGES' FATE IS KEY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25  The United States gave strong backing tonight to the urgent call for a Security Council meeting on the Iranian crisis in the expectation that a resolution would be adopted insisting on the release of American hostages in Teheran.

title: Carter Gets Lead in Race For Support in New York
description: With many key New York Democrats scheduled to announce their endorsement of President Carter today and tomorrow, the President has taken a substantial lead in the competition for the support of prominent Democrats in a state generally considered second only to Massachusetts as a political power base for Senator Edward M. Kennedy.

title: Copeland of Knicks Is Defying the Odds
description: The gamblers on Seventh Avenue in the heart of the Garment District, where Knick fans can be found arguing and wagering on most anything, would have given 1001 odds two months ago against Hollis Copeland's chances of making New York's 11man roster. The odds probably would have been steeper that he would still be on the team after 21 games, and the possibility of his surviving the entire National Basketball Association season would have been off the board.

title: Korean Uranium Purchase
description: TORONTO, Nov. 25 (Reuters)  Three Canadian companies said they had agreed to supply the Korea Electric Company with seven million pounds of uranium oxide over 11 years.

title: Obituary 7 -- No Title
description: ANNOUNCEMENTS OF DEATHS MAY BE TELEPHONED TO 354.3900 UNTIL 5:30 P.M. FOR WEEKDAY EDITIONS. UNTIL 2:30 P.M. ON SATURDAY FOR SUNDAY EDITION. IN REGIONAL OFFICES 9:00 A,M. TO 4:30 P.M. MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY; NEW JERSEY (201) MARKET 33900; WESTCHESTER CO. AND NORTHERN NEW YORK STATE COUNTIES (914) WHITE PLAINS 95300; NASSAU CO. (516) 7470500; SUFFOLK CO. (516) 6891800; CONNECTICUT (203) 3487787.

title: Giants Topple Redskins, l46
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Nov. 25  Again today, Billy Taylor did not start at halfback for the Giants, but he was exhausted, limping and happy by the time he finished. He finished with 26 carries for 126 yards, including 75 on a 7minute43second, 79yard drive to his fourthquarter touchdown that clinched a 146 victory over the Washington Redskins.

title: PlaceKickers: It's Do or Dig In Seconds
description: THE climate and the names change, but the scene is much the same on the practice fields of the 28 National Football League teams across the country. From end zone to end zone the turf is alive with grunting linemen, scampering halfbacks and passers taking their drops, punctuated by coaches whistles and the thwack of pad meeting pad. Off to the side stands a moody man, smaller than his teammates and less well paid, often with the number 1 on his jersey.

title: Article 4 -- No Title
Saudis Withhold Oil Decision
description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia, Nov. 25  Treasury Secretary G. William Miller wound up two days of meetings with top Saudi Arabian officials today with the Saudis emerging uncommitted on the key questions of how much oil they would produce next year and how much they would charge for it.

title: Laureine Knight, Lawyer, Is a Bride
description: Laureine Knight, a lawyer with CBS Inc. in New York, and David Roy Greenbaum, an associate with the New York law firm of Weil, Gotshal & Manges, were married yesterday afternoon at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Murray M. Knight of Bronxville, N.Y. The ceremony was performed by Rabbi Solomon Sternstein, assisted by Cantor Benjamin Belfer. The bridegroom's parents are Mr. and Mrs. Walter Greenbaum of Rockville Centre, L.I.

title: Deaths
description: ANDREWSMildred Marks. Loving mother of Adrienne Marks. Loving daughter of Sophie Feinstein. Beloved sister of Jean Glickstein and Rose Schwarzapfel. Services Monday 11:45AM The Riverside, 76 St. and Amsterdam Ave.

title: Ice Is Big Enemy in Alaskan Oil Search
description: ANCHORAGE, Nov. 25 (AP)  Conservationists and Eskimos, concerned that oil wells in the Arctic pack ice could jeopardize the existence of the bowhead whale, have sued in Federal courts to block or limit the sale of drilling rights in the waters off the North Slope.

title: Courtship of Hollywood and Novelists Moves Closer to Marriage
description: LOS ANGELES

title: How Oil Industry Cash Is Spent
description: So far this year, the five largest American oil companies have earned a record $7.9 billion in profits, or 75 percent more than they made in the first three quarters of 1978. At the same time, according to their financial reports, they have poured $10.1 billion back into their businesses, roughly two thirds of which went toward finding and developing new energy supplies.

title: Pope's Trip to Turkey Aims At Closer Ties to Orthodox
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, Nov. 25  Pope John Paul II's visit to Turkey this week will mark the beginning of a theological dialogue for the unity of the Roman Catholic Church and the Eastern Orthodox Church, formally separated since the schism in 1054.

title: Khomeini Goals Supported By Much of the Middle Class
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Nov. 25  A very long time ago, when he began his selfimposed exile in France, Assadi Khosrow had anticipated what it would be like in Iran after the inevitable revolution against Shah Mohammed Riza Pahlevi.

title: Capitals 2, Nordiques 2
description: QUEBEC, Nov. 25 (UPI)  Real Cloutier scored his 16th goal of the season at 4:0Z of the third period tonight and gave the Quebec Nordiques a 22 tie with the Washington Capitals.

title: Black Hawks 6, Blues 3
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 25 (AP)  Thirdperiod goals by Grant Mulvey, Dave Logan and Stan Mikita lifted the Chicago Black Hawks to a 63 victory over the St. Louis Blues tonight.

title: Events Today
description: METROPOLITAN OPERA, Tchaikovsky's Eugene Onegin,8.

title: Recital: Elly Ameling Sings Some Rare Pieces
description: IT would not be quite accurate to say that Elly Ameling held court yesterday afternoon in Alice Tully Hall  that is too grandiose a description for a singer of such refreshing musical spontaneity and personable charm. The Dutch soprano did, however, keep her audience in thrall from first note to last, demonstrating in no uncertain terms why so many people reckon her to be today's leading exponent of art songs.

title: Bruised Passenger Tells of Screams As Hotel Elevator Plunged 7 Floors
description: The elevator started falling faster and faster. Somebody said, I don't think we're going to make it. Everybody was screaming. Then bump we stopped and then bump again. The next thing I knew there were people trying to open the elevator door to get us out.

title: Tool Orders Up 36% For October
description: New orders for machine tools in October soared 36 percent from the yearearlier level, aided by an exceptionally large advance in foreign orders. Shipments and backlogs also increased during the month, the National Machine Tool Builders Association reported over the weekend.

title: Pincay: Good Day At Big A
description: Laffit Pincay continued his winning ways yesterday after being told at the start of the program that he had been found blameless for the disqualification of Lothian, a 2yearold he had ridden Saturday.

title: At 74, a Lifelong Achiever Has a New Job
description: Ask Helen Buttenwieser how she has managed to have a highpowered legal career, raise four children, devote countless hours to volunteer work and still be married to the same man after 50 years, and she is likely to break into a wry grin and tell you about the time she fell asleep while walking down a Manhattan street.

title: Recital: Daunoras, Bass
description: UNLIKE most of the Soviet musicians appearing in New York these days, Vaclovas Daunoras, heard Saturday night at Carnegie Recital Hall, is not an emigrant but a visitor. A bass, Mr. Daunoras is a member of the Lithuanian State Opera in Vilnius. He won a bronze medal in the 1966 Tchaikovsky Competition, and once studied at La Scala, where he has sung Sparafucile in Rigoletto and the High Priest in Idomeneo.

title: Kaunda Says South Africans Plot to Isolate Zambia
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, Nov. 25  President Kenneth D. Kaunda chose today to forgo a conference in Tanzania of leaders of the socalled frontline nations and black nationalists of Zimbabwe Rhodesia to address his own Cabinet members and party chiefs. He all but ignored the Zimbabwe Rhodesia question and spoke of South Africa as his country's main concern.

title: Rock: Forbert Moves Up
description: STEVE FORBERT and Carolyne Mas launched their careers playing the New York clubs, so their performances at the Palladium Saturday night were, in a sense, a test. Would the rapport both artists have enjoyed with local club audiences survive in a theater setting? Would their stage presence still seem as impressive on a larger stage? Would their material be strong enough to make for a really satisfying show?

title: Iran's Oil Minister Vows Boycott of Hostile Lands
description: TEHERAN, Nov. 25 (Reuters)  Iran's Oil Minister, Ali Akbar Moinfar, said an oil boycott would be imposed on countries hostile to Iran, the official Pars press agency reported today.

title: Chess:
description: The Najdorf Sicilian, Poisoned Pawn Variation  the old favorite of Bobby Fischer, the former world champion  is still in business despite the most strenuous efforts to crack it. This savage, provocative defense yielded the Hungarian grandmaster Lajos Portisch two and a half points out of three trials in the Rio de Janeiro Interzonal Tournament.

title: The Region
description: ORANGETOWN, N.Y.  An attendant at the Rockland Psychiatric Center has been arrested on a charge that he raped a severely retarded teenage patient, the police said.

title: Blacks Sue Florida Town to Gain Better Services
description: OKEECHOBEE, Fla., Nov. 25 (AP)  Black residents have filed a lawsuit in an attempt to force this central Florida town to pave streets, unclog drainage ditches and stop flooding in black neighborhoods before it spends any more money on white neighborhoods.

title: 80,000 in Japan See Notre Dame Win
description: TOKYO, Nov. 25 (AP)  Vagas Ferguson scored three touchdowns for Notre Dame before a rainsoaked but enthusiastic Japanese crowd of about 80,000 today as the Fighting Irish defeated Miami, 4015, in a college football game.

title: Heiden Leads Sweep In Speed Skating
description: WEST BERLIN, Nov. 25 (AP)  Eric Heiden led an American sweep of the first three places today in men's competition at a twoday international speedskating competition.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY

title: De Gustibus Epicure: What He Is And What He Isn't
description: A very young man with a considerable enthusiasm for food, wine and the other good things of life recently asked me whether I, as a professional food writer, would prefer to be referred to as a gourmet, an epicure, a gastronome or a connoisseur. I quickly assured him that I dislike labels and would with a professional interest in cooking and the good life.

title: The U.N. Today
description: Meets at 10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M. on Palestinian matters.

title: Steelers Stop Browns, 3330
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 25  Matt Bahr, a rookie placekicker, booted a 37yard field goal with nine seconds remaining in overtime to give the Pittsburgh Steelers a hardearned victory today over the Cleveland Browns, 3330, in a game that saw 82 passes attempted and 53 completed, for 697 yards.

title: Food Getting Into Cambodia Is Still Far Below Need
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 25  The international campaign to feed faminestricken Cambodia through the Vietnamesesupported Government in Phnom Penh has delivered in the first three months of operation an amount of food sufficient to prevent starvation for 10 days.

title: Tanker Blaze Resists Firemen
description: GALVESTON, Tex., Nov. 25 (AP)  Coast Guard aircraft monitored a 25dayold fire aboard a leaking oil tanker in the Gulf of Mexico today after firefighters gave up a second attempt to extinguish the blaze.

title: Obituary 2 -- No Title
description: Deaths

title: Dance: Bournonville Festival Opens in Denmark
description: CPENHAGEN, Nov. 25  August Bournonville, Denmark's great choreographer of the Romantic ballet, died on Nov. 30, 1879. Last night at the Royal Theater, the Royal Danish Ballet opened an extraordinary weeklong festival in honor of the Bournonville centenary.

title: Quebec Delays Asbestos Move
description: QUEBEC, Nov. 25 (Reuters)  The resources minister of Quebec said this weekend that the provincial government's expropriation of the Asbestos Corporation would not take place until January at the earliest.

title: N.Y.U., Bucking National Trend, Expands Its Classes and Faculty
description: New York University, with the financial crisis that five years ago was threatening its existence now behind it, has become one of the few major universities in the country seeking to expand its arts and sciences program and to hire a substantial number of new young faculty members.

title: ESSAY A Time For Daring
description: WASHINGTON  Calculated delay is the phrase chosen by one editorialist to praise the frustrated fingerwagging of the Carter Administration, which refuses to acknowledge that this nation is being warred upon. In the 19th century, the favorite euphemisms were masterly inactivity and disciplined inaction.

title: Frustrated Rangers Beaten by Leafs, 43
description: Being a Ranger watcher lately is something like going to the same Broadway show until you have memorized the script. You know just what will happen, what will be said, and who will say it.

title: 13% Rise in Cost Found In Oil Service Contracts
description: The average cost of oil burner service contracts has gone up $6.03 13 percent  in the two months since September from $44.88 to $50.91 a year, according to a survey released yesterday by Robert Abrams, New York State Attorney General, and Richard Kessel, a Long Island consumer advocate.

title: At Garment Factory on Coast, a Family Atmosphere
description: SAN GABRIEL, Calif.  The telephone rings and Gerta Slates, a stylish, middleaged woman, answers in a businesslike manner, Dattilo. Then she smiles and looks around the garment factory where a dozen women produce the expensive, fashionable suits and dresses that carry the Dattilo label. It's Edward's mother. She is amused. Some things never change.

title: Public TV Asks State to Double Funds
description: New York State's nine public television stations, promising substantial increases in educational programming, have asked the Legislature to double the amount of the state's contribution to noncommercial broadcasting in its budget for the 1981 fiscal year.

title: Whalers 4, Flames 2
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Nov. 25 (UPI)  Mike Rogers scored a goal and added an assist tonight to lead the Hartford Whalers to a 42 victory over the Atlanta Flames.

title: Sabres 6, North Stars 2
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 25 (UPI)  Craig Ramsay scored two goals and added an assist tonight as he led the Buffalo Sabres to a 62 victory over the Minnesota North Stars. Ramsay's linemates, Don Luce and John Gould, each scored to give the line four goals for the night.

title: A Look At the Wheels of Chance
description: It is welcome news that New Jersey's Casino Control Commission will hold hearings in January to evaluate the impact of casino gambling in Atlantic City. The hearings may yield important lessons for New Jersey and other states as well.

title: A Guide to Maps and Books
description: There are government topographic maps available for most of the United States, and they may be obtained in many sporting goods stores and bookstores.

title: Panel Will Study Jersey's Courts In Move to Cut Operating Costs
description: TRENTON, Nov. 25 (AP)  A special committee will be appointed by the State Supreme Court to improve administration and lower the cost of operating the courts in New Jersey, Chief Justice Robert N. Wilentz said today.

title: Notes on People
description: How a Variety of Celebrities Decline the Phrase I Do

title: Letter: On School Budget Deficits
description: Since when has consultation meant surrender'? In its editorial of Nov. 19, The Times concluded that because the New York City Board of Education agreed to listen to the ideas of the City Council and the Board of Estimate concerning our budget deficit, we have surrendered our responsibilities as an independent agency.

title: Gunmen Loot East Side Hotel of $100,000
description: Five welldressed robbers, one of them a guest at an Upper East Side hotel, held nine other guests and employees of the hotel at gunpoint for nearly an hour early yesterday morning while looting the hotel's safe deposit boxes of at least $100,000 in cash and jewelry.

title: 2 Miners Killed in Hungary
description: BUDAPEST, Nov. 25 (Reuters)  Two coal miners were killed yesterday when a shaft collapsed in Tatabanya, 30 miles west of Budapest, the M.T.I. press agency said today. Two other miners were rescued.

title: Obituary 10 -- No Title
description: PORTSMOUTH, N.H., Nov. 25 (AP)  Secret Service agents are assisting in the investigation of an incident in which a woman and two men held three persons hostage for nine hours, the police said today. The three alleged kidnappers demanded to speak to President Carter about the crisis in Iran.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: LONDON, Nov. 25 (AP)  PIans for a British rugby tour of South Africa next summer, which critics say might lead to Britain's ouster from the Olympics, were delayed today after four rugby unions met but came to no decision.

title: Miss Navratilova Beats Mrs. Lloyd
description: BRIGHTON, England, Nov. 25 (AP)  Martina Navratilova beat Chris Evert Lloyd, 63, 63, in the final of a $110,000 women's tennis tournament today, winning 12 of the last 14 points of the match.

title: Crowd Seizes a Suspect After Subway Assault
description: Led by a 30yearold Manhattan actor, a group of enraged subway riders seized an assault suspect last night, moments after he allegedly pushed a man onto the tracks at the Union Square Station.

title: Rutgers Overwhelms Louisville, 317
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Nov. 25 (AP) Albert Ray scored two touchdowns and rushed for 183 yards as Rutgers rallied for 28 secondhalf points to defeat Louisville, 317, today.

title: Kissinger Pressure Assailed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 (UPI)  A former American diplomat said today that the United States might have refused to admit the deposed Shah Mohammed Riza Pahlevi of Iran, had it not been for the enormously obnoxious pressures of a group including Henry A. Kissinger, the former Secretary of State.

title: Commodities
description: STILL another chapter in the scandaIridden commodity options business unfolded last week as the Government, under intense pressure from certain members of Congress, was forced to delay its ban on the sale of socalled leverage contracts, a form of option.

title: Rodin Sale Sets Records For Prices and Quantity
description: MONTE CARLO, Monaco, Nov. 25  The largest group of sculptures by Auguste Rodin to be sold at one time went on the block here today, bringing record prices and adding to the reputation of this resort as Europe's fastestgrowing art market.

title: Bills Upset Patriots in Overtime, 1613
description: Anyone looking for an example of the sharp reversals of form that have been on display during this National Football League season need only check the fate of the New England Patriots in their last three games.

title: 8 Arrests in Philadelphia Protest
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 25 (AP)  Eight persons were arrested early today as the authorities ended a 12day occupation of Harrity Elementary School by parents demanding that the principal be replaced.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: The Others Were No Fluke
description: AFTER their five previous victories this season, the Giants were understandably jubilant, but after yesterday's 146 triumph over the Washington Redskins, they were smiling quietly, almost smugly.

title: Rhodesia Rebels Balk at Meeting TrucePlan Deadline
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, Nov. 25 (Reuters)  The two leaders of the Patriotic Front guerrilla alliance refused today to meet Britain's deadline for a reply to ceasefire proposals for Zimbabwe Rhodesia.

title: Question Box
description: QUESTION: In the National Hockey League, defensive players in front of the net often push around offensive players who are not in possession of the puck. According to the rules, inteference should be called, but it rarely is. Why?

title: Prices Up in Denmark
description: COPENHAGEN, Nov. 25 (Reuters)  Denmark's wholesale price index rose 1.2 percent in October after rising 1.6 percent in September, the Statistics Bureau said. That means that last month's wholesale prices were 13.1 percent higher than in October 1978, compared with a yearto year increase of 11.8 percent in September.

title: Passaic Talks of Layoffs in Fiscal Crisis
description: PASSAIC, N.J., Nov. 25  Faced with an $800,000 budget shortfall, the Mayor and top administration officials of Passaic have threatened to lay off themselves and 800 city employees to draw state unemployment compensation. Unemployment in this city of 56,000 already stands at 12 percent.

title: Guaranteeing Chrysler's Fat Paychecks
description: Alfred Kahn, the Administration's chief inflation fighter, thinks Chrysler's settlement with the United Auto Workers is outrageous, a clear violation of the President's wage guidelines at a time when both Chrysler and its union are begging for Government aid. Auto Worker President Douglas Fraser disagrees. He thinks that the only thing outrageous in the entire matter is the conduct of Mr. Kahn. We're with Mr. Kahn.

title: 100 Stranded Tourists Find Way Out of Town
