title: World Court Is the U.N.'s Principal Judicial Organ
description: The International Court of Justice, to which the United States turned yesterday in the Iranian crisis, is the main judicial organ of the United Nations.

title: THOMAS LeBOUTILLIER
description: Thomas LeBoutillier, a retired test pilot for Grumman Aircraft Engineering Corporation, died Wednesday morning of a heart attack while playing golf at the Lyford Cay Club at Nassau, the Bahamas. He was 65 years old and lived in Old Westbury, L.I.

title: Crisis Might Keep Carter Off a FundRaising Tour
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29  With little indication of an early break in the crisis in Iran, it appears likely that President Carter will skip the fundraising tour that was to kick off his reelection campaign next week, White House officials said today.

title: F.C.C. to Broaden Scope Of Mobile Phone System
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 (AP)  A decision today by the Federal Communications Commission could make available thousands of additional communications channels, allowing an increase in the number of car telephones, according to agency officials.

title: In Teheran, Students Speak Out And Processions Fill the Streets
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Nov. 29  In a small concrete room in the United States Embassy compound, decorated now with posters of Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini, two of the leaders of the 25dayold occupation gave answers they had prepared in committee to written questions.

title: Opera: Assertive Aida
description: EVERY once in a while, one can enjoy a performance of Aida that is characterized more by broad, assertive singing than by subtle vocalization, and that was pretty much the nature of the Metropolitan Opera's performance of Verdi's Egyptian fantasy on Wednesday night.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 29  The United States Steel Corporation, which earlier this week announced it would close 15 plants and mills and lay off 13,000 workers, today announced increased prices for certain steel mill products effective Jan. 1.

title: Single Coin Is Sold for Record $725,000
description: The record price paid for a single coin was set late yesterday when Martin Monas, acting as agent for an unidentified collector, paid $725,000 for a Brasher doubloon that was part of the Garrett Collection held by Johns Hopkins University of Baltimore.

title: Pope Urges Turkish Christians to Work With Moslems
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, Nov. 29  Pope John Paul II appealed today for collaboration between Christians and Moslems and called on Christians to recognize the moral and religious values that Christianity and Islam have in common.

title: 4,000 on L.I. Line Cortege Route for Slain Marine
description: PORT JEFFERSON, L.I., Nov. 29 About 4,000 people stood along roads here to watch the funeral procession today of Cpl. Steven J. Crowley, the 20yearold marine who was killed last week defending the American Embassy in Pakistan.

title: New Talent Is Thriving on Stages All Over Town
description: EVERY season The Young Actress comes to New York, eager and hopeful about her chance for success in the theater. She is here to prove the truth behind the clich: someone has to fill the role of star. The actress moves in with friends or tries to find an inexpensive hotel room, makes copies of her rsum  perhaps slightly embellishing her outoftown credits  and prints up her 8 by 10 glossies.

title: Retail Sales Rises Called Slow Start for Christmas
description: The nation's largest retailers yesterday reported higher sales in November than a year before, but the percentage gains were mostly lower than those for the year todate, indicating a slow start for the strategic Christmas selling season, which began a week ago, industry analysts said.

title: Tribunal of U.N. Is Asked to Order
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29  The United States asked the International Court of Justice today to order Iran to release the American hostages who have been held for 26 days in the United States Embassy in Teheran.

title: Iranian Couple Arrested in Jersey And Charged With Having Opium
description: HACKENSACK, N.J.  An Iranian couple whose visas had expired were arrested yesterday at their home in Franklin Lakes, N.J., and charged with possession of 6.5 ounces of opium that had arrived in a package with the day's mail, authorities said.

title: At the Movies
description: THE scene was the General Film Studio near the docks on West 19th Street. On a sound stage, where Brian De Palma's Dressed to Kill is in production, a set representing a psychiatrist's office on East 70th Street has been built.

title: and a Screen Tribute To Ellington Tonight
description: The first full evening presentation of Duke Ellington's appearances on film will be presented tonight at 8:30 at Columbia University's Wollman Auditorium, Broadway at 115th Street, by David Chertok, who has one of the three largest known jazzfilm collections in the world.

title: Senators Warned of Terrorist Acts
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29  Senate members were warned today to take precautions against possible attacks by religious fanatics and nationalist terrorists.

title: President's TV Request Is Sidetracked by Court
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29  The bid by the CarterMondale committee to buy 30 minutes of television network air time next week was sidetracked today when the United States Court of Appeals issued a stay of an order by the Federal Communications Commission.

title: Restaurants
description: IN the last seven or eight years, Indian food has come to be one of our more fashionable cuisines, served in handsomely decorated, expensive restaurants that are far cries from the murky, tacky holesinthewall we usually had to rely on before that time. Raga, on West 48th Street, was not the first of the stylish and elegant Indian restaurants, but since it opened in January 1977, its tone has proven to be the most consistent.

title: Party Chiefs Vow Unity Behind Carter Over Iran
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 (AP)  The chairmen of the Democratic and Republican parties pledged united support today for President Carter in the crisis over Iran's holding of American hostages.

title: Cays Down Knicks On Layup by Smith
description: RICHFIELD, Ohio, Nov. 29  A layup at the buzzer by Randy Smith gave the Cleveland Cavaliers a 117115 victory tonight over the Knicks, who wasted a sparkling rally. New York had trailed by 9 points with 4 minutes 50 seconds left to play.

title: President Sends His Women Kin To the Hustings
description: MANCHESTER, N.H., Nov. 29  The women of Jimmy Carter's campaign his wife, mother and daughterinlaw, and his running mate's mate  swept through New Hampshire hamlets today in a blitz of 17 separate kaffeeklatsches.

title: New York Readies Drive For Full Count in Census
description: Extraordinary steps were announced yesterday to prevent a significantly low count of New York City residents in the 1980 census and thus avoid a possible reduction of government aid to the city and a cut in its representation in Congress and the Legislature.

title: St. Nicholas Days At Van Cortlandt Mansion
description: The Bronx Arts Ensemble and Singers will perform for the fifth annual St. Nicholas Day Festival at Van Cortlandt Mansion, near Broadway and 246th Street, tomorrow and Sunday at 1:30 and 3 P.M.

title: Bonn Disavows Morgan Move
description: BONN, Nov. 29 (UPI)  West German officials said today that their Government was not involved in the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company's move yesterday to freeze Iran's stake in Fried. Krupp G.m.b.H. and expressed regret that they were not informed of the action.

title: For Children
description: DIE FLEDERMAUS, Strauss operetta, sung in English, Saturday at 7:30 P.M. and Sunday at 2:30 P.M. at Amato Opera Theater, 319 Bowery. Children and the elderly, S4: adults, 55. Reservations: 2288200.

title: Concern Over Koch Delays
description: Mayor Koch, who shook up his administration last August to get more done faster, has not acted as he promised he would on a number of key appointments and actions that he said then were top priorities.
